loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion T. is from the town of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Concepcion is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Concepcion raises pigs for sale. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Concepcion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC.

Concepcion is now requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Concepcion from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor, 26 years old, is from the village of Casilagan Ilagan, Isabela. He and his wife, Fely, have a three-month-old daughter named Cecille Hyacinth.

As head of the family, Melchor has lots of plans. He and his wife joined hands to begin their "rolling store" business. They rent a stall where they sell different snacks and children's drinks, since they are located near the elementary school. At present, Melchor manages their store on his own, since his wife just gave birth and needs to take care of their baby.

Melchor is planning to sell more goods and additionally to add some school supplies. To this end, he is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 6,000 as additional capital. His dream is for their business to grow and to be able to give his family a comfortable standard of living.

He believes that by focusing on the business, he and his family can have a more progressive life.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is from the town of Aloran. She is 48 years old. Erlinda is married and has seven grown children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixteenth loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia A. owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store, selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Amalia has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita M.'s main source of income comes from making and selling a variety of food products in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Sherlita has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Sherlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sherlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase inventory and for working capital.

Sherlita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

They are from the village of Capucao, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Cristita has been in this business for over 19 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cristita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children and for her family's daily food.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a member of the Dodoma road D in kihesa,Iringa.She is 43 years old woman,she is married and mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 27,25,22,20,17,15,and 8 years.she also cares for other 4 dependents.

 Anna started her own shop business selling sugar,salts,banana, 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

 This is Anna`s first loan from BRAC-Tanzania.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business,

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Anna hopes to pay school fees,save more money ,get more food for family and expand her business.

Eligia started her own business selling chicken 4years ago,she works 11 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Eligia`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 In order to buy more chicken for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Eligia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.name: Solie

texts.en:
Solie D. is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Solie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Solie raises pigs. Solie has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month.

In May 2008, Solie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Solie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to saise and sell.

Solie is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Solie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
“For with God, nothing is impossible,” says Angelita, who believes in the power of God. She is 50 years old and she is a rice retailer in the rural village of Casilagan of Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Arturo, a security guard, and they have two grown children, Richard and Jolan. Both are married and have provided their parents with grandchildren, who bring great joy to their lives.

Angelita enjoys selling rice in their village. Her business has been a great help, not only for her family but also for her co-villagers, for they do not need to travel far just to buy rice.

Aside from rice vending, she is also a direct seller of Avon products.

Angelita is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders so that she can achieve her desire of improving her small business and become a productive and successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Mary An Janit

texts.en:
Mary An Janit L. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mary An Janit is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary An Janit plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Mary An Janit has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In February 2009, Mary An Janit joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Mary An Janit has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Mary An Janit is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary An Janit from PMPC. She plans to use some of the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Mgreth

texts.en:
Magreth is a member of the Idunda borrower group,In Kihesa,Iringa.she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 36,30,28 years.

magreth started her own  business selling charcoal 13 years ago,she works 14 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Magreth`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested loan amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Magreth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Prisinta

texts.en:
Prisinta raises hogs near her house in the village of San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. She is 55 years old and still very determined to make her business grow to help her family. To maintain the business, Prisinta is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5 000. She intends to use the loan to buy enough feed for the growth and health of her hogs so that she will be able to sell them at a higher price.

She has had six children, five of whom are married. Her youngest daughter Jennifer is 15 years old and still studying. Prisinta patiently maintains her hog raising business in order to be able to give her youngest child a better education. Prisinta is aiming for the best for her family and hopes that it may someday be lifted from poverty.

loans.use: To obtain additional business capital

loans.name: Pablia

texts.en:
Mrs. Pablia D., age 48 and married, is a resident of P6 Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She and her husband have been blessed with five children. Two are now studying in college, one in high school, and one in elementary school. One is now working abroad.

Presently, the couple is earning income from a Copra buy-and-sell business with an average net income of not less than P 3,000 a month. They started this kind of business in the year 2008 with an initial capital of P 15,000 with the support of her daughter abroad. Now they are planning to engage in a new type of business, a "sari-sari" (or general) store.

As a new member of Paglaum MPC, Pablia is now applying for her first loan in the amount of P 5000 to finance her newly opened sari-sari store business. Their future plan is to expand their businesses, both the Copra trading and their newly opened sari-sari store.

Her dream in life is to help provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her newly opened sari-sari store

location.town: P6 Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Odeaza

texts.en:
Odeaza manages a hog-raising and a buy-and-sell business. The second business began when her eldest child entered college and Odeaza got the idea of engaging in something to supplement her hog-raising work. The combination of the two businesses really helps with income and helps provide for the educational needs of her child.

To help improve their living conditions, Odeaza also purchases fresh pork meat that she sells in their neighborhood at a retail price. This way, she is generating a daily income which is very helpful in meeting the daily needs of the family.

Odeaza is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 that she will use as additional capital for her current business. She hopes that it will bring her more income to use toward the education of her children and in supporting their family.

She is 40 years old and her husband's name is Wilson. In addition to their college child, they have a child in high school.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

In 2008, Constancia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her hope was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Constancia has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Constancia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Rainy Mae

texts.en:
Rainy Mae P. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Rainy Mae is married and has a baby.

To make a living, Rainy Mae works in someone else's business venture, helping to run a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks in the local community. Rainy Mae has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rainy Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her hope was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rainy Mae is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 5,000, PHP which will be used to invest in her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rainy Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Rose Chepkwemoi

texts.en:
Rose C. is 25 years old. Her husband's name is Protus Simiyu. Her business is located within the Nangili centre within Eldoret town, and her major customers are people living within the centre and its outskirts. She has been in the retail business for the past two years.

Rose was introduced to KADET by an existing member. With the loan she is taking out from KADET, she intends to replenish her inventory: this includes cooking oil, sugar, and rice. The remaining part of the loan will be used for farming, primarily to buy fertilizer for her maize crop.

In the future, she intends to diversify to wholesale.

Her goal is to be able to allow for her children's education at higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: To buy such staples as sugar, rice, and cooking oil for her retail business

Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in a business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Judith Anyango

texts.en:
Judith O. is 23 years old and married with two children. Her husband Godfrey is a Technician. She lives in Kangemi, which is a highly populated area. She deals in health and food supplements which she does by hawking. She travels round the city in order to meet her clients.

Judith got to know about KADET after a marketing event which was done by KADET staff in the area. She will be servicing her first loan and, since her business is young, she hopes to build it and to be able to supply to a wide clientele.

She also intends to diversify into farming back at her rural home.

loans.use: To buy more health and food supplements.

This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. loans.name: Anastasia Njeri

texts.en:
Anastasia K. is a 34-year-old single lady with one child. She has been in the business of selling soft drinks and snacks for the last year. Her business is in the busy main bus park in Nairobi town.

Anastasia was introduced to KADET by existing clients, and this will be her third loan in KADET. She intends to use the money to increase her variety of soft drinks and snacks. She plans to use the extra profit to purchase a piece of land so as to put up rental houses.

Anastasia believes she is very hardworking and innovative and she aspires to be a landlady able to collect about Ksh 50,000 a month.

loans.use: To increase her variety of soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok M. is a 37-year-old married woman and mother. She works sewing clothes for the garment industry and gets a salary of US$120 a month. She provides her income to manage her family’s daily expenses.

Hok M. is married with two young children who are enrolled in school. Her husband’s name is Mr. Eum Nhor, age 30, a construction worker, who appears in the photograph here.

Hok M. and her family face difficulty with electricity use because her house doesn’t have electric power. Therefore, Hok M. is taking out a loan to pay for the expense of hooking up to the electricity supply. The rest of loan will be used to decorate her old house.

loans.use: To pay for hooking up to the electricity supply and to decorate her old house

 Jema  started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 75000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jema`s first loan from BRAC _Tanzania.She requested the amount of 150,000Tsh in order to buy more clothes.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Jema hopes to save more money and expand her business.
