loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade A. is 30-years old and married with two children. She makes a living selling bottles of drinks and juice. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 in order to purchase more bottles of drinks and fruit juice to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks

loans.name: Kris

texts.en:
Kris T. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old. Kris is married and has a baby. Kris owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Kris has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Kris joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kris is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Kris from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a farming business

loans.name: Elesa

texts.en:
Elesa D. is from the village of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32-years old. Elesa is married and has four children in school. To make a living, Elesa owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from providing pedicab services to local community members. Elesa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elesa joined Kiva Partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elesa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elesa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve a pedicab business

loans.name: Grentina

texts.en:
Grentina is a member of the Semtema in  kihesa Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 14,9 years.she also cares for other 1 dependents.

 Grentina started her own business selling tomatoes,salts 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn mothly profit approximearly 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

 This is Grentina first loan from BRAC_Tanznaia.she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan  Grentina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes,tomatoes,salts

loans.name: Antoniette

texts.en:
Antoniette D. is from the village of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29-years old. Antoniette is single and has one baby. To make a living, Antoniette owns and operates a business running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc.,. Antoniette has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Antoniette joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antoniette is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antoniette from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a grocery store business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita E. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, M.isamis Occidental. She is 59-years old. Teresita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting peanuts for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teresita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a peanut growing business

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, cette dame pour apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer, s’est lancée au cours de cette année dans la vente de produits alimentaires de toute sorte ; elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour agrandir son stock de marchandises avec l'achat de 05 petites boîtes de tomates, 10 grandes boîtes, 10 bidons d’huile, 25 litres de lait, 05 cartons de spaghuéti, 03 cartons de sardines. Elle exerce son commerce au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est convaincue que ce financement apportera un changement dans sa vie et dans son foyer.
texts.en:
Viviane M. is married and the mother of 2 children. In order to contribute to her family's finances, she launched a business this year selling all sorts of food products. She is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES in order to increase the stock of her merchandise. She will purchase 5 small crates of tomatoes, 10 large crates of tomatoes, 10 canisters of oil, 25 liters of milk, 5 boxes of spaghetti and 3 containers of sardines. She does business in the large market in Lomé. She believes that this financing will change her life and her home.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Hel

texts.en:
Hel S., 60, currently weaves bamboo baskets that she sells directly from her house. She makes over 120 sets of baskets before selling out, and also orders baskets from the other villagers to sell in order to make additional income. Her husband, who assists her in buying the raw materials and weaving baskets, works on the farm.

Hel S. has five children, one of her daughters having just married and currently building a new home for separate living. Hel S. is requesting a loan for her daughter to buy more housing materials to finish the house.

loans.use: To buy more housing materials to finish building a new house.

loans.name: George Maiko

texts.en: George O., 39-years-old and married, has been in the embroidery business for nine years and manages his rental houses on the side.  George learned about KADET through existing clients, and is requesting his first loan of ksh 50,000, with which he plans to add to his stock of embroidery materials and buy an embroidery machine. With the extra profits that accrue, he plans to build more rental houses.  Focused and hardworking, George's goal is to have several more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and add to his stock of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda S., 29, is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, where she is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Cresilda owns and operates a business venture selling food snacks in the local community. Engaged in this business for over a year, she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cresilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP in order to expand the business. This loan will be her first, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Maglalena

texts.en:
Maglalena is a member of the semtema borrower group in Kihesa Iringa,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 5,2 years.

Magdalena started her own clothing business selling vitenge(fabric) 2 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 95000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Magdalena`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge (fabric).

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Magdalena hopes to save more money and expand her family

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda C. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is single, and has one school-aged child. Esmeralda owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling both food and daily used products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Esmeralda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans le commerce du charbon de bois dans le quartier de Djidjolé à Lomé où elle vend à la fois en gros et en détail. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1993 et c’est ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et de contribuer financièrement aux dépenses de son foyer. Son stock est en état d’épuisement ; pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de 25 sacs de charbon de bois. Elle est célibataire mais a à sa charge 03 personnes.
texts.en:
This woman specializes in the sale of charcoal in the neighborhood of Djidjolé, in Lomé. She sells the charcoal wholesale and for cash. She has been in this business since 1993 and this allows her to handle the business herself and contribute to her family's financial expenditures. The stock of her business has been exhausted; so she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 25 bags of charcoal.

She is unmarried, but she is caring for 3 people.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Tegemea

texts.en:
Tegemea is a member of the semtema B borrower group in Kihesa Iringa,she is 23 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is 1 year aged.

Tegemea started her own clothing business selling clothes2 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 90,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Tegemea`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Tegemea hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Grenly

texts.en: Grenly Y. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Grenly owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Grenly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Grenly is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Padagnassou

texts.fr: Depuis 2001, cette dame mariée sans enfants exerce le commerce de bois de chauffage à Agoè Démakpoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins financiers de son foyer. Pour renouveler son stock et pour augmenter sa marchandise, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de 32 tas des bois de chauffage et pour la couverture d’autres frais.
texts.en:
This woman is married and without children. Since 2001, she has been in the business of selling heating wood in Agoè Démakpoè, a neighborhood in Lomé. This business enables her to provide for the financial needs of her home. To renew her stock and increase her merchandise, she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES to purchase 32 piles of heating wood and to pay for other costs.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase heating wood

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea C. is 24 years old and resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, about 90 kms from the capital, Phnom Penh, along National Road Number 5, around the area of the Tunle Sap River. She and her husband have two kids who currently live with them.

Chea C. earns a living by making bamboo baskets for sale. Most of her valuable clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. She also buys baskets from other handicraft weavers to better satisfy her customer’s requirements. In this business, her husband assists her in weaving baskets and buying raw materials.

Chea C. will be using the Kiva loan to buy more bamboo in order to continue making baskets for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo in order to continue making baskets for sale

loans.name: Walikou

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’habits traditionnels depuis 2006. Cet homme était comptable, parce qu’il a perdu son emploi, il a monté ses propres affaires ; pour cela il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une vingtaine d'habits traditionnels. comme la rentrée scolaire approche, il souhaiterai associer à son commerce la vente d'articles scolaires, donc ce crédit lui permetrrai d'acheter  20 paquets de cahier, 10 petits paquets de bics et des règles. Il a ouvert sa boutique dans le quartier Atsanvé à Lomé. Il est marié et père d’un enfant
texts.en:
Since 2006, this gentleman has had business that generates revenues by selling traditional clothing. This man was an accountant, but because he lost his job, he started his own business, so he is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES, in order to purchase 20 sets of traditional clothes. As the start of school approaches, he hopes to associate his business with the sale of school items, so this loan will also enable him to purchase 20 packages of notebooks, 20 small packages of pens and rulers. He opened his shop in the neighborhood of Atsanvé, in Lomé,

He is married and the father of one child.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes and school supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthou Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan consists of 14 people located in Lvea Sa Leu village in Kandal Province, led by Mrs. Chanthou C., the village bank president selected by the members. A pig breeder, Chanthou is married to Mr. Y. Chorn, a village chief and farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetable. Now Chanthou is requesting a loan to build a piggery for her pig-breeding business. She is 54 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Five members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a piggery for her pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret Y. is 44 years old and is married to Wilson Simotwo. They have four children.

Margaret’s farm-produce business is located along the Iten-Tambach Road in Eldoret Town. She has been in the farm-produce business for the past eight years.

Margaret was introduced to KADET through a promotion by its staff. She is expecting to use the loan to buy more stock for sales including tomatoes, carrots and other vegetables.

In future, Margaret intends to expand her business to become wholesale and also to diversify to cereal sales, chicken-rearing and raising other domestic animals, so as to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce to sell

loans.name: Teodorico

texts.en:
Mr. Teodorico A. G., 53 years of age, is married and is a resident of Circumferential Road, Aguada, Ozamiz City.

Teodorico has a passion for cooking and has an existing eatery business called “Fountain Head”. Together with his wife, they have managed their own business for almost fifteen years. Mostly, their regular customers are workers from the different offices and warehouses nearby. With an average net income of P15,000 a month, they are able to support their family and are able to send their children to school.

Teodorico joined Paglaum MPC on May 23, 2009 as a regular member. Now, he is applying for a loan of P30,000 to add to the existing capital of their business. Their dream in life is to be able to send their eldest son to college and be able to meet the needs of their family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for his eatery business

loans.name: Akpé Ablavi

texts.fr:
Cette dame a appris la couture qu’elle exerce comme métier depuis 2003 ; parce qu’elle ne trouve pas trop de clientèle, elle a pensé vendre, en plus de la couture, des matériels de couture dont les clients ont besoin. Pour cette raison, elle demande un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une machine de plinthe, 12 cartons de fils de couture et divers articles propres à la couture.
Elle est célibataire sans enfants.
texts.en:
In 2003, this lady learned the skill of sewing, which she now does as a business. She has not found too many clients, so she decided to sell the materials her clients need to sew for themselves, in addition to the clothes she sews. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES to purchase a baseboard sewing machine, 12 boxes of thread and various other items for sewing.

She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Lourgen

texts.en:
“Money from firewood”... Industry and hard work are the capital for Mrs. Lourgen M. who is 29 years of age, married, and a resident of P6 Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is blessed with two children, both of whom are now in their elementary grades. Her husband is a poultry worker with an average income of not less than P150 a day.

Because of this situation, Lourgen decided to go into business in order to help her husband to raise their family. Now, she is earning an income from the sale of coconut sticks, “paluwa” in our local dialect, used as firewood. She started this business in January 2008 with an initial capital of P1,000 from her husband’s daily income and with the help of her neighbors as suppliers of the coconut firewood sticks. Now, she is earning an average net income of P1,000 a month which is very helpful for their family needs.

As a new member of Paglaum MPC, Lourgen is applying for a loan of P3,000 to add to her business capital. She is hoping that someday all her children can finish their studies up to college level.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

location.town: P6 Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna A. is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has two sons: the older one is nine, and the younger one is an infant. Anna’s business consists of selling clothes at the trade fair. She keeps working at this business even though her child is only 2 months old, and her sister takes care of the baby. She needs a loan of $1,100 to expand her trade by buying modern ladies' autumn clothing to resell.

loans.use: Buying modern ladies' autumn clothing to resell

loans.name: Adjowa Lydia

texts.fr: Cette dame vend des plats, seaux et des objets en plastique depuis 2007 à Soviépé, l’un des quartiers périphériques de Lomé. Elle n'est pas mariée mais a 04 enfants, ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge et de couvrir également les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants. Pour cela, elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour pouvoir s’approvisionner avec 20 plats, 15 seaux et une douzaine d'objets en plastique de toute sorte.
texts.en:
This is a lady who has been selling dishes, buckets, and plasticware since 2007 in Soviépé, one of the outlying districts of Lomé. She is unmarried but has four children. This commerce allows her to support herself and also to feed and school her children. For these reasons, she would like to obtain a WAGES loan to be able to stock up with 20 plates, 15 buckets, and a dozen items of plastic goods of all sorts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dishes, pails, plasticware

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali-Rwanda,

Bernadette M. is 30 years old, she is married and she has  three children, with the ages: 9, 5, 2,and she takes care of 1 independent who is 37 years old.

Bernadette has been selling different kinds of shoes since 2006 working from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM and employs one person. She gets a monthly profit of 300,000 RWF.  

Bernadette is requesting her first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company s.a. 
The purpose of this new loan is to expand her business through purchasing more shoes.

Through accessing this new loan, Bernadette hopes to help her husband to build their own house and save for the future of her family.

loans.use: shoes

loans.name: Mrs. So Kear Khon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in Tnaot village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. So Kear K. is the 39-year-old village bank president.

Mrs. So Kear K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a weaver who makes cloth from Khmer silk. Her husband, Mr. Sor Mab, is a security guard. This couple has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Since her business is doing well, Mrs. So Kear K. wants to expand it by purchasing more silk to weave more cloth. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave more cloth

loans.name: Rose Andala

texts.en:
Rose A. is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband John works as a technician. Two of her children are in high school and the other two are in primary school. 

Rose was introduced to KADET by her friends who had joined a group. She has never borrowed from any sources other from KADET. She repaid her first loan very well and on time. She has applied for a second loan which she plans to invest in her business; using it for restocking and using part of the money to pay school fees for her children.

Rose sells decorated tablecloths and women clothes. Her business is in a semi-urban area with few business, so competition is low. Her customers are from the surrounding community, but she also sells to retailers from other places. 

Rose intends to buy an embroidery sewing machine so she can cater to her customers' tastes and demands. She also hopes to buy fabric in bulk to increase her returns.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice I. is 40 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her husband Lucas is a driver. Two of her daughters are in the university. Her other children are in high school and primary school. 

Eunice hawks (sells door-to-door) clothes around the Kangemi area, a very highly populated,low and medium-income neighborhood in Nairobi. Due to the nature of her business, she is in a position to meet many people, unlike those who are confined to one region.This enables her to maximize her returns, and she can visit her clients wherever they are.

Eunice was introduced to KADET by her friends who were already in a group. She had never borrowed from other sources before. After repaying her first loan well and on time, she decided to apply for a second one to add clothes to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business by increasing her stock and diversifying her goods. She also intends to build her own house so that she can save on rent and be able to educate her children comfortably.

loans.use: Eunice plans to increase her stock of clothes and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Tyaminou

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur est célibataire sans enfants. Il fait des services de secrétariat et vend des matériels informatiques dans sa boutique située dans le quartier Démakpoè à Lomé. C’est depuis 2005 qu’il est dans ce commerce et il compte sur un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 01 carton de papier rame, une imprimante, un disque dur et divers autres articles informatiques. Sa boutique de vente est très connue de la population.
texts.en:
This gentleman is unmarried and has no children.  He provides office services and sells computer equipment in his shop located in the Démakpoè district in Lomé.  He has been in this business since 2005, and he is counting on this loan from WAGES to buy a box of paper in reams, a printer, a hard disk, and various other computer items.  His sales outlet is well-known.   

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper in reams, a printer, a hard disk, and various other computer items

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: Cet homme s’est spécialisé dans la réparation des appareils électroniques dans son atelier situé à Agoè-Klinvé, qui est l’un des quartiers périphériques de Lomé. En plus de cette profession de réparateur, il vend aussi des matériels électroniques de toute catégorie. Pour maintenir son stock à jour, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un régulateur, un testeur, un étain et des fils électroniques de réparation. Il est célibataire sans enfants.
texts.en:
This is a man who became specialized in repairing electronics in his workshop located in Agoè-Klinvé, which is one of the outlying districts of Lomé.  In addition to this repair profession, he also sells electronics of all kinds.  To keep his inventory up-to-date, he is requesting a WAGES loan to buy a regulator, a tester, some tin, and some electronic wire for repairs.  He is unmarried and has no children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a regulator, a tester, some tin, and some electronic wire

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 33-years-old. She is married to Thomas Rono and they have two children. Her business is located along Iten -Tambach road in Eldoret Town.

She has been in the hair salon business for five years and her major clients are residents of Iten-Tambach. Valentine was introduced to KADET by a registered KADET group member. She has applied for a loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan buy equipment, including a blow-drier, and add to her stock of hair chemicals. 

In the future, she intends to open a beauty salon and hair dressing college, and to build residential houses.

loans.use: To buy hair salon equipment and restock her hair chemicals.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée sans enfant. Elle exerce le commerce de produits alimentaires, à savoir l’haricot et des condiments de cuisine de toute variété. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2006. Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES parce qu’elle a des difficultés financières pour renouveler son stock. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter un sac d’haricot et plusieurs condiments. Son commerce se situe dans le quartier d’Agoè Plantation à Lomé.
texts.en:
This is a married woman who has no children.  She does commerce in food items, namely beans and condiments of all kind.  She has been in this business since 2006.  She is requesting a WAGES loan because she has financial difficulties renewing her inventory.  This loan will enable her to buy a sack of bean and several condiments.  Her business is located in the Agoè Plantation district in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of beans and condiments for cooking

loans.name: Roukéa

texts.fr: Cette dame est une grande vendeuse de pagnes de qualité au grand marché de Lomé depuis 2003. Ses pagnes sont très sollicités par les femmes d’affaires, les hauts fonctionnaires et bien d’autres personnes. Pour éviter une rupture de stocks, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Phoenix, 12 pagnes Hitarget et couvrir divers frais. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady has been a major retailer of quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth) at the grand marketplace of Lomé since 2003.  Her pagnes are in high demand by business women, high-level civil servants, and many other people.  To avoid inventory shortages, she is requesting a WAGES loan to buy 15 lengths of Phoenix pagnes and 12 lengths of Hi-target pagnes and to cover various costs.  She is married and the mother of one child. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Tappe

texts.fr: Cette dame vend dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé des beignets d’arachide communément appelés « Gonazo » ; ce sont des beignets qui sont très appréciés de la population et surtout des enfants. Elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 07 sacs d’arachide pour pouvoir fabriquer ses beignets. Elle est mariée et sans enfants.
texts.en:
At the marketplace of Agoè Assiyéyé, this woman sells peanut fritters commonly called gonazo;  these are fritters that people really appreciate, especially children.  She would like to obtain a loan from WAGES to buy 7 sacks of peanuts for making her fritters.  She is married and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 7 sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta S. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 31 years old. Julieta is engaged and has 1 young child. To make a living, Julieta runs a general store where she sells a variety of products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ameyo Nathalie

texts.fr: Cette femme sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en 06 cartons de tomates en boîte, 03 sacs de sucre, 02 sacs de riz et 12 sachets de bonbon pour sa boutique d’alimentation générale. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de se prendre en charge et de pouvoir continuer son commerce qu’elle exerce depuis 2006 dans son quartier Sogbossito à Lomé. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is requesting a WAGES loan to stock up with 6 boxes of canned tomatoes, 3 sacks of sugar, 2 sacks of rice, and 12 baggies of candy for her general store.  This loan will allow her to support herself and also to continue her business, which she has been operating since 2006 in her district, Sogbossito in Lomé.  She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: canned tomatoes, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, and candy

loans.name: United Tamensu Group

texts.en:
Here are Lucy J., Kadiatu B. and Kalima B.. They call their group "United Tamemsu." This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are borrowing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses so that sales and profit will increase. Consequently, their standard of living will also improve. They will be in a better position to look after themselves and children; in terms of feeding, clothing, sending them to school and providing them with medical care incase they fall sick.

Lucy J. is the leader of this group. Lucy is now thirty-two years of age. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. Two of her children are in primary schools and one is still young. Lucy sells cigarettes, matches, mints, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years. With this loan, she will be able to add more items to her cigarette stall.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 36 years old. Helen is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen plants, harvests, and sells rice. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest from these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and labor during cultivation. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that she will use to buy the rice farm that they have been leasing. This will be Helen's 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy the rice farm that they have been leasing

loans.name: Tawopr Group

texts.en:
Here are Baba K., Marie K., Iye S. and Adama B.. They call their group "Tawopr," a Temne phrase meaning "let us be steadfast." This is the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have borrowed from SMT/Kiva. Their previous loans have had a tremendous effect on the lives of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of Le 1,300,000.00 to enable them further improve their businesses.

Baba K. is the leader of this group. Baba was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have five children. He sells food items and non-food items at the Magburaka town market. He has been a businessman for more than fifteen years.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Rosa Lissai

texts.pt:
Rosa Lisa P. S. nasceu na provincial de inhambane no distrito de Vilanculos (a 790 km a norte de Maputo) casada e mãe de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 21 e 24 anos. O primeiro filho trabalha numa empresa em Boane enquanto que o outro continua a estudar. Parou de estudar na 5 classe por falta de incentivo por parte dos pais que não tinham visão sobre o valor da educação.

Vive em boane a mais de 10 anos, proveniente de Maputo, donde se transferiu com toda sua família, na casa própria juntamente com sua mãe que se encontra sob sua responsabilidade. Seu marido trabalha na fabrica de cimentos de Moçambique enquanto que ela faz o negocio a mais de 12 anos sem empregados.

Aprendeu a fazer negocio ha 24 anos no mercado Fajardo na cidade Maputo.  Vende cereais, (milho e o que compra a 120,00MT o saco e vende a 255,00MT cada). Obtém uma renda diária no valor de 2.500,00MT e uma parte poupa no esquema tradicional de poupança rotativa (xitique).

Nunca teve empréstimo com outros Bancos e que teve informações sobre a existência da Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos e tendo desembolsado 3 empréstimos (10.000,00MT; 20.000,00MT e 30.000,00MT) todos para comercio.

Com o presente credito de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar mais produtos (milho e outros cereais) para reforçar o seu negocio. Decidiu pedir pouco valor comparando com os créditos anteriores por causa da saturação do mercado. 

Pretende pagar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de expandir para novas zonas e contratar trabalhadores para lhe auxiliar a fazer o marketing.
texts.en:
Rosa Lisa P. S. was born in the Inhambane province of the Vilanculos district (790 km north of Maputo). She is married and is the mother of 2 children between the ages of 21 and 24. Her first son works in a business in Boane while the other studies. She stopped her studies in the 5th grade because her parents did not believe in the value of education.

She has lived in Boane more than 10 years, having come from Maputo, where she moved with her whole family, in her own home with her mother, whom she supports. Her husband works in the Cimentos de Moçambique (Cements of Mozambique) factory while she has run the business for the last 12 months without employees.

She learned how to run the business during her 24 years in the Fajardo market in the city of Maputo. She sells grains (corn which she buys at 120,00 MT per sack and sells for 255,00 MT per sack). They bring in a daily revenue of 2.500,00MT and she saves the money in a traditional rotating method (called an xitique).

She has never taken out a loan with any other bank. She learned of Hluvuku-Adsema (a Kiva partner) through her neighbors and has been given 3 loans (10.000,00MT; 20.000,00MT and 30.000,00MT), all for her business.

With this loan of 15.000,00MT she hopes to buy more products (corn and other grains) to fortify her business. She decided to ask for a smaller loan than before because of the saturation of the market.

She plans to pay without problems so that she can take out more loans with the objective of expanding into new areas and to hire workers to help with marketing.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell corn and other grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow cassava

loans.name: Geraldo Francisco

texts.pt:
Geraldo Francisco C. nasceu em Zavala província de inhambane,de 38 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 9 e 13 anos de idades, todos frenquentam escola. Para alem da família sustenta mais 3 sobrinhos que estão sob sua responsabilidade. Estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado devido à guerra. Vive com sua família na casa própria.

Geraldo saiu de Zavala quando tinha 16 anos para refugiar se na cidade de maputo devido à guerra civil que terminou no ano de 1992, juntamente com sua família. Chegado a maputo, trabalhou com seu primo como cobrador no transporte semi- colectivo durante 10 anos e mais tarde arranjou emprego formal nas bombas de combustível da Petromoc (Petróleos de Moçambique) onde trabalha ate data hoje.

Para alem de estar a trabalhar e como o salário mensal de 5.000,00MT, com o qual sustenta sua família, faz o negocio de venda de pneus para viaturas. Compra o pneu a 1.350,00MT e vende a 1.950,00MT e consegue um bom rendimento que ate poupa no banco comercial.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e este é o seu quarto credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra e venda de pneus e outros acessórios para revender. Obteve informações acerca da instituição através de amigos e vizinhos que também são clientes da hluvuku. Os primeiros empréstimos foram de para a mesma actividade nos valores de (7.500,00MT; 15.000,00MT e 25.000,00MT) respectivamente.

Propõe se a pagar os empréstimos sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos para cumprir o sonho de melhorar a forma de prestação de serviços construindo um estabelecimento convencional, incluindo lavagem de viaturas.
texts.en:
Geraldo Francisco C. was born in the Zavala province of Inhambane. He is 38 years old, married, and is the father of 2 children who are 9 and 13 and both attend school. Aside from his own family, he also supports 3 nephews. He studied until the 6th grade but had to stop because of the war. He lives with his family in his own home.

Geraldo left Zavala for Maputo with his family when he was 16 to take refuge from the civil war that ended in 1992. He arrived in Maputo and worked with his cousin as a driver for a tram for 10 years. Later on he found a job with the gas station Petromoc (Petroleum of Mozambique) where he continues to work today.

Aside from this work and as his monthly salary is 5.000,00MT, with which he supports his family, he has a business selling tires. He buys the tires at 1.350,00MT and sells them for 1.950,00MT and he earns a good return which he saves in the bank.

He has never taken out a loan with another bank and this is his 4th loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 15.000,00MT to buy and sell the tires and other accessories. He learned of the institution through his friends and neighbors who are also clients. The first loans he took were used for the same purpose and were for the amounts of 7.500,00MT, 15.000,00MT, and 25.000,00MT, respectively.

He plans to pay back the loans without problems to be able to have access to more loans to finance his dream of improving his services, constructing a conventional establishment, including a car wash.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of car tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell food items and staple goods

loans.name: Sapo-Ben Group

texts.en:
These are a group of local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to help them improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses so that both sales and profit will increase. In this way, these entrepreneurs’ living conditions will improve; they will be able to better look after themselves and children.

Abdul S. C. is the leader of this group. Abdul is thirty-three years of age.  He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children.  Abdul is a motorbike driver and he has been in this business for five years.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow peanuts

loans.name: Sturuda

texts.en:
Sturuda is a member of the Idunda In Kihesa Iringa,she is 50 years old woman.she is widowed and a mother of 3 children.Her children  are aged 31,29,26 years.

 sturuda started her own clothing business selling vitenge (fabric) 5 years ago.she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sturuda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitege.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Sturuda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa E. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 62 years old. Josefa is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be Josefa's fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Progress Group. They are local business people based in Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They have been in business for many years, but business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs. Therefore, they have decided to apply for a loan from SMT/Kiva. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses.

Gibril S. K. is the leader of this group. Gibril is thirty-seven years of age. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. Gibril sells both soft drinks and hard drinks in Magburaka town. He has been a businessman for more than seven years. With this loan, he will be able to buy more crates of both soft drinks and hard drinks to add to his shop.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Chapo Manuel

texts.pt:
Chapo Manuel M. nasceu na cidade de maputo tem 69 anos de idade e pai de 5 filhos maiores de 18 anos. Estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado devido à factores políticos no tempo colonial português.
Vivem com sua família e mais duas netas e dois sobrinhos sob sua responsabilidade na casa própria no mesmo distrito de boane.

Chapo participou movimento independentista contra o regime colonial português desde o ano de 1954 que culminou com a independência do pais no ano de 1975 sob liderança do partido ainda no poder em Moçambique. Em 1994 depois das primeiras eleições gerais no pais, passou a reforma. Ganha mensalmente 3.500,00MT no Ministério da defesa Nacional. Para alem da pensão, recebe 3.000,00MT de aluguer de casa que construiu com o dinheiro obtido a quando da sua desmobilização.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através do seu secretario do bairro tendo aproximado e desembolsado o primeiro credito no valor de 16.000,00MT que se destinava a compra de material de construção.

Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00MT pretende continuar com a actividade de construção de mais uma casa para aluguer, comprando material de construção.
Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a outros créditos com o mesmo propósito. Depois de terminar com a sua obra, sonha comprar uma viatura para os filhos.
texts.en:
Chapo Manuel M. was born in the city of Maputo. He is 69 years old and is the father of 5 grown children. He studied until the 4th grade but he stopped his studies due to political factors during the Portuguese colonial rule. He lives with his family and two granddaughters and two nephews whom he cares for in his own home in the Boane district.

Chapo participated in the independence movement against the colonial Portuguese regime, beginning in 1954 and which ended in 1975 under the leadership of the party then in power in Mozambique. In 1994 after the first general elections of the country, reform came.

He earns 3.500,00MT monthly in the national defense ministry. Aside from this, he receives 3.000,00MT for the lease of a house that he constructed with money obtained after the end of his military service.

He never has taken a loan with another bank. He came to know Hluvuku-Adsema through his neighborhood secretary having taken a loan for 16.000,00MT which he used to buy construction materials.

With this new loan of 20.000,00MT he hopes to continue the construction of more than one house to rent, purchasing construction materials. He hopes to pay back the loan without problems in order to be able to have access to future loans for the same purpose. After finishing his current project, he dreams of buying a vehicle for his children.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Espedita

texts.en:
Espedita is a member of the Semtema A borrower group in Kihesa Iringa,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children,Her children are aged 18,16,14,8 and 5 years.

 Espedita started her own food business selling vegetable 9 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 48000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Espedita first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Vegetable.

With the profit she gain from the use of this Loan espedita hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable

loans.name: Massesegbeh Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Massesegbeh loan group. They are small-scale business people in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan of Le 2,500,000 to help them improve their businesses. 

Abdul K. is the leader of this group. Abdul is forty years of age. He is married and has six children. He was born in Magburaka town. Abdul is a vehicle driver and has been in the transportation business for over ten years. Abdul will invest this loan in his transportation business.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema is a member of the semtema A borrower group in Kihesa,Morogoro,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 23,19, and 12 years.

 Jema started her own food business selling tomatoes,anion 10 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 24000 Tanzania shillings.
 
This is jema`s fist loan from BRAC _Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,anions.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Jema hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,potatoes,anion

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen G. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 27 years old. Helen is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Helen is just starting this business.

In 2007, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Helen's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Lizete Venancio

texts.pt:
Lizete Venâncio B. nasceu no distrito de boane tem 36 anos de idade e é mãe de 1 filho de 13 anos que estuda na escola primaria completa de Boane. Estudou ate 7 classe tendo parado devido a questões sociais e tradicionais.

Lizete cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e nunca saiu do distrito. Atualmente é viúva. Aprendeu a fazer negócios há bastante tempo com sua mãe e vende roupa usada e nova de adultos e crianças no mercado central da vila de Boane. O seu negocio está a evoluir bem e adquire a mercadoria na cidade de Maputo a 1.500,00MT cada fardo de roupa diversa e vende a 3.000,00MT cada. Rende mensalmente 3.000,00MT que aplica no reforço do negocio e sustento da família. Poupa num esquema tradicional de poupança rotativa (xitique) uma vez por semana.

Já teve créditos com outras instituições similares em grupos solidários e quando teve informações através de vizinhos sobre os créditos individuais da Hluvuku-Adsema aproximou e solicitou vários empréstimos para a mesma actividade de venda de roupa usada, um de 6.000,00MT e os restantes de 10.000,00MT cada.
Já beneficiou de credito de kiva e tendo concluído sem problemas e o seu negocio conheceu uma melhoria significativa. Vive e consegue sustentar a sua família.

Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00MT, pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada e outra nova para responder a demanda do produto. Propõe se a fechar o credito sem problemas para aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de construir uma capoeira para fazer avicultura.
texts.en:
Lizete Venâncio B. was born in the district of Boane. She is 36 years old and is the mother of one son, 13 years old, who studies in the elementary school of Boane. She studied until seventh grade, having had to stop due to social and traditional issues. Lizete grew up with her parents and never left the district. She is a widow at this time. She learned how to do business a long time ago with her mother, and she sells new and used clothing for adults and children in the central market of Boane. Her business is evolving well. She acquires merchandise in the city of Maputo at 1,500 MT for a bundle of mixed clothing, and sells at 3,000 MT per bundle. This yields 3,000 MT each month, which is applied to reinforcing her business and sustaining her family. She puts money aside in a traditional savings system (xitique) once a week. She has already had loans with other similar institutions as part of a group, and when she got information through neighbours about the individual loans from Hluvuku-Adsema, she approached and asked for various loans for the same purpose of selling used clothing, one of 6,000 MT and the rest for 10,000 MT each. She has already benefitted from a loan from Kiva, and paid it back without problems. Her business has realised a significant improvement. She lives and manages to support her family. With the present loan of 15,000 MT, she plans to purchase bundles of used clothing and others of new clothing in response to the demand for this product. She proposes to pay back the loan without problems in order to access more loans with the goal of constructing a chicken coop to raise poultry.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various clothing

texts.en:
Here are Fatmata B., Yeabu W., Hawa S., Hawa S. and Jeneba S.. They named their group "Help Us." This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are borrowing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in quality and quantity. Consequently, sales and profits will improve for these entrepreneurs.  As such, they will be in a better position to look after their families and meet their educational, nutritional and medical needs.

Fatmata B. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka thirty-three years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for more than ten years. She sells market food. She will invest this loan in her market food business.

This group of entrepreneurs is seeking a loan of Le 3,200,000 in order to expand their businesses. They call their group "Furtha United." This is the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have borrowed from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, these women were able to improve their businesses. They were able to increase the size and quality of their businesses, thereby improving sales and profits. As a result of SMT/Kiva loans, they are now in a much better position to assist their school-going children.

loans.name: Armindo Lainda

texts.pt:
Armindo Lainda P. de 37 anos de idade é natural de Massinga Província de Inhembane casada e mãe de 3 filhos com idade media de 10 anos, todos a estudarem. Para alem de sustentar a família, tem mais 2 sobrinhos na sua responsabilidade. Estudou ate 5 classe tendo parado devido à situação econômico e social. Vive com a família na sua própria casa.

Armindo saiu de Inhembane em 1988 para Maputo e cinco anos depois saiu da cidade de Maputo para boane, onde vive ate data hoje com a sua esposa, seus filhos e sobrinhos. Chegado ao distrito, no ano de 1993, iniciou o negocio de venda de material de construção localmente disponível (capim) com experiência a mais de 3 anos vendendo este tipo de material. Um molho de capim vende a 4.003.00MT, é muito difícil adquirir este material há vezes que o capim sêca.

Com o negócio que faz rende 4.000.00MT com os quais consegue sustentar a família e poupar algum dinheiro através de um esquema tradicional de poupança rotativa (xitique). Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00MT para compra de materiais de construção para lodges e outro tipo de complexos turísticos.

O primeiro credito foi de 15.000,00MT, também para mesma actividade. Conheceu a Hluvuku através do amigo que também é cliente da instituição.
Nunca teve credito em outras instituições e, com o presente empréstimo pretende adquirir mais matéria prima e poderá empregar mais pessoas para lhe ajudarem na colecta ou procura do material. 

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo mais rápido possível, sem problemas, para poder obter outros créditos com objectivo de construir um forno para fabricação de pão.
texts.en:
Armindo Lainda P. is 37 years old, a native of Massinga Province of Inhembane. He is married and is the father of three children whose ages average 10 years, all of whom attend school. In addition to supporting his family, he has two dependent nephews. He studied until fifth grade, having had to stop school due to his economic and social situation. He lives with his family in his own house. Armindo left Inhembane in 1988 for Maputo, and five years later left the city of Maputo for Boane, where he still lives today with his wife, his children and his nephews. Having arrived in the area in 1993, he began a business selling locally available construction material (capim - a type of grass), having more than three years of experience selling this type of material. A sheaf of capim sells for 4,003 MT. It's very difficult to acquire this material at times, because the capim dries out. The business yields 4,000 MT, with which he manages to support his family and save some money through a traditional savings system (xitique). This is his second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 12,000 MT to purchase construction materials for cabins and other types of tourist complexes. The first loan was for 15,000 MT, also for the same purpose. He got to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. He has never had a loan with another institution, and with the present loan he plans to acquire more raw materials and to be able to employ more people to help in the collection or procurement of material. Armindo proposes to pay back the loan as quickly as possible, without problems, in order to be able to obtain other loans for the purpose of constructing an oven for manufacturing bread.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: collection, purchase and sale of capim

loans.name: F & G Enterprise Group

texts.en:
This is Foday S., Sorie C., Alhaji K. and Mohamed K.. The named their group "F. and G. Enterprises." They are small-scale businessmen from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their fourth loan from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a lot of improvements in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to improve their businesses and make more profits so that they can feed their children three meals a day, send them to school, and provide them with clothes and medical care. 

Foday S. is the leader of this group. Foday is thirty-five years of age. He was born in Magburaka. He is married and has one young child. Foday runs a cinema. He shows mainly European football (soccer) league films. He has been in this business for eleven years. Foday will invest this loan in his business. He will pay the satellite subscription fee, make new benches and repair worn out benches, and buy CDs, a generator, and a television.

loans.name: Albertina Jacinto

texts.pt:
Albertina jacinto N. de 53 anos de idade natural de matola província de Maputo, solteiro mãe de 3 filhos maiores de idade encontrando a vivem nas suas próprias residências. Estudou ate 6 classe do antigo sistema e vive na sua própria casa com o neto que está sob sua responsabilidade no bairro da Matola 700. 

Albertina cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e teve oportunidade de aprender vários ofícios, dentre os quais o serviço de cabalaria foi o que mais gosta de fazer. Possui um estabelecimento feito de material convencional (salão de cabalaria), onde tem feito os trabalhos de prestação de serviços de beleza.
Tem 30 anos de experiência nesta actividade e desenvolve o negocio sem grandes transtornos, também porque adquire os produtos de beleza a bom preço e tem tido clientes que lhe garantem a estabilidade do negocio. Rende diariamente 350,00MT e no final de cada mês consegue pagar o credito e sustentar a sua família.

Nunca teve empréstimos bancários em outras instituições e tomara conhecimento sobre a existência da Hluvuku-Adsema através da sua filha mais velha. Já levantou dois empréstimos de 6.000,00MT e 8.500,00MT, respectivamente para o exercício de actividade de salão de cabelaria.

Com o credito de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar materiais de construção para ampliar o estabelecimento (salão de cabelaria) para prestar serviços de qualidade aos seus clientes. Tem como desafio, ampliar as instalações e expandir o negocio.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de fazer crescer o seu negocio e melhorar a situação social da sua família.
texts.en:
Albertina Jacinto N. is 53 years old, a native of Matola in Maputo province. She is a single mother of three children, all of whom are adults and live in their own homes. She studied until sixth grade under the old system, and lives in her own house with a dependent grandson in the neighbourhood of Matola 700. Albertina grew up with her parents and had the opportunity to learn various trades, amongst which hairdressing was the one she most enjoyed doing. She has an establishment made of conventional materials – a hairdressing salon – where she works providing beauty services. She has 30 years of experience in this activity and runs her business without great difficulty, in part because she acquires beauty products at a good price, and has had customers that guarantee her stability for her business. This yields 350 MT per day, and at the end of every month she is able to pay her loan and support her family. She has never had bank loans with other institutions, and came to learn about the existence of Hluvuku-Adsema through her oldest daughter. She has already taken out two loans, for 6,000 MT and 8,500 MT respectively, for carrying out the activities of her hairdressing salon. With the loan of 10,000 MT, she plans to purchase construction materials to increase the size of her establishment (hairdressing salon) to provide quality services to her customers. She has challenged herself to enlarge the installation and expand her business. She proposes to pay back the loan without problems in order to access more loans, with the objective of growing her business and improving the social situation of her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction materials to build onto salon

loans.name: Famous Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Famous Group. They are small-scale business people in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are applying for a loan of Le 1,500,000 for the first time to boost their businesses. With this loan, their businesses will expand in size and quality. They will make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their standard of living will rise to a new level.

Mohamed B. is the leader of this group. He was born in Makeni and  he is twenty-eight years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a businesswoman, too. Mohamed sells medicines and has been in the business for over three years. He will invest this loan in his business.

loans.name: Sungane

texts.pt:
Sungane M. nasceu na província de tete (a 2800 km a norte da cidade de Maputo onde existe a terceira maior hidroelétrica de áfrica) tem 59 anos de idade e pai de uma filha de 17 anos de idade. Estudou ao ate 5 classe tendo parado quando saiu o seu nome para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório.

Cumpriu o serviço militar na província de maputo onde, depois de desmobilizado, veio a casar com sua esposa no distrito de boane. Vive com a família, na casa própria, sem ninguém sob sua responsabilidade. É pensionista do Ministério da defesa nacional auferindo 4.082,00mt, com os quais sustenta a família e paga o credito. Tem experiência na área de agricultura, produz horticolas no vale do rio umbeluzi desde 1988.

Conheceu a Hluvuku graças às informações obtidas através de um amigo vizinho.
Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições, sendo este o seu segundo credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT que vai aplicar na compra de blocos para construção da sua casa de material convencional. O primeiro credito foi de 3.950,00MT que se destinava para compra de insumos agrícolas e tendo reembolsado sem problemas.

Sungane compromete se a reembolsar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com o intuito concluir a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Sungane M. was born in the Province of Tete (2,800 km north of the city of Maputo, where the third largest hydroelectric power station in Africa is). He is 59 years old and is the father of a 17-year-old girl. He studied until fifth grade, having had to stop when his name came up to do his obligatory military service. He carried out his military service in the province of Maputo where, after demobilization, he married his wife in the district of Boane. He lives with his family in his own house and has no other dependents. He is a pensioner of the Ministry of National Defence, giving him 4,082 MT, with which he supports his family and pays his loan. He has experience in agriculture, he has grown vegetables in the Umbeluzi River Valley since 1988. Sungane got to know about Hluvuku thanks to information he received through a neighbouring friend. He has never had loans with other institutions, and this is his second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 10,000 MT. It will be used in the purchase of construction blocks for his house, made of conventional materials. The first loan was for 3,950 MT, which was for purchasing raw agricultural materials, was repaid without any problems Sungane promises to repay the loan without problems so that he can access more loans with the intention of finishing the construction of his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

Bernard W. is 29 years old. He is married and the father of a daughter named Trizah. He lives in Mikindani, Mombasa where he runs a store that sells electronics and mobile accessories. His business has been in operation for 8 years. 

This will be Bernard's first loan from KADET. He plans to use the money to increase his stock of electrical ware and to purchase a computer for mobile repairs.

In the future. Bernard hopes to open more stores in Mikindani and to expand further into other towns.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
E. Mahbuba is a hard working mother. Since she married, she has been breeding and selling cattle. She is quite efficient thanks to her years of experience. She works very hard to support her dear children in their education. The desire of this virtuous mother is to grant her children the opportunity to finish their studies an opportunity she never had due to the scarce economic resources of her family when she was young. She is requesting a loan to help achieve her goals. She will use the capital to invest and obtain a bigger profit from selling her animals. Let's help Mahbuba and her beautiful family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

texts.en:
T. Ayubjon and his determined family have been through difficult financial times. Thanks to his restless nature and self-initiative, he has been able to learn a great deal, and now – thanks to great effort and sacrifice – he is doing well with his manufacturing business. His objective is to provide an excellent level of service and to make his small workshop the busiest in his native town, with the assistance of his children who help and support him in his daily endeavors.

To achieve his goals, Ayubjon is asking for a loan of $1000 US. Your generous support will be a wise investment in the hands of this family, giving them the opportunity to prosper with their new project.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. texts.en:
Remia L. and her husband used to plant vegetables for their family's consumption; however, they realized that they could also sell them in the market and earn extra income. Remia is from San Jose Village, Brgy Calumangan, Bago City. She is 38 years old, married with two children of school age.

This couple plan to buy fertilizers with their twelfth loan, borrowing 4,000 PHP from NWTF-Project Dungganon. They hope they can produce more than their previous harvest.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life which can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.
