texts.en:
Emélido O. Espinoza is 70 years old and lives with his wife and nephew in a small rural community in the Alajuela province of Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala. They raise cattle for their meat and milk and plant basic crops such as rice, bean, and corn, among others. Emélido has been raising cattle for many years. He sells his products to nearby communities and his customers are very satisfied with the quality of products he sells. If fact, the demand for his products outweighs the supply he is able to provide. Don Emélido is thankful to the for the opportunities the microfinance organization has given him. Little by little his family has been able to improve their quality of life. They have been able to play an integral part in the development of the community, which has gone through frequent periods of inclemency and unemployment. Don Emélido would like to obtain a loan for ¢685,000 (six hundred eighty-five thousand colones) so that he can purchase three cows to increase his production. He knows that raising three extra cattle will require a lot of sacrifices and extra work. However, his goal is to be an outstanding small business owner and he is motivated to get ahead and improve his family's quality of life. Don Emélido is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, one of 100 organizations which make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and with the loan he hopes to continue to grow on a personal and economic level and to become more active in the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase three cows.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo se encuentra casado y tiene 35 años de edad, 2 hijos, toda la familia vive en domicilio propio en la comunidad de Huacarama. Pablo se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros afiliado al sindicato de trasportes "progreso" con experiencia de 19 años en el rubro y la esposa  se dedica a la comercialización  de hortalizas. La competencia es media, tiene su propia clientela  ya que por la forma de atender  a sus clientes y principalmente la antigüedad en el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, es el más preferido. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de llantas para su vehiculo. Cuenta con buen historial crediticio en agrocapital, por parte de la codeudora tiene antecedentes negativos esto se respalda con una solicitud de excepción.
texts.en:
Pablo is married, 35 years old, and has two children. The whole family lives in their own home in the Huacarama community. Pablo is in the passenger transportation business and is affiliated with the transport syndicate Progreso. He has 19 years of experience is this field. His wife sells vegetables. Pablo has a medium level of competition. He has his own customers. Because of the quality of his service, and, mainly, because he has been in business for so long, he is the top choice in passenger transport. This loan will be used to purchase tires for his vehicle. In part because of a loan co-signer, he has had some negative incidents (in his credit history), but he has asked for an exception and hopes to do well with Kiva partner Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a 37-year-old trader and she is married with four children. Three are schooling while her last-born is still breastfeeding. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family.

Agatha supports her family through the sale of used clothing and charcoal and has been in this business for a year now. The selling of used clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new items are very expensive for the economically active poor.

Agatha travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on selling kid’s wear, bed sheets and used towels.

Agatha believes this loan will help her save for her children’s future and also help her to rent a store to trade in as she currently sells the clothing through hawking (going door-to-door).

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es: El grupo “Bolivar” estan representadas por la señora Rosa y conformadas por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio de productos como de ropa para todos los gusto y un porcentaje mínimo de las socias se dedican a la venta de abarrotes, pan y a la elaboración de prendas de vestir.  La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The Bolivar Group is represented by Sra. Rosa and consists of 12 members who are mostly engaged in retail businesses selling products such as clothing. A small percentage of the members sell groceries, bread, or provide services such as tailoring. The level of competition among businesses is high, but the members are experienced and know that they must offer a variety of high-quality products in order to get ahead.

The loan that they received will be used to augment the operating capital for their small businesses so that they can increase their earnings. This translates into an improved quality of life for their families, which gradually gets better each day. For this, they are grateful for the confidence that has been placed in them to continue working harder.

The members are undertaking their first loan cycle as a group, but they have previous experience working with other solidarity groups. Therefore, they are committed to proceed with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Villa El Carmen Group

texts.es: El grupo “Villa el Carmen” esta representada por la señora Segunda  y conformada por 12 miembros dedicados y con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante en sus pequeños negocios de venta de pan, pollo, ropa, abarrotes, carne y de servicio  y auxilio mecánico. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The Group “Villa el Carmen” is represented by Sra. Segunda and consists of 12 members who are dedicated to succeeding in their small businesses. They offer goods and services such as bread, chicken, clothing, groceries, meat, and auto repairs. The level of business competition is high, but the members are experienced enough to know that they must offer a variety of high-quality products in order to get ahead.

The loan that they have received will be used to augment their operating capital so that they can continue their businesses and increase their earnings. This translates into a better quality of life for their families, which continues to improve gradually each day. For this reason, they are thankful for the confidence placed in them to continue striving for success.

The members are starting their first loan cycle together as a group, but they already have previous experience working with other solidarity groups. They promise to be responsible and cooperative with one another.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is the 38-year-old mother of four children. She has three children who are schooling while her last-born is still breastfeeding. She is very hardworking and resourceful to her family.

Catherine trades in charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. She obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages in her community. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory.

Catherine has added the sale of phone-credits to her charcoal business. This she believes will bring additional income to support her home. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal and phone credits

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Don Roger E. E. es un señor de 53 años de edad que vive con su esposa y dos hijos, en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, don Roger se incursionó  como microempresario en el área de la agricultura especializándose en la siembra de arroz para vender  tanto en su comunidad como en lugares vecinos, que según su criterio, hay un excelente mercado ya sea por medio de venta a intermediarios o al público directamente. 

Desde muy joven don Roger se ha dedicado a la siembra de arroz, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo; tiene un terreno en el cual ha sembrado arroz anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Roger  es un micro crédito de ¢570,000 (quinientos setenta  mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del terreno, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del arroz y lograr una buena cosecha.

Don Roger es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Roger E. E., 53, lives with his wife and two children in a small, rural community in Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala. It is located in the Alajuela province. The activities there are business, livestock with double purposes (meat and milk), and planting basic grains such are rice, beans, corn, and others. Due to the few sources of employment offered in the community, Roger became a small businessman in agriculture. He specializes in planting rice to sell in his community as well as neighboring places. He feels there is an excellent market selling to intermediaries or directly to the public. Roger has devoted himself to planting rice since he was very young. He has significant experience in the care and maintenance of this type of crop. He has land where he has previously planted rice, and he got very good results when it came time to distribute the rice. That is why he wants to expand his field. Thanks to this business his family’s quality of life has improved considerably. Roger is asking for a loan for ¢570,000 (five hundred seventy thousand colones) to help him prepare the land, buy seeds, fertilizers, and other necessary supplies to guarantee optimum rice planting and achieve a good harvest. Roger is a member of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban” (Datraban Community Credit Company), one of the 100 organizations partnered with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan, and he expects to grow on a personal and economic level. Also, thanks to this type of organization and their ways of facilitating loans, he can dedicate more time to his productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and maintenance for planting rice

loans.name: Mercedes Martha

texts.es: Mercedes tiene actualmente 43 años de edad, es casada con el Sr.Honorato, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo dependen de ella 2, cuenta con vivienda propia, la cual esta de garantía bajo. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la zona comercial de la ciudad a 1/2 cuadra de la plaza, tiene su tienda donde vende artículos de regalo, zapatos, ropa y otros; cuenta con una experiencia desde su inicio con alrededor de unos 18 años. La competencia es relativa, podríamos decir que es media, además el tiempo en la zona ha hecho que ella tenga clientela segura y un negocio estable y no solo vende un producto esta constantemente rotando su inventario de acuerdo a la época. Mercedes invertirá o invirtió en mercadería, un lote de mercadería (ropa, zapato de vestir y deportivo). Mercedes viene trabajando con Agrocapital desde el año 2005 según historial y con un buen comportamiento en el pago de sus cuotas y de acuerdo a informe confidenciales también registra un ideal comportamiento histórico.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 43 years old and she is married with Honorato. They have 3 children but only 2 are still in her care. She lives in her own home and she runs a business located in the commercial sector of the city,a bout half a block from center square. There she has a store selling gift items, shoes, clothing etc. She has been running this business for about 18 years now. There is a fair amount of competition but given the amount of time she's been selling and the well travelled area she can count on her clientele and a steady business. She never sells only one product but she always changes and rotates the the products in her inventory to match the season. Mercedes invested in the purchase of merchandise, a lot consisting of clothing, dress and sports shoes. Mercedes has been with Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner) since 2005. She has always been on time with her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: El Pauro Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “El Pauro” esta representado por la señora Gregoria  y conformado por  23  miembros D. las cuales16 son mujeres y 7 son varones,  emprendedoras y emprendedores, que trabajan para poder ayudar económicamente  al bienestar D. sus familias, por eso es que acuden a la institución D. Agrocapital para poder tener un financiamiento rápido, que les permita invertir en sus negocios, para obtener mayores  ganancias. Es un grupo muy compacto entre ellos, además que se conocen bastante bien entre sus integrantes a pesar D. ser su primer ciclo. La mayoría D. los miembros se dedican  a actividades D. venta D. productos como comida, fruta, electrodomésticos, tejidos, leche, tejas, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, pan y a actividades como la construcción D. viviendas, mototaxistas. La competencia es granD. pero saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. su familia.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "El Pauro" is represented here by Gregoria and 23 other members, of whom 16 are women and 7 are men. These workers strive towards the financial well-being of their family, and that is why they seek the support of Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner), to have quick financing to have funds to invest in their business, and translate this into greater earnings. They are a very tight-knit group, knowing one another very well despite this being their first experience. Most of the members are in sales of products such as prepared foods, fruits, appliances, knitting crafts, milk, shingles, general groceries, and baked goods, as well as construction work and public transportation drivers. There is a great deal of competition but they all know how to pull through, especially because their families depend on them.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Las Muñequitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Muñequitas” restan representadas por la señora Candita y conformada por 13 miembros los cuales asume la responsabilidad D. la garantía solidaria, la mayoría D. sus miembros se dedica a la venta D. productos como zapatos, dulces, cosméticos, transporte público, costura, pan, pero la mayoría se dedica a trabajos como dependientes D. empresas pequeñas que desean levantar un pequeño negocio para respaldar sus ingreso. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group "Las Munequitas" is represented by Candita. It is composed of 13 members and she bears the responsibility of the group. Most of the members are in sales of products such as shoes, sweets, cosmetics, public transportation, tailoring work, baked goods, and most work in small companies but wish to run their own independent businesses that they wish to supplement their income. The competition in the commercial sector is considerable but they all know how to sell their various, high quality products. The loan that they have requested will be used as working capital to set up their small businesses and to increase their earnings. This translates into an improved quality of life for their family, improving more each day. They are very grateful for the trust that they have been granted and they are encouraged to keep working even harder every day. They are currently on their first loan cycle, and they have promised to give all that they are to be successful, responsible and unified.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dario Paulino

texts.es: Dario vive con su esposa, tiene un hijo, viven en alquiler varios años en el mismo domicilio. Dario tiene un puesto de cortado de carne de res y su taxi con el que trabaja personalmente. La competencia en el mercado es media ya que existe bastante demanda del servicio de cortado de carne, por ser esta una zona  de alta demanda de los servicios por estar cerca de las venteras de carne. El destino de crédito fue para capital de operación mantenimiento de su vehiculo.  El cliente esta pagando su crédito con normalidad, tiene algunos retrasos debido a que viaja en ocasiones a otras ciudades. Finalmente se puede ver que el cliente a ido creciendo en patrimonio y negocio. A futuro tiene pensado comprar otras maquinas con lo cual estaría creciendo mucho mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Dario lives with his wife and they have one son. They have been renting their living quarters for many years now. Dario runs a butchering stand and owns a taxi that he drives himself. There is a fair amount of competition in the market because there is a great demand for beef meats. This region especially sees many butchers because they are close to the abattoir. The fund swill be used as working capital to perform some maintance on his car. He has been on time with his payments, although sometimes he has been late when he travels to other cities. It can be noted that he has been expanding his business and in responsibility. In the future he hopes to purchase other machiens to expand his business even further.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 66 years old. She is widowed and the mother of six children. All her children are grownups and independent but she lives with four of her grandchildren. She works hard to provide food and school fees for the grandchildren. She is mostly assisted by her children for finances and other basic things.

Grace is a trader and trades in flour, sugar, margarine, bags of rice, etc., in the market center where she lives. She takes delivery of stock from wholesalers and retails them at her rented store. She has been in business for the last six years now. She requests the loan to add to her capital so that she can buy more stock to upgrade her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sell like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, bags of rice, etc.

loans.name: Solitarios Group

texts.es: El grupo “Solitarios” están representados por la señora Lidia y conformados por 16 miembros nuevos que residen en el mismo barrio y son conocidos y responsables. La mayoría D. los socios se dedica a actividades D. venta D. productos como comida, refrescos, cosméticos, perfumes, ropa y al servicio D. transporte público en Vehículos  y motocicletas. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group named "Solitarios" is represented by Lidia and it is composed of 16 new members. They all live in the same district, they know each other, and they are responsible. Most of the members are involved in sales of products such as prepared foods, soft drinks, cosmetics, perfumes, clothing, and in public transport. There is a great deal of competition but the members have a great deal more experience and they know how to make their businesses prosper, offering various high quality products. The loan they are requesting is to be used as working capital to invest in their business so to increase their earnings. This all tranlsates into a better quality of life for their family, improving more and more every day. They are very grateful for the trust that has been granted, and have even greater strength to work hard. The members are currently on their first loan cycle, although they have participated in groups before. They promise to give all that they are to prosper responsibly, and together.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells meals every evening from her front porch, putting out four tables beginning around 6:00 pm. She offers her customers fried chicken, hot dogs, french fries, hamburgers, and soft drinks. She has an excellent location for her business, near the corner of a main road, and has a good customer base.

Elizabeth has been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for two years and is a member of the "Amigas Por Siempre" (Friends Forever) communal bank . Elizabeth invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in ingredients for cakes and other baked goods, which she sold at her father’s bakery. Although she was able to earn additional income by working at her father’s bakery, Elizabeth wanted to have her own independent business, so she decided to start her little home-based restaurant. Her business has been going quite well. 

Elizabeth used her last loan of 1500 soles (about $500) from Manuela Ramos to purchase a special fryer for chicken. Elizabeth plans to use this loan of 2000 soles to purchase six more tables, better chairs, and food in bulk. Elizabeth’s business has grown a lot. On weekends, she now has more customers than she can accommodate at the four tables she has in her restaurant. 

Elizabeth lives with her partner and their two children, ages 13 and 7. Her partner works as a supervisor at a company that repairs broken phone lines and downed phone systems. 

Elizabeth is glad to be working with Manuela Ramos. She was unable to get loans from other banks because they had too many requirements. Elizabeth also appreciates the educational talks given by Manuela Ramos’s loan officers at every monthly meeting of her communal bank. These talks deal with business-related themes (e.g. how to promote and develop a business) as well as larger themes, such as making life goals, etc. 

Elizabeth "thinks big" about her business and has many goals for the future. Eventually, she wants to buy an extra-large deep fryer for making french fries. She also wants to turn the front room of her home into a restaurant so she will have a larger and more comfortable space for her customers.

In this short video clip, Elizabeth talks about how she wants to expand and improve her business, and how she plans to take full advantage of her loans in order to do so.

loans.use: Higher-quality chairs, six tables, food in bulk for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes que en estos momentos cuenta con 31 años vive en  su propia casa, ubicada en la Urb. El cairo, junto a su esposo el codeudor con 34 años y sus tres hijos de 11-7-3 años de edad.   Lourdes trabaja como costurera en su casa a pequeña escala y su esposo el codeudor como cargador de productos terminados en aceite fino, ambos con sus buenos años de experiencia en dichas actividades. La competencia es mediana en cuanto a la costura, ya que ella tiene sus clientes conocidos. En cuanto a su esposo no tiene ya que el es asalariado y por ende seguro. Lourdes invirtió en la compra de materiales de construcción. Este es el tercer préstamo de Lourdes y los dos anteriores los canceló dentro del plazo establecido. No tiene deuda en ninguna otra institución financiera.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 31 years old and lives in her own home located in Urb. El Cairo. Together with her husband, who is 34 years old and the cosigner of this loan, they have three children (ages 11, 7, and 3). She works from her small house as a seamstress. Her husband delivers refined petroleum products. The both have years of experience in their respective occupations. The competition from other tailoring business is about average, but fortunately Lourdes knows her regular clients. Her husband does not have that problem because he is a salaried employee and has a secure income.

Lourdes will purchase building materials. This is her third loan and her previous loans were repaid on time. She does not have any debts with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is fifty years old. She is married and the mother of six children. All of her children are in school, from polytechnic to the junior high school level. She works hand in hand with her husband to save enough for the future of her children. She enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. 

Hannah owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, bar soap etc. However, a lack of capital prevents her from making meaningful progress. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams etc. to make increased profits. She believes with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Limber Alejandro

texts.es: Limber es soltero vive junto a sus padres, trabaja en la empresa de Ascensores Normalizados como técnico de mantenimiento de ascensores, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro ya que trabaja desde hace cuatro años atrás, no cuenta con competencia ya que es dependiente de la empresa, el crédito que se le otorgo es para comprar un automóvil el cliente contaba con aporte propio para el efecto, el mismo le servirá para poder movilizarse y poder trabajar con el mismo en horarios fuera de oficina, en agrocapital se le otorgo 3 créditos donde demostró un muy buen comportamiento de pagos, cliente de familia humilde y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Limber is single and lives with his parents. He is an employee with the Ascensores Noramlizados, working as an elevator maintenance technician. He has a great deal of experience in this field, having worked for the past four years in that occupation. He sees no competition as he is gainfullyu employed. The loan he is requesting is to purchase a car. He will use the car to be able to travel to work especially outside of office hours. Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner) has granted him 3 past loans. He has demonstrated responsibility with his payments. He is from a humble and hard working family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Kenedy Group

texts.es: El grupo comunal “Kenedy” esta representado por la señora Matilde y conformado por 13 miembros de los cuales gran mayoría del grupo ya trabajaron bajo esta modalidad de crédito solidario. Las socias se dedican a venta de comida, venta de refrescos, pastillas, venta de ropa, los varones se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group named "Kenedy" is represented by Matilde and it is composed of 13 members, most of whom have previously worked with a loan system. The members are involved in sales of products such as prepared foods, soft drink sales, baked goods, and clothing. The men provide public transportation. The competition they face is considerable but the members have a great deal of experience and know how to prosper their businesses, offering a variety of high quality products. The loan they are requesting is to be used as working capital to invest in their small businesses, and to increase their earnings. This translates into a better quality of life for their family, improving more and more every day. They are very grateful for the trust that has been placed in them and they are even more motivated to work hard. The members are currently in their first loan cycle but they have previous group experience. They promise to give all that they have to prospoer responsibly and together as a team.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen sells beauty products from Avon, Ebel, and Natura, as well as shoes. She enjoys having a business and always has her eye out for things she can sell. She has sold different items her whole life. She does not want to have to depend on her husband’s salary.

Carmen plans to take this loan of 2300 soles, as well as 1800 soles (about $600) in profits that she has saved, and travel to Lima, the capital, to purchase more goods to sell. Carmen plans to invest in sandals, clothes, and costume jewelry. She will keep her shopping list flexible so she can to take advantage of the items with the best prices. Carmen usually travels to Lima to purchase products every month or two. The Brazilian shoes that she sells arrive by mail. 

Carmen has been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for seven years. She used her very first loan to invest in beauty products. Carmen now has a number of regular clients, all of whom purchase her goods on credit and pay her at the end of the month. Her business ventures have been going well. She feels that she is quite responsible about her business and repaying her loans.

Carmen has three children, ages 22, 19 and 13. Carmen’s husband is a policeman and is also involved in a business exporting wood. Her oldest and youngest children, both boys, are also very involved in business. Carmen’s 13-year-old son sometimes sells clothing and other items. Her 22-year-old son works in timber exports with his father. Carmen’s 19-year-old daughter is studying management at a local university.

In this short video clip, Carmen talks about her goal of having a home-based boutique from which she can sell different products.

loans.use: Sandals, clothes, costume jewelry and other items

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo cuenta con 34 años de edad, vive en su propio taller que está en alquiler, aunque tiene casa propia en la comunidad de las barreras la misma que alquila. Junto a su esposa la codeudora de 29 años y sus 5 hijos de 11-9-8-6-4 años de edad. Eduardo tiene su gomería con muchos años de antigüedad en plena avenida principal de la localidad donde también vende llantas y aros semi nuevos. Finalmente compra chatarras al por menor las acumula y luego las vende al por mayor. Y su esposa la codeudora es profesora de básico en la comunidad de batavia en la unidad educativa del mismo nombre. La competencia es mediana, esto debido a que existen otras gomerías en el medio pero debido a su antigüedad y ubicación de la misma tiene bastante clientela, mas los complementos que tiene para ofrecer. Como dije anteriormente son varios años de trabajo en el rubro y la ubicación sobre todo en plena Av. Principal final norte. En cuanto a su esposa es mensual y seguro. Eduardo invirtió todo el monto del préstamo solicitado en la compra del lote de terreno que tenia predestinado en la comunidad de las barreras, este seria el octavo préstamo de Eduardo y todos los anteriores los a cancelado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 34 years old, and he lives in his auto shop, a space he rents. He also rents a house in the Barreras community where he has his family: His 29 year old wife and their five children, aged 11, 9, 8, 6, and 4 years old. Eduardo has had his auto shop for many years now. It is located in the main street of the area where he also sells tires and used bearings. He buys and sells wrecked cars. His wife is a primary school teacher in the Batavia community. There is a fair amount of competition in the market, especially because there are other auto shops, but given his seniority and the location of his shop he sees a steady stream of clients. His wife has a steady job and earns monthly wages. Eduardo will invest the amount of the loan to purchase a plot of land in the Barreras community. This will be Eduardo's eighth loan, with all previous loans successfully repaid on time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Las Viviendas 2 Group

texts.es: El banco comunal  “Las Viviendas 2” están representados por la señora Consuelo y conformada por 14 miembros antiguo que se encuentran cursando juntos ya su  sexto ciclo demostrando mucha capacidad, responsabilidad, unidad y compromiso para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que les brinda la institución.  La mayoría D. los socios se dedica a actividades como la construcción D. viviendas, a la costura D. prendas D. vestir, a la venta D. refrescos, comida, pan, lubricantes a la prestación D. servicio D. secretaria. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas como hasta ahora.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Las Viviendas 2" is represented by Consuelo and it is maD. up of 14 other members that have worked together during six past loan cycles. They demonstrated great capacity, responsability, unity and a compromise to keep expanding their businesses with the financial support provided by the institution. Most of the members are involved in construction, tailoring, soft drink sales, prepared foods, baked goods, and secretarial services. The loan will be used as working capital that will be invested intheir small businesses, to increase their earnings. This will translate into a better quality of life for their family, seeing improvements on a daily basis. They are very grateful for the trust that has been given them. They have an even greater will to keep working hard.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Clober

texts.es:
Clober B. G. es un señor de 41 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus tres hijas en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Desde muy joven don Clober se ha dedicado a la siembra de piña, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un pequeño  terreno en el cual ha sembrado piña anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Clober es un micro crédito de ¢585,000 (quinientos ochenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar hijos de piña, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Don Clober es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Clober B. G. is 41 and lives with his wife and three daughters in a community called Saíno de Pital, which is located in the provice of Alajuela. The main economic activities here are livestock and agriculture, most notably the production of pineapple. The pineapple is mainly sold to international markets. For this reason, the development of the community has grown in recent years, generating a larger demand for products and services, which help to mitigate the effect of immigration. Since he was very young, Clover has been dedicated to growing pineapple, so he has quite a bit of experience in caring for and maintaining this type of crop. He has a small amount of land where he has grown pineapple before, and it has given him good results when it comes time to sell it, which is why he wants to expand his crop. Thanks to this business, the quality of life of his family has improved considerably. Clober is requesting a loan of 585,000 colones to purchase pineapple startes and various supplies to give the best maintenance and help possible to his harvest, so in the end he can be rewarded and have a good production. Clober is a member of the communal bank "Luz del Futuro Saino," one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he hopes to grow more on a personal and economic level. He also stresses that he is thankful to these types of organizations and easier ways to access credit so he can dedicate more time to production activities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for his pineapple crop

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through primary. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Comfort sells bags of maize and dried fish at Nkontrodo, Elmina, which she has done since 2001. She uses her income to pay bills. She will use the loan to buy more of the food supplies for resale.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to build a house so she has started saving towards it.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for resale

loans.name: La Esperanza Dos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Esperanza Dos” están representados por la señora Neli y conformados por 15 integrantes los cuales se dedican a la venta de verduras, ropa, comida, cosméticos, trasporte público y construcción de viviendas. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Los Esperanza Dos" is represented by Neli, and it is made up of 15 other members who sell vegetables, clothing, prepared foods, and provide public transportation as well as construction services. There is a great deal of competition in the market but the members are highly experienced and they know how to prosper their businesses, offering variety and quality in their products. The loan they have requested will be used as working capital to invest in their small busiensses, to improve their earnings. This all translates into a better quality of life for their families, seeing improvements day after day. They are very grateful for the trust that has been given them and will work even harder than before. The members are currently on their first loan cycle but they have participated in groups before. They promise to give all that they have to prosper their businesses responsibly.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is single and has no child. She has received schooling through senior high school.

Josephine sells frozen meat and fish at Nkontrodo, Elmina, which she has done since 2006. She uses her income to pay bills.

Josephine will use the loan to expand her business by buying more frozen meat and fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more frozen meat and fish for resale

loans.name: Guapomo Group

texts.es: El grupo “Guapomo” esta representado por la señora Guadalupe y conformado por 12 miembros que asimila y asume la garantía solidaria y mancomunada. La gran mayoría de las socias se dedican a la elaboración de pan casero, además de la venta de leche, a la venta de abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y al transporte público de pasajeros y la costura de prendas de vestir.  La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group “Guapoma” is represented by Mrs. Guadalupe and is made up of 12 members who assimilate and assume mutually binding and collective responsibility. Many of the shareholders make homemade bread as well as selling milk and groceries in neighborhood stores. Others sell provisions to passengers on public transportation or sew articles of clothing. The competition at the commercial level is high, but the shareholders have a lot of experience and know how to advance their businesses by offering high quality, diverse products. The loan that they obtain will be to increase their working capital and to start small businesses in order to further increase their income. A larger income translates into a better quality of life for their families. They are very grateful for the trust placed in them; it helps them work with more aspiration. The shareholders are only in their first term but already have experience with cohesive groups and are committed to giving their all in order to succeed with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operational capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia B. C. es una señora de 40 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Doña Sonia se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a las labores del hogar y también asistiendo a su esposo en agricultura, pero hace poco tiempo tuvo la idea de crear una sala de entretenimiento en su casa para que los vecinos de su comunidad se divirtieran de una forma sana. Desde que inició el proyecto ha tenido muy buena aceptación en su comunidad, ha podido adquirir maquinas de juegos electrónicas, futbolines entre otros.

Debido a que su negocio va tan bien, doña Sonia desea obtener un préstamo por ¢585,000 (quinientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar una máquina más de juegos electrónicos para así aumentar su clientela y ofrecer más variedad . 

Doña Sonia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Sonia B. C. is 40 and lives with her husband and two children in a community called El Saíno de Pital, which is located in the province of Alajuela. The main economic activities here are livestock and agriculture, most notably the production of pineapple. The pineapple is mainly sold to international markets. For this reason, the development of the community has grown in recent years, generating a larger demand for products and services, which helps to mitigate the effect of immigration. Doña Sonia has dedicated a large part of her life to working in her home, and she also helps her husband with agriculture. She recently had the idea of creating an entertainment room in her home so her neighbors could have fun in a healthy way. Since she started this project, it has been very well accepted in her community. She has been able to acquire video game machines, foosball tables, and other things. Since her business is going so well, Sonia hopes to obtain a loan of 585,000 colones to buy more video game machines so she can expand her clientele and offer more variety. Sonia is a member of the communal bank, "Luz del Futuro Saino," one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan, and with it she hopes to continue to grow on a personal and economic level. She also stresses that she is thankful to this type of organization and easier ways to access credit so she can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a video game machine

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.en:
Doris has a small home-based grocery shop. Doris has had her shop for two years and has invested all of her recent loans from Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, in products to sell. She will do the same with his loan of 1500 soles. When Doris first started working with Manuela Ramos in 2004, she sold only beer, soft drinks and popsicles. Now that she has her little store, she sells many other items. 

Doris is married and has three children, ages 23, 20 and 13, and a two-year-old granddaughter, all of whom live with her. Doris’s husband is a regional salesman for a company based in Lima, the capital of Peru.

Doris's business has been doing reasonably well. She manages to repay her loans without problems and is very careful to request only as much as she knows she can repay.
 
Doris tends to sell more when school is in session. Many students walk by her shop on their way to class and stop to buy snacks. Doris uses all of the profits from her shop to help her family, particularly her children. Doris feels that her credit from Manuela Ramos has helped her a lot. Although representatives from many other small banks and microfinance institutions have come by her shop to offer her loans, she wants to work only with Manuela Ramos.

In this short video clip, Doris talks about her goal of expanding both the size of her shop and the types of groceries that she offers.

loans.use: Products for a general store.

loans.name: Jazmines Group

texts.es: El grupo “Jazmines” esta representado por la señora Ana Maria y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales son D. bajos ingresos pero muy trabajadoras y con expectativas D. lograr salir adelante para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias, las socias tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo ya que se conocen por sus actividades comerciales y son vecinas del mismo barrio. Los miembros del grupo desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades comerciales como  tiendas D. abarrotes, venta D. comida al paso y venta D. cosméticos por catálogos todas las socias tienen sus actividades comerciales en su  domicilio y otros son ambulantes.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio no tienen la experiencia y la clientela constante D. las socias, en caso D. que no les va muy bien en el barrio se dirigen a otro lugares para realizar la comercialización D. sus productos o diversifican su actividad económica D. forma que puedan cumplir con sus obligaciones. El crédito esta destinado a la adquisición D. mercadería para surtir sus tiendas D. productos mas competitivos t al gusto D. sus clientes, también para la compra D. insumos para agrandar el negocio D. venta D. comida y las promotoras D. cosméticos aprovecharon las ofertas para proveerse D. mercadería a bajo precio, sus expectativas D. crecimiento que tienen las socias es granD. ya que van cursando su segundo ciclo con la fundación Agrocapital y se pudo evidenciar que existe una mayor utilidad que les permite brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Jazmines” is led by Sra. Ana Maria and consists of 15 members. They are of low income, but hardworking and possess high expectations of succeeding so that they can improve their families’ quality of life. The members have been friends for a long time since they live and operate their businesses in the same neighborhood. They have different commercial ventures such as grocery stores, selling food, and cosmetics sales by catalog. Most of the members run their businesses out of their home, while others sell their products door-to-door.

Even though business competition exists in their neighborhood, the members have dealt with it in different ways. If they are not doing well, then they are advised to go into other areas to market their products or diversify their business activities so that they can meet their financial obligations. The loan that is being issued to the group will be used to buy products that will satisfy their customers and make them more competitive. They will also purchase supplies needed to expand their businesses. Those members who are food or cosmetics vendors will have the opportunity to stock up on merchandise at low cost.

The members are starting their second loan cycle with Fundación Agrocapital and they have high expectations for personal growth. Their loans have proven their usefulness when it became evident that they could proviD. their familes with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a single parent and has one child. She has received schooling through commercial school.

Mary is a vendor of mobile phone top-up cards at Nkontrodo, in Elmina, which she has done since 2006. She uses her income to pay bills.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more mobile phone top-up cards for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone top-up cards for resale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is a single parent and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school.

Theresa sells sandals and shoes in Elmina, which she has done since 2000. She uses her income to pay school fees and other bills.

Theresa will use the loan to purchase more sandals and shoes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a store.

loans.use: To purchase more sandals and shoes to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through National Vocational Training Institute (NVTI). Her husband is a trader

Patricia has a small shop at Elmina where she sells groceries, which she has done since 2007. She uses her income to pay school fees and other bills.

Patricia will use the loan to purchase more grocery items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Patricia plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Siempre Amigas” esta representada por la señora Maria Jesús y conformada por 14 socios que han demostrado ser muy dinámicas puesto que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y unirse mas como grupo; las señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo ya que se conocen de sus actividades comerciales y son vecinas del mismo barrio. La mayoría de los miembros de grupo desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales y de servicio como salones de belleza, tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos por catálogos  y en cuanto los socios se dedican a actividades como mecánico automotriz y otro presta servicios de limpieza en general los socios desarrollan sus actividades en su domicilio y el resto son ambulantes sin puesto fijo. En cuanto al entorno competitivo los socios tienes clientes que se fidelizan gracias a su buen trabajo o por contar con productos de calidad. El destino del financiamiento de para la adquisición de mercadería para surtir sus tiendas, insumos y materiales para agrandar sus negocios y herramientas que ayuden a realizar un trabajo de mayor calidad yen menor tiempo.  Sus expectativas son tener mayores ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida así como tener una economía más estable. A pesar de estar en su primer ciclo los miembros del grupo cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. gracias a créditos con otras instituciones financieras similares a la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group “Siempre Amigas” [“Always Friends”] is represented by Maria Jesus and composed of 14 members that have proven to be very dynamic given that they wish to carry out activities to become closer and more united with the group. The women have been friends for a very long time given that they know each other from their businesses and live in the same neighborhood. The majority of the group members run different business and provide different services, such as, beauty shops, grocery stores, food sales, cosmetics sales by catalog, while one of the male group members works as an auto mechanic and the other provides cleaning services. Generally the group members run their businesses out of their homes, and the rest work as mobile vendors without a fixed locale. As far as the competitive market is concerned, the group members have loyal clients thanks to their good work or because they provide quality products. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise to stock their stores, to purchase supplies and materials to expand their businesses, and to acquire tools that will help them carry out work of higher quality in less time. Their expectations are to gain better incomes so that they can offer their families a better quality of life while being in a stable economic situation. Even though they are in their first loan cycle, the group members count on experience in solidarity groups thanks to loans that they have received from other financial institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to purchase merchandise, supplies, materials, and tools).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells fish and cloth at Elmina. Mary has received no formal education.  She is married and has two children. Mary has been selling fish and cloth since 1990. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy more for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for resale

loans.name: Retoño Group

texts.es: El grupo “Retoño” esta representado por la señora Rosario Mariela y conformado por 15 socias mujeres las señoras tienen su negocio y viven alrededor de la entrada el barrio "el retoño" cuyo nombre lleva el banco. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales como tienda de abarrotes, venta de refrescos y empanadas, venta de cosméticos y venta de comida los cuales algunos atienden en su propio domicilio y otros en puestos ambulantes.  El entorno competitivo es alto pero los socios tienen la virtud de tener puestos ambulantes que cuando la competencia es muy alta se mueven para tener un mercado mas amplio, en cuanto a las socias con puestos fijos ellas tienen a su clientela constante y saben como salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es la adquisición de mercadería al por mayor para reducir costos y la adquisición de insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso diario que representa el sustento de sus familias. En cuanto a sus experiencias crediticias un 60% de las socias van cursando juntas su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad, responsabilidad y unión creciendo cada vez mas para sacar adelante a sus hogares.
texts.en:
The group “Retoño” [“Sprout”] is represented by Rosario Mariela and composed of 15 female members that have businesses and live near the entrance of the “El Retoño” neighborhood, which is also the name of their communal bank. The majority of group members run different types of businesses, such as, a grocery store, drink and empanada sales, the sale of cosmetics, and the sale of food. Some of the members own their own locales while others are street vendors. Competition is high but some members have the advantage that they are mobile vendors that can move to more expansive markets when competition it too high; as far as the other members with fixed stands, they have a steady client base and know how to get ahead. The loan will be used to acquire wholesale merchandise to reduce costs, and to acquire supplies and tools that will help daily generate a better income that provides the means of support for their families. As it refers to loan experience, 60% of the members are now on their second loan cycle together, and have shown punctuality, responsibility, and a growing unity in their effort to get their household ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire wholesale merchandise, supplies and tools).

loans.name: Las Chicas Top Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Las Chicas Top” están representadas por la señora Victoria y conformada por 14 miembros que residen en el mismo barrio, todas tienen negocios propios como la venta D. pan, venta D. ropa, tienda D. abarrotes y venta D. juguetes usados (americanos). En cuanto a la competencia en sus negocios es elevada pero pese a eso saben sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios  ya que D. ello depenD. la subsistencia D. sus hogares. El destino del crédito  es para hacer crecer sus negocios obteniendo mas capital D. trabajo con el cual adquirir mas mercadería, insumos y materiales que ayudaran a generar mayores ingresos que representan en un futuro mejor para sus hijos. En cuanto a sus antecedentes crediticios los socios tienen amplio conocimiento del trabajo en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital en la que van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad para el manejo D. los fondos, responsabilidad en los pagos y sobre todo unidad en el grupo el cual les brinda un apoyo económico para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Las Chicas Top” are led by Sra. Victoria. There are 14 members in the group and they live in the same neighborhood. They all have their own retail businesses selling products such as bread, clothing, groceries, and used toys (maD. in America). Even though competition is high, they know how to succeed in their small businesses because their families’ survival depends on them.

Their loan will be used as additional capital to grow their businesses. They will acquire more merchandise, supplies, and materials to help them generate larger profits and proviD. a better future for their children. As for their previous credit history, the members have extensive knowledge of how solidarity groups work because of loans they have received from other entities similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are starting their second loan cycle and have demonstrated that they can manage their funds responsibly, make their payments on time, and work together so that they can continue to receive financial support and grow as a group.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena K. sells maize at Elmina. Philomena has received primary education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Philomena has been selling maize since 2006. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to finance a building project.

loans.use: buy more maize for resale

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Niño Divino” están representadas por la señora Saturnina y conformada por  12 miembros que residen en el mismo, la mayoría de las socias de dedican a la elaboración y comercialización de pan y algunas a la venta de ropa, comida y F.. La competencia a nivel comercial es lata pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El destino del financiamiento es para adquisición de herramientas mas modernas para realizar un pan de mayor calidad en menor tiempo, también para la adquisición de mercadería mas acorde a las exigencias del mercado en especial para el cambio de temporada. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The group “Niño Divino” [“Divine Child”] is composed of 12 members that reside in the same neighborhood; the group members are represented by Saturnina. The majority of the group members dedicate themselves to the production and sale of bread, and some sell clothing, food, and flowers. Competition at the commercial level is high, but the group members have a lot of experience, and know how to move their businesses forward by offering a variety of products of good quality. The loan will be used to purchase modern tools to make higher quality bread in less time; they will also use the loan to acquire merchandise that will better match the demands of the market, especially for the change of season. The group members will be in their first loan cycle but they already count on experience in solidarity groups; they are committed to giving everything of themselves to get ahead in life with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital (to purchase tools to make bread of a higher quality in less time; they will also use the loan to acquire merchandise).

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en: Nana Ekua E. sells 'kenkey' (staple dish similar to a sourdough dumpling) at Elmina. Nana Ekua has received no formal education.  She is a single parent and has 5 dependents. Nana Ekua has been selling 'kenkey' since 1986. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients for the preparation of the 'kenkey' for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of the kenkey

loans.name: Las Amapolas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal “La Amapolas” están representadas por la señora Virginia Julia y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la venta D. ropa, comida, saladitos y cosméticos por catálogo. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El destino del financiamiento es para adquisición D. mercadería mas acorD. a las necesidades que exige el mercado en especial por el cambio D. temporada, así como para materia prima  para la adquisición insumos y materiales que ayuden a genera un mayor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias y para el mejoramiento D. su hogar. En cuanto a sus antecedentes crediticios los socios tienen amplio conocimiento del trabajo en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital en la que van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad para el manejo D. los fondos, responsabilidad en los pagos y sobre todo unidad en el grupo el cual les brinda un apoyo económico para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The partners of the community bank "La Amapolas" are represented by señora Virginia Julia and the group is comprised of 12 members. The majority sell clothing, food, snacks and cosmetics from catalogs. They have a high level of competence because the women have a lot of experience and know how to advance their businesses by offering various products of good quality. They will use their loan to buy products more tailored to the needs of the market which have changed with the new season. For instance, the purchase of primary materials, supplies and other materials to sell will help them make larger investments in their family and improve their homes. The women of this community bank have ample knowledge of how to work in solidarity groups because of their previous participation in similar groups with Fundación Agrocapital where they are finishing their second loan cycle. This indicates their ability to manage funds, repay responsibly, and, above all, the unity within their group helps them economically and allows them to continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations Capital

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena A. sells 'gari' (manioc flour) at Elmina. Helena has received no formal education.  She is married and has one child.  Helena has been selling 'gari' since 2007. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more 'gari' for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more gari for resale

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana T. is a single parent and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Diana sells groceries at Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Diana uses her income to pay bills. Diana will use the loan to purchase more grocery stock for her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Diana plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock for her shop

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 41 years old. She is married and is blessed with two children who are in school. She has been sewing for sixteen years. She specializes in women's clothing. Her skills and designs are refined. She sews various styles that give her customers a new look, such as children's school uniforms, church attire, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, and the kaba and slit, which is a tailored top and long skirt.. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing supplies, such as linen, threads, and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She has three apprentices who are learning skills for their future.

loans.use: To buy sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Ericka Zulema

texts.es:
la Sra. ERIKA ZULEMA M. AGUILAR se dedica al comercio , ella tiene una pequeña venta de ropa,cosmeticos y variedades de uso personal de mujeres.
su negocio le permite generar ingresos para  cubrir algunos gastos del hogar y compromisos que tiene, de esta forma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos y la alimentacion de su hijo, Ellos
se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Su esposo Juan Pablo se dedica a la caficultura y la ganaderia, ya que Danli es una zona apta para dicha actividad economica, doña Erika ha sabido ganarse la clientela que hoy en dia tiene ya que cuando no van a comprar a la tienda la visitan personalmente en su casa facilitandoles de esta manera ahorro de tiempo y dinero, esto le favorece a ella ya que coloca su mercaderia mas facilmente generandole mayores ventas aun cuando es temporada baja. 
esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio y asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora ERIKA ZULEMA M. AGUILAR has a business selling clothing, cosmetics, and various personal items for women. Her business lets her generate income to cover some costs of her home and obligations that she has. In this way, she helps her husband with the costs of raising their son. They mutually support one another to get ahead. Her husband, Juan Pablo, grows coffee and raises livestock. Danli is a good area for this economic activity. Erika has learned how to grow her clientele, who today no longer go to the store to buy, but now come to visit her personally in her home because it saves them time and money. This works well for her because she can lay out her merchandise more easily and generate better sales, even in the off season. She is requesting a loan to supply her business and to satisfy her customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair accessories, earrings, creams, towels, perfumes, lotions, hangers, powders, and jeans

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German M. R. es un  señor de 44  años de edad quien vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Como parte de las respuestas a esa situación, desde hace dos años se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce, hecho que motivó a don German a iniciar en la producción de leche para luego venderla a esta planta. 

Asegura que su familia  se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo, por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 

El queso de la región donde vive don German es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

Don German desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera y poder iniciar con su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante esto es una de las cosas que lo motiva a esforzarse y trabajar con mucho esmero.

Don German es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
German M. R. is 44 and lives with his wife in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba in the province of Cartago. This is a small rural community of approximately 2,000 people. Its residents are dedicated to milk production and to growing coffee. It has an irregular landscape, and much of the land is maintained as tropical forests. The community has very picturesque landscapes that combine the tropical forest with lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairy farms. El Sauce is located approximately an hour and a half from Turrialba, the nearest commercial center. However, several times a year, the road becomes impassable due to the rains that slam the region. This is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges for the community. When there weren't a lot of jobs in the area, many people opted to go out looking for work in Turrialba or at banana farms located in the Atlantic region of Costa Rica. Currently the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so neighbors are looking to invest in projects in this region to avoid having to migrate to find work. As part of the answer to this situation, two years ago, a cheese factory was built in the community. It belongs to El Sauce's Association of Milk Producers. This has motivated German to start producing milk to sell to this plant. He assures us that his family has been dedicated to this work for a long time, which is why he has been able to experiment with all of the work that it demands. He has also received training from his family members for a long time now. The cheese that comes from the region where German lives is famous throughout Costa Rica. It's a fresh cheese that is traditionally knowh as "Turrialba cheese." "Ticos" (the name given to people from Costa Rica) like this product a lot, and it can be found on tables accompanied by any type of food. For this reason, the market for this product is very good. German hopes to obtain a microcredit of 500,000 colones to buy a dairy cow and to be able to start his business. He hopes to be a successful microbusinessman and to be able to help his family get ahea. This is one of the things that motivates him to work very hard and very carefully. German is a member of the Producers Association of El Sauce, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and he hopes to continue growing at a personal and economic level. He also stresses that he is thankful to this type of organization and easier ways to access credit so he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA MAGDALENA C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual esta ubicada en el Benque, Jamastran, la pulperia opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "GINA".
este negocio le ha permitido generar capital para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña C. es madre casada, tiene 1 hijo el cual lo mantiene de las entradas que le genera su negocio, para que el pueda salir adelante con sus deberes.- 
Doña Magdalena tiene 3 años de estar al frente de este tipo de negocio en el cual cuenta con una buena clientela por la calidad de mercaderia y sus precios que son bajos.
sra. Maria compra para tener buena apariencia de su local y asi poder generar mas ganancias.
necesita el credito para comprar al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señora MARIA MAGDALENA C. is dedicated to selling products for personal consumption. She has a small grocery store, which is located in el Benque in Jamastran. Her store is called, "Gina." This business has allowed her to generate capital to improve her quality of life. Doña C. is a mother and is married. She has one son, who has a play area in front of her store, so she can get her work done. Doña Magdalena has had this business for three years, and she has a good clientele due to her quality of merchandise and her low prices.
