La tienda de Elsa es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, su gran carisma y su paciencia para atender a sus clientes, han hecho de ella una de las vecinas más queridas. Desde muy temprano se levanta para abrir su tienda, ya que sabe que por las mañanas es cuando más sus vecinos necesitan de su productos, pues vende comestibles y otros artículos necesarios para el hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la tienda principal de su barrio. Este es el sétimo préstamo de Elsa con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados incrementará la cantidad de productos que tiene en stock, ya que desea ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Elsa is a hard-working, cheerful woman. She lives in her own home with Marco, her ten-year-old son. She wants very much to give him a good education. Elsa's store is one of the most popular in her neighborhood; her great charisma and patience with her customers have made her one of the most well-liked residents. She rises early to open her store and knows that her customers need her products in the morning more than at any other time; she sells food and other items necessary for the home. The most enjoyable thing about her job is to discuss neighborhood news with her customers. She has operated her store for ten years and considers the most difficult part of her job that she must remain in the store the entire day and may not go outside into the street or do other things. She hopes that her business will grow and become the most important store in her neighborhood. This is Elsa's seventh loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She has been very punctual with her payments and expects to continue to be so. In her cooperative bank, she is very active and well-liked by the other members. With the $700 she has applied for, she will increase the number of products that she has in stock. She wishes to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Edith es soltera, tiene 23 años, Edith vende paltas, productos que adquiere en la la ciudad de Pampas y lo vende en el mercado de frutas de la ciudad de Lima, de donde adquiere frutas variadas como durazno.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de paltas.
Los sueños de Edith son tener una tienda de venta de computadoras.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the cooperative bank Ccatarisun, which means "Let's rise up" in Quechua. Edith is single and 23 years old. She acquires avocados in the city of Pampas and sells them in the fruit market in the city of Lima. In the Lima market, she acquires various fruits such as peaches. She needs a loan of $700, which will be invested in avocados. The dream of Edith is to have a store that sells computers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of avocados

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Delia es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, Delia tiene una imprenta en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro D. L. ciudad, en donD. brinda servicios D. impresiones, también tiene cabinas D. Internet y reparación D. computadoras.
Delia necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que  será invertido en L. compra D. tintas y papeles.
Los sueños D. Delia son tener mas capital para tener productos en stock.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the cooperative bank Ccatarisun, which means "Let's rise up" in Quechua. Delia is single, 22 years old, and lives with her parents. She has a printer's shop in a rented site located in the center of the city. She provides printing services and also offers cubicles with Internet access and repair of computers. She needs a loan of $325, which will be invested in ink and paper. Delia's dream is to have more capital in order to have products in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ink and paper

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 23 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar en los gastos del hogar, es por eso que está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. El puesto de quesos de Rosa está ubicado en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella es una vendedora muy carismática y sencilla que siempre atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es conseguir los quesos más sabrosos, ya que ella tiene una reputación muy bien ganada y la gente sabe que sus quesos son muy cotizados. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender muchos más productos y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales pueda dar a sus padres una vejez tranquila. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rosa con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, igual como hizo con sus anteriores créditos. Ella es una persona muy alegre y querida en su banco comunal y espera poder seguir trabajando bien con todas sus compañeras. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea invertirlos en la compra de más quesos, con los cuales espera incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 23, is young, very happy and a worker. She lives in her parents’ house, and she wants to help with the household expenses. That’s why she is determined to work very hard. Rosa’s cheese stand is located in the Santa Bárbara Market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She is a very charismatic and candid saleswoman who always waits on her customers with a smile on her lips. What she likes most about her business is conversing with her neighbors in the market. She has been involved in this activity for three years and considers the most difficult part of her job obtaining the tastiest cheeses since she has a well-earned reputation and people know her cheeses are highly sought-after. In the near future, she hopes to have a very large shop in which she can sell many more products and, thus, improve her income so that she can give her parents a peaceful old age.

This is Rosa’s fourth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on time, just as she has done with prior loans. She is a very happy person and beloved in her community bank, and she hopes to be able to continue working well with all her colleagues. She plans to invest the 1000 New Soles applied for in the purchase of more cheeses with which she hopes to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna S. is from Binuangan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to Norberto and they have six children, all of whom are in school. She is a new member of PAGLAUM MULTI-PUPOSE COOPERATIVE. Myrna decided to join PMPC because of the loan facilities and other incentives for members. She reached MPC for her capital needs. She has applied for a PHP 3,000 loan to buy farm fertilizers. She deeply wishes that their family's living condition will improve and with a good farm harvest.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her farm

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 22 años, es una muchacha muy consciente y madura, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila. Caminando por la calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, Rufina realiza su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lo hace yendo casa por casa, en espera de que la gente le compre alguno de sus productos. Rufina es una vendedora muy  convincente es por eso que ya tiene varios clientes ganados, los cuales siempre compran sus cosméticos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y ver como su mercadería poco a poco se termina, lleva un año en esta actividad y considera que lo que menos le gusta es caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo. Para un futuro espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza con mayor tranquilidad. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Rufina con MFP y quiere pagarlo a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otro préstamo posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos productos de belleza para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Rufina, 22, is a very conscientious and mature girl. She lives with her parents. What she wants most is to give them a peaceful old age. Rufina does her work walking the streets of the city of Juliaca. She sells beauty products, which sends her door to door in the hope that people will buy some of her products. Rufina is a very convincing sales person. That is why she already has won various customers who always buy her cosmetics. What she likes best about her work is selling and seeing how her merchandise, little by little, goes. She has been doing this for one year. What she likes the least is walking all day beneath the inclement sun. Even so, she knows that this is her work, and she has to do it. In the future she hopes to have a store where she can sell her beauty products with more tranquility. This is Rufina’s fourth loan with MFP. She wants to pay it on time because she would like to have access to another loan later. She is a very active member of her community bank. She is always thinking of the well being of her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to buy new beauty products to offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita M. is from the village of Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Clarita is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Clarita raises hogs for sale. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Clarita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to redeem pawned cocoa land. This will be Clarita's fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her famiy's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem pawned cocoa land

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza T. is from the town of Aloran. She is 42 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Flordeliza sells bananas in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Flordeliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Flordeliza's 16th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth tiene 23 años, es una joven madre de familia que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Miguel de 24 años y su querido hijo José de 2 años, a quienes desea dar una mejor vida. El negocio de Yaneth es la costura, su trabajo es muy solicitado en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza esta actividad. Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y ahora tiene su propio taller, donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es terminar los trabajos que le encargan. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que trabajar todo el día cuando tiene un pedido muy grande, pues ella es muy responsable y sabe que cualquier tardanza podría dañar su reputación de ser muy puntual, la cual ha ganado con mucho esfuerzo. Para un futuro cercano, espera que su negocio sea más conocido y así pueda crecer más, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro y sin descanso. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy feliz de haberlo obtenido, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y apreciada. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará una máquina de coser nueva, de esta manera espera incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 23 years old, the mother of a family, and lives in a rented house with her husband Miguel who is 24, and her dear son Jose who is 2. She wishes to provide her son with a better life. Yaneth is a seamstress and her work is much sought after in her neighborhood, since she is the only one there who does this work. She learned when she was very young from her mother and, now, she has her own shop, where she patiently cares for her customers.

What she likes best about her business is finishing the jobs entrusted to her. She's been doing this for 5 years and considers her most difficult task to be working all day when she has a very large order. She is very responsible and knows that any tardiness whatsoever could damage her reputation for being very punctual, which she has earned with much effort. In the near future, she hopes that her business may be better known and thus grow more. For this, she is disposed to work very hard and without rest.

This is her first loan request from MFP and she is very happy to have qualified. She understands that she must pay it off on time and she intends to do so, since she does not wish to cause problems for her fellow members in the community bank where she is much loved and appreciated. With the requested $700 she will buy a new sewing machine, and in this way she hopes to increase her production and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUY A SEWING MACHINE

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora S. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Nora is married and has 1 young children. To make a living, Nora sells clothes in the local community. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Nora's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yalu

texts.es:
Yalu es casada y tiene 49 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el pueblo joven Nueva Esperanza, en la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace quince años ella maneja junto a su esposo un pequeño taller donD. confeccionan bolsas y sacos D. polietileno, los cuales son usados para el almacenamiento y transporte D. diversos productos; ellos trabajan en base a pedidos y con este negocio solventan los gastos D. su hogar.

La demanda D. sus bolsas ha venido creciendo y Yalu no se abastece para trabajar y terminar todos los pedidos que le han solicitado, por lo que está solicitando un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles, que utilizará en la ampliación D. su taller con la compra D. otra máquina D. coser semi industrial que pueda agilizar el trabajo y D. esa manera cumplir con lo solicitado por su clientela.

Su mas granD. anhelo es tener un gran taller D. confección D. bolsas D. polietileno, y ser una empresaria que con su negocio brinD. oportunidades D. trabajo a las personas inválidas marginadas.

Yalu es una D. nuestras clientes mas antiguas, se le ha otorgado 12 créditos, los que ha cancelado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Yalu is married, 49 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in the new neighborhood of Nueva Esperanza in the city of Chiclayo.

For the last 15 years she has run a small workship with her husband where they manufacture polyethylene bags and sacks which are used for storing and transporting various products. They work based on customers' orders and with the income from this business they are able to pay their household expenses.

The demand for their bags has grown and Yalu does not have enough supplies to work and finish all of the orders they have received, so she is asking for a loan of 2000 soles. She will use the loan to expand her store and buy another semi-industrial sewing machine which will expedite the manufacturing process and allow her to meet the demands of her clients.

Her biggest dream is to have a large workshop for the manufacturing of polyethylene bags and to be an entrepreneur whose business offers employment opportunities to marginalized and disabled people.

Yalu is one of our oldest clients, she has been granted 12 loans so far, all of which she has paid off punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying polyethylene to make bags and sacks

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un agricultor de 61 años que vive con su esposa y con el menor de sus hijos en el sector Sialupe San Miguel, en el distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El goza de buenas referencias personales en su caserío y se ha dedicado durante toda su vida al trabajo agrícola y tiene una parcela de una hectárea que cultiva junto a su hijo con la que ha venido sosteniendo a su familia desde que empezó a vivir en el lugar hasta el día de hoy.

Juan ha sembrado maíz hace quince días y necesita abonarlo, por este motivo está solicitanto un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes los cuales asegurarán el éxito de su cosecha para poder seguir sustentando a su familia.

El presenta un historial de cuatro préstamos con nuestra Institución, los cuales ha cancelado puntualmente, por lo que es considerado  un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer, 61 years of age, who lives with his wife and with the youngest of his children in the Sialupe San Miguel sector, in the Lambayeque district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He enjoys good personal references in his settlement, has been involved in farming for his entire life, and has a one hectare parcel that he cultivates alongside his son, and with which he has sustained his family since the time he began living in his place until the present day.

Juan has planted corn 15 days ago and needs to fertilize it. For this reason he is applying for a loan of 1000 new soles which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer which will assure the success of his harvest and allow him to continue sustaining his family. He presents a history of four loans with our institution which he has paid off promptly, which is why he is considered a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers in order to fertilize a corn crop

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
María Flor es una madre D. familia D. 30 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cinco hijos en el distrito D. Mórrope, ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace año y medio tiene una pequeña bodega en donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.), abarrotes y algunas verduras; este pequeño negocio se ha constituido como la principal fuente D. ingreso económico D. su hogar ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como chofer D. combi (vehículo utilizado para el transporte público D. pasajeros) y lo que el percibe no le alcanza para las necesidades económicas D. su hogar.

Teniendo en cuenta esta situación, ella trata D. sacar adelante a su negocio pero hace algún tiempo se ha venido desabasteciendo D. los productos que usualmente ofrece, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la ampliación D. su negocio con la compra D. mas artículos D. primera necesidad que son los productos que tienen más salida entre sus clientes.

María Flor desea seguir sacando adelante a su familia y, mediante el trabajo en su negocio, brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida así como asegurar la educación D. sus menores hijos; ella tiene buenas referencias entre sus vecinos que la consideran una persona muy activa y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria Flor is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her husband and 5 children in the Morrope district, located 30 minutes outsiD. of the city of Chiclayo. For the past year and a half she has run a small store where she sells groceries like rice, sugar, oil, and some vegetables. This small business has been the primary source of income for her family since her husband's job as a bus driver was not making enough to proviD. for the household necessities. To make up for this, she tries to push her business forward, but at a certain point she began running out of the products that she normally offers, and that is why she is asking for her first loan of 500 sols, which she plans to invest in the expansion of her business by purchasing more of the basic foods that sell out most quickly with her customers. Maria Flor would like to continue improving the situation of her family thorough her work with the hope of offering them a better quality of life, for example by securing the education of her younger children. Maria has good references from her neighbors who consider your a very active and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos: Diego de 12 y Maycol de 10, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy pequeña Edith aprendió a amar la música y a interpretarla, con la ayuda de sus padres se formó en la ejecución del acordeón y ahora es una de las fundadoras de la estudiantina “Santa Catalina Juliaca”, es por eso que todos los años en carnavales sale a deleitar a la gente de Juliaca con la bella música que tocan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tocar con su grupo y salir por las calles demostrando su arte, lleva 20 años tocando música puneña y considera que lo más difícil es tener que tocar varios días seguidos, ya que tiene una gran cantidad de contratos y muchas veces no descansa lo necesario. Espera con el tiempo poder grabar un disco y así hacer más conocida su agrupación. Este es el primer préstamo de Edith con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otro posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una de las socias más queridas, ya que siempre está muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos instrumentos, con los cuales hará que su estudiantina suene mejor.
texts.en:
Edith is a very happy 39 years old woman. She lives in her own house with her two children: Diego, age 12 and Maycol, age 10, who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

From the time she was small, Edith learned to love music. With the help of her parents she learned to play the accordian and now she is one of the founders of the folk music band "Santa Catalina Juliaca." Every year at Carnival, the people of Juliaca are delighted by the beautiful music they play.

What she enjoys most about her job is playing with her group and walking through the streets demonstrating her art and twenty years of playing puneña music (music from Puno, Peru). She believes the biggest challenge is having to play multiple days in a row-- they often have a large number of bookings and she is not able to get the rest she needs.

She hopes she will eventually be able to record a record and her group will become more well known. This is Edith's first loan with MFP and she is ready to pay all her dues on time so she can take out another loan later. In her village bank she is one of the most beloved members because she is always happy. With the loan of 1000 soles that she is asking for she will buy new instruments, which will make her band sound better.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new  instruments

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana tiene 34 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y cuidadosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Leonardo de 34 años y su hija Sandra de 14 años, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobre salir en la vida. Todos los días desde las 5 de la tarde, Emiliana empieza a cocinar su delicioso pollimote (menudencias de pollo y mote fritos), el cual llegada las 7 de la noche saldrá a vender a su puesto de siempre. Ella tiene muchos clientes, quienes conocedores de su gran sazón no dudan en buscarla y saborear más de una porción. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que de esta manera hace que la larga jornada de trabajo pasa más rápido, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es tener que vender en las estaciones de invierno y otoño, ya que el frió en esas épocas es muy fuerte y muchas veces le ha causado enfermedades respiratorias, aun así sabe que tiene que continuar con su trabajo. Para el futuro espera alquilar un local donde puedas vender su pollimote con mayor comodidad. Este es el primer préstamo de Emiliana con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo para poder acceder a otro, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre participa de todas las decisiones que se toman. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar su delicioso pollimote.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 34 years old, is a very loving and attentive mother. She lives in her own house with her husband Leonardo, who is 34 years old, and her daughter Sandra, who is 14. She is willing to work hard in order to excel in life. Everyday since 5 in the afternoon Emiliana starts cooking her delicious “pollimote” (fried giblets and hominy), which as soon as the clock hits 7 p.m. she will sell at her usual spot.

She has many customers, who knowing the great flavor of her food do not hesitate to look for it and to enjoy more than one serving. What she likes the most about her work is to talk to her customers since this way her long working hours pass by faster. She has been doing this activity for 4 years. She considers having to sell during winter and autumn the hardest part of this work because the severe cold weather during these seasons has for may times caused her to be ill. Even so, she knows she must continue to work.

In the future, she hopes that she will be able to rent a location where she can sell her “pollimote” more comfortably. This is Emiliana’s first loan with MFP. She feels a responsibility to repay on time so that she can access another loan. With the amount of 500 new soles that she is requiring she will buy more ingredients to prepare her delicious “pollimote”.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare "pollimote"

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 27 años, es un joven tranquilo y muy trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila. Los días de José comienzan muy temprano, ya que llegadas las 6 de la mañana sale junto a su inseparable triciclo en busca de clientes para brindarles el servicio de transporte. Los mercados y lugares más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca son sus principales zonas de trabajo y es que él sabe que es ahí donde más gente puede necesitar sus servicios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede pasear por las calles de la ciudad y al mismo tiempo cumplir con su trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta muy altas horas de la noche, corriendo el peligro de que su triciclo sea robado, aun así el está dispuesto a sacrificarse mucho. Para el futuro espera implementar un negocio para que lo atiendan sus padres, tal vez una tienda de abarrotes, en la cual puedan trabajar sin mucho esfuerzo. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y lo hará, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que no quiere quedar mal ante el resto de sus compañeros. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su triciclo, puesto que el tiempo ha hecho que se gasten y ya no tengan la misma velocidad que antes.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old, a hardworking and quiet young man. He lives in his parents' house and what he most wants is to be able to give them a peaceful old age. José's days start very early, by 6 in the morning he leaves with his inseperable tricycle in search of clients to offer his transportation service. The markets and busiest places in the city of Juliaca are the main areas that he works since he knows many people there need his services.

What he enjoys most about his job is that he gets to travel through the streets of the city while at work. He has been doing this for four years and he considers the most difficult part of his jobs are the long hours at night, running the risk of having his tricycle stolen. He is willing to sacrifice a lot for his job.

In the future he wants to have a business that his parents can take care of, perhaps a grocery store, where they could work without too much effort.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he knows to pay all of his dues on time like he did last time. He is very responsible in his village bank and he does not want to look bad in front of the other members. With the loan of 1000 soles he will buy new tires for his tricycle, since he has been using them a long time and he can no longer travel the speed he used to.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tires for his tricycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eugenio Benedigto

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene una bodega - tienda que administra junto a su esposa en donde venden abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), con este pequeño negocio ellos sustentan a su familia e invierten en la educación de sus tres hijos.

Debido a los continuos gastos que genera la educación de sus tres hijos, se han visto en la necesidad de ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos que vender así como de mostradores, por esto ha solicitado por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles.

Eugenio anhela seguir sacando adelante a su familia con este negocio y desea que sus hijos puedan tener un mejor futuro estudiando carreras técnicas o profesionales; el goza de muy buenas referencias personales con vecinos de la zona, los cuales lo consideran como un padre responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 48 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. They live in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz located five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For three years, he’s had a warehouse-store that he manages with his wife. They sell groceries and products of basic necessity (rice, sugar, oil). This small business makes it possible for them to support their family and invest in their children’s education.

Due to the ongoing costs of their children’s education, they need to expand their business. They will purchase counters and additional products for the store. This is the reason for requesting this loan of $875 (2500 nuevos soles).

Eugenio wants to continue to get his family ahead with this business and hopes that his children can have a better future studying technical or professional careers. He has very good personal references from his neighbors who consider him a responsible and hard working father.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products of basic necessity for his store

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan E. is from the town of Aloran. She is 30 years old. Joan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joan raises and sells pigs. Joan is just starting this business.

In 2009, Joan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Joan is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Joan's 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es: Mercy tiene 19 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y siente que ya es hora de ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Aunque todavía es muy joven, ha decido apoyar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, es por eso que obtuvo la licencia para vender en un puesto de la escuela primaria “Cerro Colorado” de su ciudad. Ella es una buena vendedora y no permite que los niños traviesos se lleven algo sin pagar. Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es acabar con todo su stock para renovarlo rápidamente, lleva un año en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender a todos los niños en la hora del recreo, ya que tiene que estar muy atenta a toda su mercadería.  Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes que le genere mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo de Mercy con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a ahorrar un poco todos los días para lograrlo. Ella es muy alegre en su banco comunal y por ello, muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para surtir mejor su puesto.
texts.en:
Mercy, 19, is a very happy young woman. She lives in her parents’ house. She feels that it is now time to help with the household expenses. Even though she is still very young, she has decided to help her parents with the family expenses. That is why she got a license to sell in a place at the primary school, Cerro Colorado, in her city. She is a good sales person. She does not let mischievous children take something without paying. On the other hand, what she likes best about her business is to sell all of her stock and rapidly replenish it. She has been doing this for one year. The most difficult thing is having to watch all of the children at recess time. She has to be very attentive about all of her merchandise. In the future, she hopes to have a grocery store that generates better income. This is Mercy’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it on time. She is prepared to save a little every day to be able to do that. She is very happy in her Community Bank, and she is very dear to her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to buy sweets to better stock her location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Del Milagro

texts.es:
Rosa es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive con su esposo y sus padres de avanzada edad en el pueblo joven Jesús Salvador, ubicado en el distrito de Monsefú, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica desde hace una año a la compra y venta de arroz, que es uno de los  productos de mayor consumo en los hogares del Perú, este negocio le ha servido para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos económicos diarios del hogar ya que el se dedica eventualmente al trabajo en construcción civil y los ingresos que genera esta actividad no son suficientes para mantener su hogar.

Debido a la constante demanda ella piensa ampliar su negocio comprando más arroz, por lo que está solicitando un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles, hasta el momento Rosa ha tenido cinco préstamos los que ha cancelado puntualmente.

Rosa desea seguir sacando adelante a su familia trabajando en su negocio, y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is married, has three children, and lives with her husband and her elderly parents in the young town of Jesus the Savior, located in the district of Monsefú 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked for a year buying and selling rice which is one of the products of greatest consumption in the homes of Peru. This business has allowed her to help her husband with the daily household expenses since he works in civil construction and the income this work provides is not sufficient to maintain the home. Due to the constant demand she is thinking about expanding her business by buying more rice, for which she is requesting a loan of 1500 new sols. Previously Rosa has had five loans which she has repaid punctually. Rosa desires to continue helping her family advance by working in her business and so be able to offer them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice by the sack for resale.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Cirilo D. 68 años y sus dos hijos Isidoro D. 39 y Mario D. 28, a quienes quiere dejar una buena herencia. Simona toda su vida a trabajado mucho por salir adelante, actualmente tiene una tienda donD. venD. D. todo, la cual es muy visitada por sus clientes, ya que ella es muy alegre y siempre los atienD. muy bien. A Simona le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientes e informarse sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años en este negocio y anhela que su tienda se convierta en la principal D. su barrio, pero sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para lograrlo. Lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda y soportar el frió que hace ahí, ya que su trabajo le exige quedarse tiempo completo y no tiene tiempo para salir a distraerse un rato, ella desea salir adelante y tener un futuro mejor. Este es el segundo préstamo D. Simona con MFP, se siente muy feliz D. la oportunidad D. crédito y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Ella es nueva en su banco comunal y ha sido bien recibida por el resto D. las socias, por lo cual se siente muy contenta. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para mejorar el stock  D. su tienda.
texts.en:
Simona is 60 and is a very simple and happy woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Cirilo, who is 68. They have two children: Isidoro, who is 39, and Mario, who is 28. She wants to leave them a good inheritance. Simona has worked a lot all of her life to get ahead. Currently she has a store where she sells everything, and her customers come there a lot because she is very happy and always gives them good service. Simona likes to converse with her customers and to inform them about the things that happen in their neighborhood. She has had this business for 10 years, and she hopes that her store becomes the main one in her neighborhood, but she knows that she has to work hard to accomplish this. The thing she likes least about her job is having to stay insiD. her store all day and having to tolerate the cold there. Her job demands that she stays there full time, and she doesn't have time to go out to distract herself for awhile. She hopes to get ahead and to have a better future. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very happy to have the opportunity to have a credit, and she is willing to make all of her payments on time. She is new to her communal bank, and she has been well-received by the rest of the members, about which she is very happy. With the 500 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy more products to improve her store's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo es un hombre de 28 años, vive solo en una habitación alquilada, no tiene hijos y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Endulzando la vida de sus clientes con sus ricos chocolates, Wilfredo pasa sus días. Sentado en una banquita realiza sus ventas diarias, pues tiene un pequeño puesto, en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Ya son 3 años los que lleva con este negocio y siente que ya es hora de crecer. Wilfredo siempre saca unos chocolates de su puesto, para comérselos mientras trabaja, a él le gusta bromear con sus clientes y es muy amable y divertido. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender sin miedo a que llegue la lluvia, ya que la temporada más difícil porque no vende mucho. Este es el segundo préstamo al que Wilfredo tiene la oportunidad de acceder en MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, él es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar más chocolates, así incrementará la cantidad de productos que tiene en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a man of 28 years who lives alone in a rented room, does not have children, and wants above all to move ahead. Sweetening the lives of his clients with his rich chocolates, Wilfredo passes his days. Seated on a bench he undertakes his daily sales; he has a small location in the Santa Barbara market (the most important market of the city of Juliaca). It's now 3 years that he carries on this business and he feels it is time to expand. Wilfredo always takes a few chocolates from his location to eat himself while he works. He likes to joke with his clients and is very friendly and entertaining. For the future he wants to have a sweets store where he can sell without fear of the rain arriving, since that is the most difficult season because he doesn't sell much. This is the second loan which Wilfredo has the opportunity of accessing from MFP and he feels capable of making all his repayments. He is one of the most active members in his community bank for which he is very much loved and respected. The two thousand new sols requested will be invested in the purchase of more chocolates so he can increase the quantity of products he has in his sales location.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 40 años es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos: Zenaida de 21 y Wilson de 18 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. El negocio de Yolanda es la carpintería, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 14 años junto a sus hijos. Se dedican a fabricar camas, mesas, sillas, etc, los cuales distribuyen entre los vendedores de muebles del mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Sus trabajos son de muy buena calidad y el acabado que realizan a sus muebles es muy bueno, por lo que se venden muy rápido. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio a Yolanda es transformar la madera en cosas que la gente pueda usar, pero lo más difícil es trasladar la madera hasta su casa, ya que le resulta muy cansado, aun así Yolanda desea continuar con su negocio y anhela poner su propia tienda de muebles donde pueda vender sus propios trabajos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra y contagia. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más madera para fabricar nuevos muebles y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 40 years old and is very cheerful and hard working. She lives in her own house with her two children, Zenaida who is 21 and Wilson who is 18. She would like to give them a better life. Yolanda has been a carpenter for 14 years and works with her children. They manufacture beds, tables, chairs, etc. and sell them to the furniture vendors at the Tupa Amaru market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca). She does very high quality work and the finish on the furniture is very good; her products sell very quickly. Her favorite part of her business is transforming the wood into useful products. Transporting the wood to her house is the most difficult part of her job and is very tiring. She would like to have her own store where she can sell her furniture. This is her second loan with MFP and she has made all of her past payments on time as she does not want to cause problems for the members of her community bank, where she is well liked for her contagious cheerfulness. With the 2,000 nuevos soles she will purchase more wood to manufacture new furniture and will be able to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luciel

texts.en: Luciel B. is from the village of Poblacion 1,Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Luciel owns and operates a clothing business. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Luciel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Luciel is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia M. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 64 years old. Anastacia is married and has three adult children. Anastacia owns and operates a serviced-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor-cab transport services. Anastacia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (about $21) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anastacia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Anastacia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Joyda

texts.en:
Joyda M. is from the village of Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old. Joyda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Joyda owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Joyda has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (about $63) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joyda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Joyda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antolin

texts.en:
Antolin L. is from the village of Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 35 years old. Antolin is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Antolin owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a motor-cab transport service. Antolin has been engaged in his business for more than three years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (about $187) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Antolin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antolin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase tires and other accessories. Antolin is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Antolin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Regie

texts.en: Regie J. is from the town of Calamba. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Regie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Regie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Hadisa

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Рахимова Хадиса - 39 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Хадиса  работает в ОАО «Таджиктелеком», в качестве оператора связи. Она зарабатывает средне. Хадиса посоветовав с мужем решила сделать ремонт на кухне и в ванной комнате. Поэтому они просят кредит в сумме 1000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, а потом погашать кредит с зарплаты мужа. До наступления холодов Хадиса и муж планируют закончить ремонт.
texts.en:
Hadisa R. is 39, married, and the mother of four children. She works as an operator at the public company “Tajiktelecom”, and earns an average income. Hadisa and her husband plan to finish the renovations before the cold weather hits.

loans.name: Rabeca Nhancale

texts.pt:
Rabeca nasceu em Gaza tem 41 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 12 aos 23 anos, somente os três mais novos é que vão à escola.

Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e conta com ajuda do seu segundo filho nos trabalhos, consegue poupar por mês um valor de 1.000.00MT porque faz os seus trabalhos numa capoeira de aluguer pagando 1.000.00MT em cada fase.  

Rabeca sai de Gaza para Município da vila de Namaacha (Fronteira da Suazilândia) quando tinha apenas 2 anos de idade com sua mãe, esta que andava a procura de emprego. Inicia os estudos muito tarde devido à falta de condições e quando frequentava a 4ª classe a mãe fica desempregada, e ela teve que abandonar os estudos e trabalhar na empresa estatal como criadora de pintos durante 5 anos, para ajudar nas despesas da casa. 

Anos depois junta se com seu esposo que lhe deu um fundo para iniciar com seu próprio negócio de criação e venda de frangos. Tem metido uma media de 2x100 pintos em cada fase, pois ela tem vendido alternadamente para não perder a clientela. Gastando em cada fase um valor de 14.000.00MT obtendo de lucro um valor de 4.000.00MT quando vende a grosso para revendedores, e de 6.000.00MT quando vende por unidade a consumidores locais. Mas, mais tarde, devido a enormes encomendas do seu produto ela aproxima se a hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para aumentar a sua criação (comprar mais pintos e ração) e satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes a tempo.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Rabeca na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro de 9.200,00MT e o segundo de 7.000,00MT foram usados para a mesma actividade. Está confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir novos empréstimos para construir a sua própria capoeira.
texts.en:
Rabeca was born in Gaza. She is 41 years old, married, and is the mother of five children with ages ranging from 12 to 23 years. Only the three youngest go to school. She has no dependents, and relies on the help of her second son in her work. She manages to save 1,000 MT per month because they run their business in a rented chicken coop that costs 1,000 MT for each phase. Rabeca left Gaza when she was only two years old for the town of Namaacha (at the border of Swaziland) with her mother, who went there looking for work. She began her schooling very late due to their financial situation. When she was in fourth grade, her mother lost her job and she had to abandon her studies and work in a state-owned company as a chicken keeper for five years to help with household expenses. Years later, she married her husband, who gave her funds to begin her own business raising and selling chickens. This involves an average of 2x100 chicks in each stage, which she has sold both wholesale and retail so as not to lose her clientele. Spending 14,000 MT in each phase, she earns 4,000 MT in profit when she sells wholesale to dealers, and 6,000 MT in profit when she sells chickens singly to local consumers. But later, due to enormous orders for her product, she approached Hluvuku and Kiva, asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 MT to increase her livestock (to buy more chicks and feed) and to satisfy the needs of her customers on time. This is Rabeca's third loan with Hluvuku and her first loan with Kiva. The first loan of 9,200 MT and the second of 7,000 MT were used for the same purpose. She is confident that she will repay the loan before it comes due and will ask for new loans to build her own chicken coop.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed, to raise and sell chickens

loans.name: Xavier Ordem

texts.pt:
Xavier nasceu em Zambézia, tem 43 anos de idade é casado e pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 6 aos 16 anos de idade, todos vão à escola. Para além dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus pais estes que vivem em Zambezia enviando lhes um valor de 1.000.00MT em cada Semestre. 

Xavier apos concluir a 10ª classe é recrutado para tropa onde conclui o serviço militar obrigatório em dois anos (tempo regular) e de seguida é chamado para fazer um curso de policia numa formação básica intensiva na capital Maputo concretamente em Matalane e é colocado para trabalhar em Michafutene com a categoria de Investigador da PIC (Policia de Investigação Criminal) durante 5 anos.

 Anos depois consegue uma vaga e continua com os estudos e faz a 12ª classe e conseqüentemente sobe de categoria. É transferido para trabalhar no Município da Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira com Suazilândia como Sargento principal da Policia onde trabalha 24horas(sendo 2 dias de trabalho e 2 dias de folga) consecutivamente, auferindo mensalmente um valor de 5.500.00MT.

Com ajuda da sua esposa conseguem construir uma capoeira e iniciar com a criação de pintos para aumentar a renda familiar. E, como não tinham fundo suficiente e com muitas encomendas dos seus clientes, aproxima a Hluvuku e Kiva e solicita um empréstimo no valor de 22.000.00MT para aumentar o volume da sua criação. Tem criado por media de 4x100 caixas de pintos gastando um valor de 28.000.00MT e tendo de lucro um valor de 10.000.00MT.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Xavier na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 14.000,00MT e o segundo de 15.000,00MT foram usados na criação de pintos. Com o presente credito de 22.000.00MT pretende aumentar o volume da criação (comprando ração e pintos de um dia e fazer crescer).
Está confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir novos empréstimos para aumentar a sua capoeira e fazer a criação de novas espécies tais como pato, Perus e gansos.
texts.en:
Born in the Zambezia province of Mozambique, Xavier Ordem G. is 43 years old, married, and the father of three kids ages 6-16, all enrolled in school. In addition to supporting his wife and children, he is also responsible for supporting his parents, sending them 1.000,00 mt per semester. His schooling was interrupted in 10th grade so that he could fulfill his obligatory military service, after which time he took a basic course to become a police man and started working as a criminal investigation police officer in Michafutene. After resuming his high-school schooling years later, Xavier was promoted and sent to work in the town of Vila Namaacha, on the border of Swaziland, as Principal Sargeant at the town's police station. This work, with its schedule of 48 hours on/48 hours off, earns him a monthly salary of 5.500.00 mt. With his wife's help he was able to build a chicken coop and start a poultry raising business to improve the family's income. On average, he raises 4x100 boxes of baby chicks, profiting 10.000.00MT for each 28.000.00 mt spent. This is Xavier's third loan with Hluvuku, and the first with Kiva. His first and second loans (14.000,00mt and 15.000,00mt, respectively) were also invested in the chicken raising business, and now that business is picking up, Xavier needs to invest some more money in it to answer the growing demand for his chickens. He plans to use the current loan of 22.000,00 mt to buy more one day-old chicks to raise and chicken feed. Xavier is confident that he will be able to repay this loan before the end of the 15 month-term, and plans to apply for more loans in the future, to build a bigger coop and start raising ducks, turkeys and geese in addition to chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chicken raising and selling

loans.name: Violeta Lucas

texts.pt:
Violeta nasceu em Inhambane tem 48 anos de idade, estudou ate a 12ª classe não tem filhos. (nunca teve filhos) Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e seu sobrinho que vive em Inhambane enviando lhes em cada três mêses uma sexta básica no valor de 1.000.00MT.

Violeta quando frequentava a 4ª classe teve oportunidade de ir à Alemanha (antiga RDA) graças à bolsa de estudos que conseguiu na sua Escola, onde fez uma formação profissional de datilografia.
 Apos a unificação das duas alemanhas, ela volta a sua terra natal Moçambique concretamente em Inhambane. Mas mais tarde, devido à falta de emprego, sai de Inhambane para o Município da Vila de Namaacha com sua tia. Esta consegue lhe arranjar um emprego na Escola Secundária da Namaacha como dactilógrafa onde trabalha a mais de 16 anos das 7:30 as 15:30h auferindo um valor mensal de 2.960.84MT e vive num quarto no internato da mesma escola.

O salário que recebe não satisfaz as suas necessidades porque está a construir a sua própria casa com o fundo solicitado no BIM (Banco comercial que opera na vila de Namaacha) no valor de 20.000.00MT. não conseguiu concluir devido ao elevado custo do material e aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00MT para dar continuidade da sua obra comprando material de construção.

Este e o segundo empréstimo de Violeta na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 5.000,00MT foi usados para compra de material para a sua obra e com o presente credito de 8.000.00MT será usados também para comprar material de construção para dar continuidade da sua obra. Está muito ansiosa em viver na sua própria casa. Confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer manutenção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Violeta was born in Inhambane. She is 48 years old and attended school through the 12th grade. She doesn't have any children. She takes care of her mother and her nephew, who live in Inhambane. She sends them 1000 meticals every three months. Violeta had the opportunity to go to Germany (the former GDR) when she was in 4th grade thanks to a scholarship she received from her school, where she trained to become a typist. After the reunification of the two Germanies, she returned to Mozambique, specifically to Inhambane. But later, because of the lack of jobs, she left Inhambane with her aunt and went to the town of Namaacha. Her aunt got her a job as a typist in the high school in Namaacha, where she's worked more than 16 years from 7:30 to 15:30, earning 2960.84 meticals a month. She lives in a room in the dormitories there. Her salary is not enough to meet her needs because she is building her own house with funding requested from BIM, a commercial bank that operates in Namaacha, in the amount of 20,000 meticals. She couldn't finish it because of the high cost of materials, and approached Hluvuku and Kiva requesting a loan of 8000 meticals to continue the work, buying building supplies. This is Violeta's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first loan of 5000 meticals was used to buy building supplies, as will the current 8000-metical loan so she can finish her house. She is eager to live in her own home. She is confident that she will have no trouble paying off the loan and be able to request a new loan to do upkeep on the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Fenias Filije

texts.pt:
Fenias Fileje C. nasceu em Gaza, tem 59 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 15 aos 25 anos sendo os  dois mais novos estudantes. Para além dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua irmã que sofre de uma doença mental e que vive na cidade de maputo, gastando 1.000,00MT por mês.

Sai de Gaza com seu Comandante militar em missão de serviço para Tete (província nortenha do pais) onde trabalhou por muito pouco tempo por não concordar com as idéias e decisões do seu superior e foi é sujeito a passar 3 meses na cadeia. Após sua saída junta se a Renamo (partido Político que desencadeou a guerra dos 16 anos no pais) e foi colocado para trabalhar no pais vizinho (Suazilândia) como representante do mesmo partido, onde trabalhou a mais de 25 anos.

Assim, ele consegue construir 18 dependências de aluguer onde cobra por dependência um valor de 100 randes (o que equivale em moeda nacional 350.00MT) e conta com ajuda da sua filha esta que tem recolhido os valores naquele pais, pois ele já se encontra numa idade avançada.

 Apos sua reforma, regressa a Moçambique concretamente na vila de Namachas na fronteira da Suazilândia e constrói uma barraca que dista a 45 km da mesma vila, pois a população da quela região não se beneficiava de nenhum estabelecimento comercial.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Fenias na Hluvuku e Kiva. Nunca teve em nenhuma outra instituição aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos. Tem como melhor produto (peixe, açúcar arroz e bolachas) uma vês que esta localizada perto duma Escola Primária. Ganha um lucro no valor de 4.000.00MT e consegue poupar 2.000.00MT mensalmente e conta com ajuda dum empregado.

Propõe se a reembolsar o empréstimo sem nenhum problema e pedir um outro credito para aumenta com mesmo objectivo para responder a demanda e elevar o grau de satisfação dos seus clientes.
texts.en:
Fenias Fileje C., 59, was born in the province of Gaza, Mozambique. The father of 5 children between the ages of 15 and 25 (the two youngest still in school), Fenias currently lives in Namaacha. In addition to supporting his family he also contributes 1.000,00 mt per month toward the care of his mentally disabled sister, who lives in Maputo. Fenias left Gaza as a young men to go to Tete (in northern Mozambique) on a special mission as a military Commander, and soon after was sent to jail for 3 months for disagreeing with his superior's ideas and decisions. After being released from jail, he joined Renamo (a political party who fought against the Frelimo party in the 16-year civil war in Mozambique) and was sent to Swaziland, as a representative of the party, where he worked for 25 years. His years of work in Swaziland allowed him to build 18 rental places there, for which he charges 100 randes (the equivalent of 350.00 mt per unit). He counts with the help of his daughter to manage the places and collect rent. As a reformed military he moved back to Mozambique and settled in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, where he has since been running a grocery store (located 45 km from Namacha and near an elementary school) serving people who prior to that had to travel much further to find a commercial establishment. Fenias bestselling products are fish, sugar, rice and crackers. He has one employee and earns 4.000.00 mt per month, which allows him to support his family, pay his helper's salary and still save about 2.000,00 mt. This is Fenias' first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva (he has never applied for a loan before). He will use it to increase his stock, and expects to repay it without a problem. He plans to apply for more loans in the future, to keep investing in meeting the demand for his products as well as increasing the level of satisfaction of his clients.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more groceries and basic products to sell at his grocery store

loans.name: Luis Adelaide

texts.pt:
Luis Adelaide Manhiça nasceu na cidade de Maputo vive maritalmente e é pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 8 aos 16 anos de idade, todos encontram se a frequentar o ensino geral. , para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele em sua casa.

Luis quando concluiu a 10ª classe teve que fazer o curso de professorado que durou 3 anos, apos concluir é afecto numa escola muito distante da cidade. Trabalhou durante 5 anos e regressa novamente a casa da sua mãe. Mas devido ao maior numero de agregado familiar ele teve que sair de casa e passou a alugar uma dependência, porque já havia formado também a sua família. Anos depois ele compra seu próprio terreno em Boane e constrói sua própria casa e um estabelecimento no mesmo local e teve que pedir um empréstimo no Banco Internacional de Moçambique BIM.

Anos depois é transferido para o município da vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia onde trabalha a mais de 5 anos e devido a essa transferência perde o controlo de gestão do seu estabelecimento e fica na beira da falência. Então aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00MT para recomeçar com a venda de produtos mercearia do seu estabelecimento, pois já tem tempo suficiente para gerir o seus negocio e conta com ajuda da sua esposa que também é docente.
Tem como melhor produto a cerveja nacional de marca 2M e refrescos nacionais que tem vendido mais nos fins de semana. Tem comprado 10 caixas de cerveja sendo e 10 caixas de refresco gastando no mínimo um valor de 5.000.00MT na compra e ganha um valor de 7.500.00MT e não poupa por estar a pagar despesas de ensino superior.

 
Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Luis na Hluvuku e Kiva para aumentar o volume dos produtos do seu estabelecimento, no valor de 25.000,00MT. Está confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construção de uma esplanada para dar mais conforto aos seus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis Adelaide Manhiça was born in Maputo, where he still lives with his partner and children. He is the father of four kids between the ages of 8 and 16, all enrolled in school. In addition to supporting his family, he's also responsible for two nephews who live with them. After finishing high school, Luis took a three-year teaching course and upon graduating was stationed at a town very far from Maputo. After teaching there for 5 years, he went back to live with his family and extended family for a while, before renting a place and starting his own family. A few years after that he took a loan from the International Bank of Mozambique (BIM) to buy a piece of land to build a house and start a home-operated grocery store. He has been living and working in Namaacha, on the border of Swaziland, for the past 5 years. Unable to keep the store in Maputo when he was transferred to Namaacha, Luis went nearly bankrupt. In order to improve his income, he started a new grocery store in Namaacha, which he manages with the help of his wife, who is also a teacher. He plans to use the 25.000,00MT loan, his first with Hluvuku and Kiva, to increase his stock. Currently, his bestselling products are the national beer 2M and soft drinks. He pays 5.000,00MT for 10 boxes of beer and 10 boxes of soft drinks, profiting 2.500,00MT on average. Since he's still paying for his higher education, he is unable to save any money. Luis is confident that he will be able to pay off the loan early and plans to apply for a new loan, to build a patio and make his establishment more comfortable for his clients.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more groceries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Clara De Fatima

texts.pt:
Clara de Fátima Macuacua M. nasceu em inhambane, tem 55 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 27 aos 40 anos. Todos já concluíram um ensino geral. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua afilhada que vive com ela em sua casa. 


Clara perde seus pais ainda criança e cresce com o seu avo materno, esta que perde a vida quando ela frequentava a 2 classe. Assim sendo, ela fica desesperada e sem nenhum parente que pudesse tomar conta dela. passa a viver em casa de um vizinho. Anos depois junta se com seu marido e fica grávida do seu primeiro filho e coincidentemente seu marido é recrutado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório durante 3 anos. A vida de clara fica mais difícil ainda. Apos a sua chegada a namaacha é enquadrado para trabalhar no município da vila de namaacha e leva com sigo a sua família.

Então, clara com ajuda do seu marido inicia seu próprio negocio de venda de potes adquiridas na capital maputo e revendidas no pais vizinho (swazilandia) por encomendas, nas quartas e sábados no mercado informal shoprite onde a intercambio de vários produtos das 5h às 18h gastando 10.000.00MT em cada viagem.
Tem tido de lucro um valor de 5.000.00MT dependendo muito mais da estação do tempo. 

Aproxima se a hluvuku e kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00MT para reforçar o seu negocio (comprando mais potes, ou seja, panelas de alumínio) – o povo swazi e sul africano têm forte tradição de fazer alimento usando este tipo de panelas -. 

Este e o segundo empréstimo de clara na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro credito foi no valor de 20.000.00 serão usados para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos. Está confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para a construção de capoeiras para criação de frangos na sua nova casa.
texts.en:
Clara de Fátima Macuacua M. was born in Inhambane. She’s 55 years old; she’s married and a mother of 6 children between 27 and 40. All of them have already finished their general education. However, she is still responsible for two of them and also her goddaughter who lives with her. Clara lost her parents when she was a child and grew up with her grandfather on her mother’s side, until he died when she was on 2nd grade. For this reason, and desperate after not having any relatives who could take care of her, she moved with a neighbor. Years later, she moves with her husband and gets pregnant with her first child, but at the same time her husband is recruited for mandatory military service for three years. So, Clara’s life becomes even harder. After his arrival to Namaacha, he’s assigned to work at the Vila de Namaacha and he moves with family with him. Once there, and with the help of her husband, Clara opens her own kitchen pots business, buying products in Maputo capital and reselling them in Swaziland, their neighbor country by packages, on Thursdays and Saturdays from 5am to 6pm, at the local market where she can also exchange them for other products, spending 10,000.00MT on each trip. Her profits reach the 5,000.00MT depending on the season of the year.
