She came to Hluvuku and Kiva to request for a 25,000.00MT loan to upgrade her business (purchasing more pots, that is, aluminum kitchen pots) – the Swazi community, on the South side of the African continent bears a strong tradition of using these type of pots to prepare their meals. This is the second loan Clara receives from Hluvuku and the first one from Kiva. Her first loan was for 20,000.00 and was used to increase the stock of her products. She is confident she will repay this money before the stipulated time, and that she will be able to request for a new loan in order to build a farmyard for chicken breeding in her new house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale kitchen pots (aluminum pots)

loans.name: Inacio Enoque

texts.pt:
Inácio Enoque M. de 45 anos de idade nasceu em Manjacaze, provincial de Gaza (terra do natal do Dr. Mondlane, obreiro da Unidade nacional) tem 45 anos de idade e é pai de 3 filhos maiores de idade e não frenquentam escola. Estudou ate 5 classe tendo parado por perca de vaga para continuar com os estudos.

Saiu de Manjacaze no ano de 1979 para Maputo e teve muitas saídas para as províncias de Gaza e Sofala, sozinho, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Mais tarde regressou a maputo, onde vive com sua família, seu tio e mais 3 sobrinhos sob sua responsabilidade.

Trabalha para uma empresa de segurança (DELTA, Segurança) a mais de 12 anos desempenhando as funções de supervisor e com o salário mensal de 2.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de empréstimos.
 
Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos, também clientes da instituição, e aproximou tendo desembolsado e empréstimos de 5.000,00MT; 7.200,00MT e 9.000,00MT que aplicou na construção da sua casa que vem edificando em fases. todos créditos foram reembolsados sem problemas.

 Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar materiais de construção para dar continuidade com sua obra e compromete se a pagar sem problemas, como condição para poder aceder a outros empréstimos com objectivo de terminar a casa e mobilar.
texts.en:
Inácio Enoque M. is 45 years old. He was born in Manjacaze, province of Gaza (home town of Dr. Eduardo Mondlane, who served as the president of the Mozambican Liberation Front from 1962 until his assassination in 1969). He’s the father of 3 children, who already finished school. He finished up to 5th grade, when he had to drop out because he lost his scholarship. He left Manjacaze in 1979 to move to Maputo and he frequently traveled to the provinces of Gaza and Sofala, alone, looking for better life conditions. Later on, he returned to Maputo, where he now lives with his family, his uncle and 3 nephews he also takes care of. He’s worked on a surveillance company (DELTA, Segurança) for more than 12 years working as a supervisor with a monthly salary of 2,500.00MT, which he uses to support his family and to repay his loans. He met Hluvuku-Adsema through this friends, also members of the group, and he has repaid several loans of around 5,00.00MT; 7,200.00MT and 9,000.00MT which he used to make home improvements, as he’s building his home in different stages. All his loans were repaid without a problem. With this current loan of 10,000.00MT he would like to purchase construction materials to continue with his work and he is committed to repay it without any problems, as a condition to access to other loans that will help him finish his house and buy furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Paciencia Alberto

texts.pt:
Paciência Alberto C. nasceu em Homoine na provincial de inhambane, tem 38 anos de idade e é mãe de 4 filhos de idades compreendidas entre 3 e 13 anos que estudam na escola de boane, na exceção do mais novo. Estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado devido à gravidez precoce.

Saiu de Homoine com seus pais a boane em 1986 e vive com seu marido na casa própria. Sustenta um sobrinho que esta sob sua responsabilidade.
Aprendeu a fazer negocio quando vivia em casa dos pais e neste momento, no lar, vende produtos alimentícios (batata, cebola e outros) que adquire na áfrica do sul. Compra cada saco de 10 kg a 100,00MT e vende a 140,00MT obtendo um rendimento médio mensal de 5.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de crédito.

É pela segunda vez que levanta o credito da Hluvuku-Adsema e no valor de 10.000,00MT que pretende comprar produtos para vender (batata,arroz, cebola e outros).
O primeiro empréstimo foi de 7.00,00MT que aplicou na mesma actividade e tendo reembolsado sem dificuldades.

Compromete se a reembolsar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos com o objectivo de construir uma casa e ampliar suas instalações de comerciais.
texts.en:
Paciência Alberto C. was born in Homoine, in the province of Inhambane. She is 38 years old. She’s the mother of 4 children from 3 to 13, who go to school in Boane, -except for the youngest. She finished up to 6th grade, as he got pregnant when she was still a teenager. She left Homoine with her parents to live in Boane in 1986, where she now lives with her husband in their own house. She is supporting a nephew who is under her care. She learnt the business when she lived with her parents, and now, at home, she sells food products (potatoes, onions and others) that she buys in South Africa. She buys each 10 kg sac at 100.00MT and sells them at 140.00MT getting an average monthly salary of 5,000.00MT which she uses to support her family and repay her loans. This is the second time she requests for a loan from Hluvuku-Adsema for 10,000.00MT which she would like to use to purchase more products to resell (potatoes, rice, onions and others). Her first loan was for 700.00MT which she used for the same activity and that she paid without any problems. She promises to repay the loan without any issues in order to access to more loans in the future to be able to build her house and expand her business facilities.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of grocery products (potatoes, rice, onions and others)

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es tramitadora y su esposo tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como taxi, y es una ayuda para poder solventar los gastos D. alimentación y estudios D. sus hijos. Vive en la zona D. Alto obrajes D. la ciudad D. La Paz en domicilio propia.

El crédito será destinado para el capital D. inversion (mantenimiento D. su vehiculo, y compra D. repuestos). Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a legal documents processor while her husband works as a taxi driver. Both of their incomes help cover the cost of feeding and educating their children. They resiD. in their own home in the district of Alto Obrajes in the city of La Paz.

Teresa will use her loan to pay for maintenance of her husband’s vehicle and spare parts. This is her third loan with IMPRO. Her payment history qualifies her as a good client who is able to make her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance & spare parts

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es: El señor Freddy Aragón 48 años de edad, habita en los cedros, comarca del municipio de Villa del Carmen, departamento de Managua, casado tiene dos hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad, tiene como planes construir un anexo en su casa siendo la cocina. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de responsable de bodega desde hace seis meses, poco a poco  espera hacer sus anhelos  de realizar sus planes y con este financiamiento es la opción. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo el cual  comprara  materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlines, piso y zinc. Ofreciendo una mayor comodidad a su familia y sobre todo un techo digno.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para construir la cocina

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia, tiene un taller de costura donde elabora edredones y camas de bebe, tiene un hijo y esta separada de su esposo, es la única persona que solventa los gastos de su familia. 
Vive en la zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto de La Paz. en casa de sus hermanos.
El crédito será destinado para el capital de inversión (compra de tela e hilos).
Es la octava vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como buena clienta.
texts.en:
Lidia has a sewing workshop where she makes quilts and baby bedding. She has one child and is separated from her husband. Therefore, she is the only wage earner in her family. Lidia lives in the Rió Seco area of the city of El Alto de la Paz with her siblings.

Her loan will be used to purchase fabric and yarn. This is Lidia’s eighth loan with IMPRO. Her payment history qualifies her as a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & yarn

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Roberto C. de 37 años de edad, habitante de Carlos Fonseca comarca de villa del carmen, casado tiene dos hijos, su esposa ama de casa, viven en casa propia, se desempeña como Electricista Automotriz desde hace ocho meses, profesionalmente aumentar sus ingresos para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y unas remodelaciones en su vivienda son parte de sus planes. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, piso, zinc. Obteniendo seguridad y protección para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto C. is 37 years old, married, and has two children. He and his family live in the Carlos Fonseca region of the town of Villa Del Carmen. His wife is a homemaker. Sr. Roberto has been working as an automotive electrician for the past 8 months. His plans include increasing his career earnings and remodeling his home so that his family will experience better living conditions.

Thanks to his loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to buy constructions materials such as cement, flooring, and zinc. These improvements will provide security and protection for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials for home improvements

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, trabaja en una empresa como consultora, tiene un hijo y es madre soltera. Su fuente de trabajo es el único ingreso que tiene para solventar los gastos de alimentación y estudios de su hijo.
Vive en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz en domicilio propio.
El crédito será destinado para el capital de inversión (pago de matricula y mensualidades de la universidad de su hijo).

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial de crédito es confiable.
texts.en:
Carmen works for a company as a consultant. She is a single mother and has one son. Her job is the only source of income to cover the cost of feeding and educating her child. She lives in her own home in the northern section of the city of La Paz.

Carmen will use her loan to pay her son’s registration fees and monthly tuition for his university studies. This is the second time she has requested a loan from IMPRO. She has a reliable credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's university tuition & registration fees

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es: El señor Manuel González  42 años de edad, vive municipio de Villa el Carmen, soltero, vive en casa propia, su casa necesita unos retoques y es de primordial necesidad. Trabaja en la Alcaldía Villa del Carmen desde hace seis meses, con dificultades ha podido construir poco a poco su vivienda. Agradece a ala Institución por el préstamo será invertido en la realizarle mejoras a la casa comprando materiales de construcción como: cemento, piso, piedrines y zinc. Para comenzar a realizar a construir, se siente sastifecho por los logros adquirido.

loans.use: Comprar materiales  de construccion para hacer mejoras a su casa

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es: El señor Manuel López de 42 años de edad, habitante de la comarca nandayosi, municipio de Villa del Carmen, casado su esposa ama de casa, Don Manuel de profesión maestro de obras sus planes es sembrar en una manzana de tierra que tiene para obtener mayores utilidades y mejor nivel de vida. Trabaja para la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de guardia de seguridad desde hace cuatro años. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar productos para la siembra como: abono, semilla lo cual espera tener una buena producción y poder obtener buena ganancias. la cual será para beneficio de su familia.

loans.use: Comprar semilla y abonos

loans.name: Nicolas Jose

texts.es: El joven Nicolás B. de 26 años de edad, habitante de la comarca los cedros, soltero vive con sus padre en casa propia, su objetivo es mejorar el nivel de vida para ofrecerle mayor comodidad, su planes es construir un anexo a su vivienda. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de conductor desde hace ocho meses, ha encontrado dificultades de financiamiento para cumplir sus planes. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piso y bloque y poder construir, lo cual estará con mas privacidad y sobre todo con una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Nicolás B. is a young man who is 26 years of age. He is single and lives in his own home with his father in the region of Los Cedros. He hopes to improve his standard of living so that he will be more comfortable. His plans include building an extension to his house. Nicolás has been working in Villa del Carmen for the past eight months as a truck driver.

He has encountered difficulty securing financing to complete his project. Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will buy construction materials such as cement, iron, flooring, and blocks. These improvements will provide more privacy and give him a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build an extension to his house

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luís M. tiene 43 años de edad, habitante de la comarca Nandayosi, casado su esposa ama de casa tiene dos hijos que están cursando en la universidad. Sus metas son que sus hijos se preparen y que tenga un mejor provenir. Como planes a corto plazo es las mejoras de su vivienda ya que necesita unos retoques. Trabaja para la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen con el cargo de conductor desde hace ocho meses, anteriormente trabaja por cuenta propia. Ha encontrado dificultades para realizar sus planes la falta de financiamiento es unos de las primordial dificultad. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, piso y zinc. Obteniendo como resultado unas paredes seguras y con la comodidad, protección de lluvias y una casa digna. a futuro espera seguir con el crédito ya que es el mas viable por los plazos y a si seguir haciendo las mejoras necesaria.
texts.en:
Sr. Luís M. is 43 years old and lives in the region of Nandayosi. His wife is a homemaker and they have two children who are enrolled in college. His goals include making sure his children are well-prepared so that they will have a better life than he did. His short-term plans include making improvements around the house that require retouching. Sr. Luís has been working in Villa del Carmen for the past 8 months as a truck driver. He was self-employed previously.

He has encountered difficulty completing his home improvement projects because of a lack of funding. Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, flooring, and zinc. He will build security walls that will provide comfortable conditions, protection from the rain, and the appearance of a decent home. In the future, he looks forward to being able to access credit again if more improvements are necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build concrete security walls

loans.name: Stephanie Valeria

texts.es:
Stephanie trabaja como recepcionista en una empresa privada, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su pequeño de 2 años de edad, vive en anticrítico ubicado en la Zona Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito para cubrir sus gastos de educación de la universidad.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada aprueba el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Stephanie works as a receptionist for a private company. Her job is the main source of income to cover the living expenses for herself and her two year old child. She lives in a rental property located in the district of Cota Cota in the city of La Paz.

Stephanie will use her loan to cover her college education expenses. This is her first loan from IMPRO. Her evaluation resulted in an approval of this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: College expenses

loans.name: Miriam Isela

texts.es:
Miriam es madre soltera de tres hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad, trabaja en el magisterio por las mañanas y por las tardes trabaja como secretaria, es su principal fuente de ingreso que sirve para cubrir  la manutención de toda la  familia. Vive en la casa de su madre ubicado en la Zona Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una computadora para facilitar los trabajos escolares de sus hijos. 
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Miriam is a single mother of three children (ages 15, 13 and 10). In the mornings, she is a teacher and then works as a secretary in the afternoons. Her work is the only source of income to cover her family’s living expenses. She lives in the house of her mother, which is located in the district of Villa Esperanza in the city of El Alto.

Miriam will use her loan to purchase a computer to help with her children’s homework. This is her fourth loan with IMPRO. Her excellent payment history enabled her to be approved for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer to help with her children's homework

loans.name: Adolfo Candido

texts.es: El señor Adolfo M. de 51 años, reside en la comarca de San Isidro, en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa es comerciante, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y trigo y la venta de carbón es un trabajo cansado ya que desde horas temprana tiene que andar en los riegos y viendo que no haga plaga para poder tener una buena producción . Esta  asociado en una cooperativa en la siembra de papaya el cual les da financiamiento y asesoria Taiwanesa.  Tiene cinco años de vender el cual inicio con fondos propios y con la venta de ron y gaseosas, este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo  para sus mejoras en su inventario. Con este crédito va a comprar granos básicos, gaseosas  para mejorar las ventas. Su objetivo es  poder obtener lograr un mejor patrimonio para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos, gaseosas y productos de consumo

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es: El señor Marcial es un hombre que a su 58 años de edad, ha logrado mantener su negocio que hace treinta dos años logro poner con mucho esfuerzo, antes se dedicaba al destace de cerdo y vendía carne, en su casa y en el mercado, poco a poco logro ir vendiendo zapato nuevo y usados el cual hasta ahora vende y ha logrado tener un buen inventario. Reside en el barrio José Dolores Estrada en la capital de Managua, casado y con seis Hijos los cuales están independientes unos son comerciante. Da las gracias a Dios que le ha dado salud y poder sacar adelante a su familia, se ha beneficiado en gran manera con los prestamos en Afodenic lo cual ha invertido en la compra de zapatos. Con este crédito espera comprar variedad de zapatos, nuevos y de segunda mano que estén accesibles para el cliente, el vende en un mercado de la Capital de Managua el mas visitados por los Nicaragüense por la variedad de productos y por su bajos costos. A futuro espera poder vender otros productos para obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcial is a man who at 58 years of age, has succeeded, through considerable effort, in maintaining his business for 30 years. At first, he was a pork butcher and sold meat in his house and in the market. Then, little by little he began selling new and used shoes and now has obtained a good inventory. He lives in the José Dolores Estrada neighborhood in the capital Managua. He is married and has six independent children - some are also shopkeepers. He thanks God for his good health and the ability to support his family. He has benefitted greatly from the Afodenic loans which he used to buy shoes. With this loan, he hopes to buy a variety shoes, both new and second hand ones which may be more feasible for his customers. He sells them at a market in the capital Managua which, due to the variety of products and low prices, is popular with Nicaraguans.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes for children and adults

loans.name: David Salomon

texts.es: El señor David Salomón de 33 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, el se desempeña  como soldador y disector de cadáveres el cual aprendió gracia a su padre y es a si que se gana la vida día a día para sobresalir a delante con su bella familia, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 9 y 19 años, uno estudia y el mayor trabaja, el ha logrado comprar mucha de su maquinaria con las que trabaja lo que se le hace mas fácil. Con este préstamo  es el noveno en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por el apoyo financiero ya que ha logrado comprar su maquinaria, con este préstamo comprar materiales para elaborar soldadura y poder dar un buen servicio y seguimiento a su clientela. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. David Salomón is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación in the capital of Managua. He works as a welder and a dissector of cadavers, skills he learned from his father and uses every day to support his beautiful family. His wife has two children, ages 19 and 9. The older child is working while the younger one is still a student.

Sr. David has managed to buy most of the machinery for his welding business, which helps make his job easier. This will be his ninth loan with AFODENIC. He is thankful for the financial support that helped him acquire his machinery. With his current loan, he plans to buy welding materials so that he can provide good service and follow-up to his customers. He plans to continue making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase welding materials

loans.name: Kelin Sujey

texts.es:
la sra. Kelin Sujey Gutierrez tieen 24 años de edad, es soltera.çella se dedica a la venta de sandias, tambien hace comidas para vender, pero su fuerte es la venta de sandias.
cuando ella vende comidas, lleva el menu a diferentes lugares, prepara la comida y luego la va a dejar. la mayoria de las personas le encargan su comida ya que conocen la calidad de la misma, tambien que es muy aseada.
cuando anda repartiendo la comida tambien vende las sandias, asi vende su producto.
en esta espoca las sandias son muy buscadas por muchas personas ya que es una fruta muy deliciosa.
desea comprar varias sandias y tambien ingredientes para comidas ya que la feria de San Lorenzo esta por comenzar y en esos dias se vende mucho.
texts.en:
Kelin Sujey G. is a single lady of 24 years living in San Lorenzo. She sells watermelons and prepares food for sale, but her main source of income is her watermelon business.

She leaves a menu with her dishes of the day at different places, prepares the food and then delivers it. Most people place their order because they know the quality of her meals and because she is a very neat lady. When she delivers her meals, she also sells her watermelons. At this time of the year the watermelons are sought after by many people who like their delicious taste.

Kelin wants to buy more watermelons and ingredients for her dishes because the fair in San Lorenzo approaches and she has a high turnover on these days.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watermelons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia Belinda

texts.es:
la señora Sonia Belinda G. E. tien 28 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villanueva de la ciudad Capital, ella tiene una pulperia queopera bajo el nombre de Pulperia E., la cual tiene mas de 15 años de darles servicios a la comunidad donde ella reside. 
ella tambien da clases en una escuela de 7am a 11am y despues se dedica a su negocio todo el dia y lo cierra hasta las 10pm todos los dias. ella es casada, tiene dos hijos los cuales estan pequeños y depende de ella al 100%.
el dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en su negocio ya que las ganancias del mismo son fuente de apoyo para su esposo y su mama que viven con ella.
texts.en:
Sonia Belinda G. E., aged 28, is married and the mother of two small children who fully depend on her. She lives in the neighborhood of Villanueva in the capital city.

Sonia operates a convenience store under the name "Pulpería E.". This store has served her local community for over 15 years. Sonia starts her day as a teacher; she gives classes in a school from 7 a.m. to 11 a.m. After that she is in her store for the rest of the day. She closes every evening at 10 p.m.

The loan requested by Sonia will be invested in her store, as its profit is a source of support for her husband and her mother who live with her.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy donuts, batteries, soft drinks, juice, butter, rice, beans, oil, bread, coffee, cookies, candy, soups, pasta, sauce, toilet paper, sanitary towels, confectionary, dairy products, milk, chocolate

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mirta Cristina

texts.es: La joven Mirta Cristina de 26 años de edad, soltera, a mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir a delante con sus  estudios  y trabajo, a si como ayudar a sus padres, reside en Villa del carmen carretera vieja a León,  sus planes es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, ella se desempeña como Concejal  en la alcaldía Villa el Carmen, anteriormente trabaja en el banco central como técnico administrativo en relaciones publicas. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su casa que ha sido su mayor anhelo, a si como culminar su carrera de derecho,   a futuro espera lograr mejores beneficios, da las gracia a la institución por el financiamiento obtenido para lograr su objetivo.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para terminar de hacer su casa

loans.name: Enma Olimpia

texts.es:
la señora Enma Olimpia R. R. tiene 39 años de edad y vive en la colonia Villanueva, tiene un negocio de venta de cosmeticos y tambien vende ropa interior para dama y caballero.
las cuales los vende de manera ambulante en la colonia villanueva y en colonia aledañas a la misma, ella tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, con las ganancias le ayuda a su esposo para el manenimiento del hogar (alimantacion, educacion, vestimenta y gastos de salud). con el credito que esta solicitando ella piensa comprar mas cosmeticos con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles mejor servicio y variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: compra de cosmeticos

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wendy Argentina

texts.es:
la señora Wendy Argentina G. E. tiene 33 años de edad, ella tiene una pulperia y tambien vende cosmeticos y productos de uso personal. estos productos de uso personal tambien los vende a sus compañeros de trabajo, ella tiene un trabajo en la morgue nacional del ministerio publico de honduras. por las tardes ella atiende su pulperia.
tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ella, gracias a este negocio ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos con alimentacion, hogar y salud.
el credito que ella esta solicitando lo va a invertir en comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio y asi brindarle a sus clientes buenos productos.
texts.en:
Wendy Argentina G. E., aged 33, is the mother of two children who depend on her.

She works at the national mortuary of the Government of Honduras. In the afternoon she operates a convenience store and sells cosmetics and products of personal use. She sells these products of personal use also to her work colleagues at the mortuary. The profit from her store allows her to take care of her children and to provide them with food, a home and good health.

Wendy applies for this loan to buy more merchandise for her store and thus offer better products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy deodorants, creams, lotions, soft drinks, medical powders, donuts, eggs, bread, cookies, candy, milk, juice, butter, margarine, oil, beans, rice, sugar, paper

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
la sra. PablaR. tiene 52 años de edad, ella vive en la colonia Buena Vista, se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ademas los fines de semana vende carne asada de res y cerdo con su esposo en el mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo.
tiene 10 años de tener su negocio, necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio y tambien quiere comprar mas carnes y embutidos, ya que este producto tiene mayor demanda.

loans.use: compra de sopas, jugos, pastas, salsas, lacteos, manteca, frijoles, huevos, tortillas, mantequilla, harina, pastillas, chiles, sal, especias, condimenntos, rasuradoras, jabones, detergente.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
el señor Abel B. R. es mayor de edad, casado, tiene 42 años y vive en la colonia San Franciso en San Lorenzo, Valle. 
el tiene 8 años de dedicarse ala compra y venta de helados, su compañera de hogar es Eva Nuñez con quien ha procreado 3 hijos.
el vende de todo tipo de helados como ser paletas rellenas, conos, vasitos, capuchinos, este porducto lo mantiene en su casa en un  frezer y el tiene una carreta para venderlo ambulantemente, sale a vender a diferentes barrios y colonias.
es esta ciudad se vende mucho las paletas y el ice cream ya que es una ciudad puerto y esta pegada al mar, hace mucha calor en esa zona.
el necesita el credito para comprar algunos productos que sus clientes le piden, pero a veces el no los tiene por falta de dinero para comprarlos.
su sueño es tener varias carretas de paletas. asi mismo contribuir con empleos a mas personas.

loans.use: compra de paletas, conos, vasitos de ice cream,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La  Sra. Maria del Rosario se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser , tacos, pan con carne, Hotdog, tortillas con quesillo, yuca y refrescos, comienza a vender a las cinco de la tarde, tiene clientes fijos, que hacen sus pedidos via telefono y tambien vende en su casa ya que prepara ricos bocadillos, es amable y muy conocida en su colonia, lo cual le ayudado a tener buenas ventas
asi mismo con su negocio le ayudado a su esposo a salir adelante y cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo quien trbaja en empresa privada, ella solicita el credito para poder invertir en materia prima como ser pollo, quesillo, queso, carnes rojas, aceite y otros, ya que compra a diario sus productos y
desea comprarlos al por mayor y obtener mejores ganancias, su meta a corto plazo es remodelar mas su cocina.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario sells food such as tacos, bread with meat filling, hotdogs, quesadillas, yucca (cassava) and soft drinks. She starts selling at 5:00 p.m. and has established customers who request orders by phone. She also sells from home, as she prepares delicious sandwiches and is friendly and well-known by local residents, who help her have good sales. In addition to her business, she helps her husband and receives support from her son, who works in a private enterprise. Maria del Rosario is requesting a loan to invest in raw materials such as chicken, cheese, red meat, and oil. She buys products daily and hopes to buy in bulk and generate better income. Her short-term goal is to remodel her kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken, beef, and pork, maize flour, tortillas, sauces, spices, condiments, soft drinks, juices, oil, vegetables, plates, glasses, forks, napkins, cheese, hotdog buns.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Doña Zoila se dedica a la venta de tortillas se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana a ir a quebrar el maiz y asi elaborar sus tortillas ya que desde muy temprano es visitada por sus clientes, ella vende en su casa desde hace tres años, tambien sale a vender a la Col. Arturo Quezada queda a 20 minutos de su casa caminando y las vende de casa en casa ya que tiene sus clientes fijos que les vende a la hora del almuerzo, de su negocio dependen sus dos hijas de 8 y 13 años las cuales le ayudan a entrgar el producto, con el prestamo desea aumentar su produccion para empezar a  vender 
mas tortillas, 
Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, el trabaja en el departamneto de Olancho y viene cada quince dias a ver a su esposa y sus dos hijas su meta a corto plazo es tener un negocio de ropa venta de ropa.

loans.use: compra de leña, maiz, agua, cal.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Unidas está conformado por Lidia del Socorro V. G., Vilma del Carmen M. C. y Yolanda del Carmen B. R., tres mujeres provenientes de  la Comarca Los Altos; Ubicada en la carretera a Tipitapa. Este Grupo, inicia ya el Treceavo ciclo de crédito con ADIM y se sienten orgullosas de su trabajo desempeñado a lo largo de estos tres años.

La coordinadora es Doña Lidia V., de treinta y cinco años de edad, quien emprendió hace cinco años el reto de crear  su propio negocio, ya que su trabajo en La Zona Franca de Tipitapa  no le proporcionaba el dinero suficiente para las necesidades de su hogar. Así decidió iniciar la venta de granos básicos en su casa y ha ido incrementando la variedad de productos con cada ciclo de crédito en ADIM.

Doña Vilma M. quien vende cosméticos de la Zermat en la Zona Franca y Doña Yolanda B. quien distribuye cosméticos de la Vogue en su comarca, son las otras dos integrantes del grupo. Ellas creen poder seguir creciendo a través de los créditos y capacitaciones que han recibido
texts.en:
The Las Unidas group is formed by Lidia del Socorro V. G., Vilma del Carmen M. C. and Yolanda del Carmen B. R.. These three women are from the Los Altos region, which is located on the highway to Tipitapa. This group is starting their thirteenth loan cycle with ADIM. They feel proud of their work for having managed it over three year. Lidia V. is the coordinator. She is 35 years old. Five years ago she undertook the challenge of starting her own business. She did this because her work in the Zona Franca de Tipitapa did not provide enough money for her household necessities. She decided to start selling basic grains in her house. She has been increasing the variety of products with each loan cycle with ADIM. Vilma M. sells Zemat cosmetics in the Zona Franca. Yolanda B. distributes Vogue cosmetics in her region. They believe that they can keep growing through the loans and trainings they have received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Keep stocking her mini market to increase the level of sales

loans.name: Grupo Pasacguin Group

texts.es: El grupo de mujeres pasacguin son originario de paraje pacana del Municipio de Sancristobal Totonicapan ser un grupo de doce personas humildes y sencillos que cada dia ven la necesidad de progresar para el bienestar de su familia. su actividad principal es la crianza de aves hoy necesita de un credito para comprar mas aves ya que dicho grupo cuenta con cinco mil pollos ponedoras dicha actividad lo vienen realizando mas de doce años  y cuando iniciaron  con diz pollos para cada persona  hoy necesitan el apoyo de ASDIR para poder desarrollarse economicamente para mejor el nivel de vida de cada persona.
texts.en:
The women of Pasacguin Group are from Paraje Pacana in the Municipality of San Cristobal, Totonicapan, Guatemala. They are twelve humble and simple people who see every day the necessity of progressing for the benefit of their families. Their principal activity is raising farm fowl. They have been involved in this activity for more than twelve years, beginning with just 10 chickens apiece. Now they have more than 5,000 egg-laying hens.

They need this loan to buy more chickens. And, now, they need the assistance of ASDIR to develop economically, in order to improve the standard of living of each person.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL TO BUY MORE CHICKENS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of more bundles of stuffed animals.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: La señora Amelia es cliente antigua, en su historial crediticio no tiene dias de atraso,su esposo se dedica a la produccion de enaguas y deportivos y ella a la venta de esas prendas, en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, tiene 3 hijos que actualmente estan estudiando, ellos piensan trabajar fuerte para construir un patrimonio para sus hijos, el destino del credito es la compra de rollos de encaje.
texts.en:
Amelia is an old client; in her credit history she shows no delayed payments. Her husband dedicates himself to the production of traditional underskirts and sports clothing, and she sells these garments at the different markets in the city of El Alto. She has 3 children that are currently studying. Amelia and her husband plan to work hard to build a patrimony for their children. The loan will be used to purchase rolls of lace.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and lace for production.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA TIENE UN PUESTO D. COMIDA EN LA CALLE A UNA CUADRA D. SU VIVIENDA ELLA ANTES TENIA UNA IMPRENTA CON EL ESPOSO PERO FUERON VICTIMAS D. UN ROBO Y DESD. ENTONCES SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. COMIDA Y A LA COSTURA PARA MANTENERSE, ELLA ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE CON SUS CUOTAS Y PAGA PUNTUALMENTE.
texts.en:
Amalia has a food stall on the street one block from her home. Previously, she had a printing press with her husband but they were victims of a robbery and since then she has sold food and done some sewing to maintain their livelihood. She is a hard worker, is responsible with her payments and pays on time.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Daniel Franklin

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel es cliente nuevo y viene recomendado por una de nuestras clientes.  La actividad economica que el desempeña es la atencion de su consultorio Odontologico ubicado en la zona del Rosario.  El vive en casa familiar donde cuenta con un departamento independiente con su esposa y su pequeño hijo.  El señor B. invertira el prestamo en la compra instrumental medico y medicamentos que seran utilizados en el desempeño diario de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Daniel is new client that was recommend by one of our clients. He works as dentist in his office located in the Rosario zone. He lives in his family’s house where he has an individual apartment in which he lives with his wife and small child. Mr. B. will invest the loan in the purchase of medical instruments and medicine that will be used to carry out his daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The client will invest in the purchase of medical instruments and supplies for his office.

loans.name: Liz Anghela

texts.es: La señora, es una cliente nueva de la institución, ella  se dedica a la venta de accesorios para teléfonos celulares en la zona 16 de julio, su negocio es ambulante, su esposo se dedica a la venta de artefactos al por mayor que lo distribuye en las zonas mas concurridas de La Paz, su tenencia de vivienda es familiar por lo cual su domicilio es de su padre, ellos en futuro piensan adquirir una casa propia pero por el momento y por la falta de capital viven en la casa de sus padres, la pareja actualmete tiene un solo hijo que tiene dos años de edad. La Sra. Liz I. invertira el préstamo en la compra de mascaras para teléfono celulares.
texts.en:
This woman is a new client of our Institution. She sells cellular phone accessories in the “16 de Julio” area door-to-door. Her husband sells devices wholesale for distribution in the most crowded areas of La Paz. They currently live with her parents because they lack the capital at the moment to buy a house. However, they hope to have their own home in the future. The couple has two year old son.

Sra. Liz I. will use her loan to purchase cell phone covers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cell phone covers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana, es una cliente nueva de la institución, al momento de la visita demostro que tiene buena actitud y buen caracter, se dedica a la elaboración de mantas de vicuña, trabaja en su mismo domicilio, pero al mismo tiempo contrata a otras tejedoras para que le ayuden a la elaboración de estas, la manta de vicuña, que es un animal comun que habita en la region del occidente de Bolivia, es una vestimenta auctoctona que utilizan las señoras de esa region, su puesto es ambulante es decir que reparte a las vendedoras de las diferentes zonas de la ciudad de El Alto, a la señora se le podria considerar como una mujer que genera fuentes de trabajo, ella aparte de la venta, produce y da a terceras personas para que realicen la labor de tejidos de mantas. su esposo Lucio Vino  es chofer propietario, la pareja actualmente tiene cinco hijos alguno de ellos estudian y otros trabajan. La Sra. Juana invertira el préstamo en la compra de lana de vicuña para el tejido de mantas.

loans.use: Invertira el credito en la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca es cliente antigua, es su primer credito en forma individual, con respecto a su actitud de pago la señora hasta el momento no ha tenido problemas. La señora se dedica a la venta de frazadas, edredones y artiulos electricos a credito. La señora vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijo pequeño, la cliente invertira en la compra de frazadas, edredones y articulos varios por mayor.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is a long-time client, but this is her first individual loan. So far, she has not had any problems making her payments.

Doña Francisca sells electric blankets, quilts, and electrical appliances on credit. She lives in her own home with her husband and young son. She will use her loan to buy electric blankets, quilts, and other items wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electric blankets & quilts

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El sr. Sergio tiene su salon de billar (pool) en su domicilio, está con esta actividad diez años, y es conocido en la zona, vive con su mamá y su hermano, ambos colaboran con los gastos de la casa ya que su papá falleció hace un año, ellos son el apoyo para su mamá. No tiene créditos en otra institución, y el crédito será invertido en la compra del paño para cambiar a las mesas y refaccionar el piso para darle mejor aspecto al salón.
texts.en:
Sr. Sergio operates a billiard (pool) hall out of his home. He has been in business for 10 years and is well-known in the area. He lives with his mother and brother, who both work in order to pay the household expenses since his father passed away one year ago. Both he and his brother are the support for their mother.

He does not have outstanding debts with any other institution. Sergio will use his loan to purchase cloth to recover his tables and refinish the floor in order to give his establishment a better appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth (felt) to recover his pool tables & refinish the floor

loans.name: Once Por Ciento Group

texts.es: Banco D. Emprendimiento: ONCE POR CIENTO fue fundado el 29 D. julio D. 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir.Está compuesto por 11 personas, como Presidenta tenemos a la señora: Rosmery V. F., se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos mediante revista Avon y Yambal, es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas. Tesorera: Maria Gumercinda Z. es socia antigua del Banco D. Emprendimiento Once Porciento, se dedica al rubro D. venta D. perfumes y cosmeticos D. Yanbal y Esika, ademas D. trabajar como empleada D. limpieza, dentro del rubro tiene 9 años D. antiguedad y tambien realiza labores D. casa. Con los ingresos que persibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia, tiene 4 hijos,es viuda por eso es que ella trabaja incansablemente, las socias del grupo la consideran un ejemplo. Secretaria:Yoissy G. C., se dedica a la venta D. productos por catalogo, perfumes y cosmeticos,tiene 23 años D. edad, y 5 años D. antigüedad en el rubro, trabaja D. lunes a viernes 6 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es atender a la gente que visita su domicilio y a las personas que ella visita para ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: Incremento de Capitales de Trabajo y Mercaderia

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Isabel es cliente antigua, demostrando buena actitud y ganas de superacion personal.  Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y zapatos por catalogo, ofreciendo sus productos en oficinas de la ciudad.  La señora invertira el prestamo en la compra de cosmeticos que se encuentren en oferta y en el incremento de mercaderia para asi poder ofrecer a su clientela una mayor diversidad de productos.

loans.use: La cliente invertira en el incremento de mercaderia para el negocio

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Don Fidel es cliente antiguo, no presento hasta la hecha problema alguno por el contrario siempre ha reflejado ser una persona responsable.  La actividad a la que se dedica es la de transporte publico ya que el cuenta con un minibus inscrito en un sindiato.  El ciente invertira en la compra de repuestos para el minibus.
texts.en:
Don Fidel is a longtime client. He has not presented any problems for us. In fact, he has always demonstrated that he is a responsible person. Don Fidel is in the public transportation business; he drives a minibus that is registered with the trade union. He will use his loan to buy spare parts for the minibus.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for a minibus

loans.name: Cesar Natalio

texts.es: Don Cesar se encuentra en su tercera secuencia, dentro de su historial crediticio no ha reportado problema alguno, pudiendose apreciar que es un buen cliente.  El vive en la casa de sus padres. Don Cesar ayuda a sus padres en sus gastos.  La actividad economica a la cual se dedica es la de transporte publico.  La inversion del prestamo estara destinada para la compra de bateria y llantas nuevas para su movilidad.

loans.use: Comprara llantas y bateria para el vehiculo

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: La señora Benigna es cliente antigua. La actividad economica que realiza es la atencion diaria de la tienda de barrio que esta ubicada casi al frente de su domicilio en la cual expende viveres, conservas, golosinas, lacteos y fruta.  Los dias viernes y sabados vende fruta de temporada en el Mercado Rodriguez.  Ella vive en la casa de su suegra con sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la atencion de la tienda. La señora Benigna invertira el dinero del prestamo en la compra de viveres(arroz, fideo y azucar) por mayor ademas tambien comprara fruta para surtir el puesto que tienen elmmercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Benigna is a longtime client. Every day, she runs a neighborhood store located in front of her home where she sells groceries, preserves, candy, dairy products and fruit. On Fridays and Saturdays, she sells seasonal fruit at the Rodriguez Market. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her children, who also help tend the store.

Sra. Benigna will use her loan to buy groceries (rice, noodles and sugar) wholesale. At the same time, she will also acquire fruit so that she can restock her stand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & inventory for her fruit stand

loans.name: Jimena Aneyda

texts.es: La Sra. Jimena C. tiene el negocio de juguetes, ella tiene dos hijos, los cría sola ya que esta separada de su esposo, su negocio está ubicado en una de las zonas mas comerciales de juguetes al por mayor y por menor, solicita crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo con novedades en juguetes, vende juguetes desde los mas pequeños y simples hasta los mas grandes y novedosos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jimena C. operates a toy store. She has two children and raises them by herself since she is separated from her husband. Her business is located in a commercial area where toys are sold wholesale and at retail.

She is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to increase her inventory of novelty toys, ranging from the smallest and simplest toys to ones that are larger and more original.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of toys

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.en: N. Haawa is a hard working lady who believes that without money, life is hard. She is a single mother of 4 children aged 14 – 3 years ensuring that all their needs are met with the urgency they desire. She has a business of keeping poultry at her home in Walusubi for 3 years and the quality of chicks she gets enable her to stay in business and earn much. This kind of business is too competitive but since her produce is good, she is worried less about this. She is able to make 40,000/= as profit a week hence being able to save to her business and family. This is Haawa’s 1st loan with the group and she is planning to add more capital in her business by buying more feeds and booking more chicks for business expansion.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feeds and more day old chicks for farm expansion.

loans.name: Jalia's Group

texts.en: I. Jalia is a widow with 6 children as she cares for 5 orphans. She is a multi business lady with a grazing business, a trader and at the same time a farmer in Mpunge for 10 years. She does all these on a small scale so as to be able to run her family and mainly due to the limited capital she does and as a result, she is able to make weekly profits of 100,000/= due to her customer care skills and favorable pricing. She hopes to boost and expand her business especially after her children complete school so that she could develop more. She is a friendly and determined lady and these attributes have won her friends.

loans.use: Buying matooke produce for resale and employing manpower on her farm for more profits.

loans.name: Filida's Group

texts.en:
M. Filida is 48 years old. She is married with 6 children between 20 and 30 years of age. She also has 9 dependents, including one adopted child who is 6 years old. Filida is a fish monger on Lake Victoria. She sells her fish at Mpunge–Buleebi Kachanga. Thanks to previous loans, she also has 12 cows and sells 40 litres of milk per week for additional income.

She is also a farmer and this helps to provide food for home consumption and the excess is sold off for an income. Her specific purpose for this loan is to buy more fishing materials and employ labour on her farm so that she could earn more.

loans.use: Buying fishing materials and employing labour on her farm.

loans.name: Prisca's Group

texts.en: N. Prisca is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is 34 years old and married with seven children aged 17 – 6 years as she cares for her siblings. She is a strong business woman involved in the sale of agricultural produce for 8 years now. A brief background of her business is that she started very small with selling matooke as a retailer but now sells on wholesale to other people in the same business. Her biggest challenge is the scarcity of produce especially during bad seasons which hikes the prices of everything, but with the loans and availability of capital, all this becomes history. Her business centre is Kiyoola and she is able to make weekly profits of 80,000/= hence being able to meet her family needs and saving for her children’s education. Prisca needs a loan to help add more capital to her business by buying more matooke for resale.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Kotilda's Group

texts.en: N. Kotilda is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is widow with seven children to cater for of which 4 are in school as she cares for more orphans and other siblings. Kotilda has a bar in Kiyoola centre that sells beers, sodas, wines and local brew and she also sells agricultural products from the same location for 26 years. Before these businesses, Kotilda was a shop keeper with a retail shop but changed due to a lot of competition and lack of enough capital; but now does not regret the move she took. She has been successful because of loans and the fact that she does not spend on rent and buying food. Her dream is to become a wholesaler and supplier of matooke so that she could earn much more. She needs a loan to help widen her capital base and ensure the stable running of the business to enable her pay school fees come next term.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Samya

texts.en:
Samya is married with three children. She appears in the photo with her husband and twin daughters.

Samya and her husband work at their pottery business: he works on pottery, making vases and coloring them, while she helps him by selling them in the market. They have small shop in the market.

Samaya and her husband need this loan to buy raw materials to make new products and designs. Samya has been with FATEN for a few years and she has taken four loans starting with 200 USD. She has repaid all her loans in full and on time.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make new products and designs

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
N. Ruth is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is a friendly and hard working lady with a bar business that she has been running for over 5 years. In the bar she sells beer, sodas, wine, spirits and local brew to her customers and such a variety enables her to earn a gross weekly income of 80,000/=.

From her profits, she has been able to acquire pigs and, at the moment, she has 4 in number, though this keeps on increasing and reducing due to buying and reselling and producing all the time. She has also been able to buy and own household items and pay her children’s school fees with much ease compared to before the loans.

loans.use: Buying more drinks like beer, sodas, and local brew for increased stock.

loans.name: Carroll

texts.en:
Carroll is the founder and owner of Shule Vista Academy, an educational daycare center that focuses on caring for girls between the ages of 3 and 5. As a mother of three, Caroll cares deeply about the impact that enriching early education has on personal and academic development. When she was laid off a year ago, she saw an opportunity to combine her passion with her need for employment to start a school. Self-employment also allowed Caroll the flexibility to care for her own children. 

Shule Vista Academy offers a wide range of classes including music, art, yoga, dance, and self esteem building exercises.  A $5,000 loan will allow Carroll to purchase educational supplies, playground equipment, and plant an organic garden.

Carroll is earning her masters degree in education and hopes to hire additional employees and turn Shule Vista Academy into a fully independent school providing education for girls from K-5th grade.

loans.use: Educational supplies and materials

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie L. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, is married, and has nine adult children.

Charlie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Charlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Charlie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ivie

texts.en:
"My business became successful thru the help of the loan  I got from CEV. I became a stock holder here in our Barangay. I have a complete stocks of assorted groceries which I also sell in my sari-sari store", says Ivie C. , a mother of two children whose eldest is now 12 years old, from Sto. Nino South Cotabato Mindanao.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase assorted groceries to sell.

It was February 2008 that she decided to joined the CEVI credit program, she likes the services offered by CEVI because they are also bringing education to the communities aside from loans that they offer.

loans.use: Purchase assorted growceries for her business

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex M. joined CEVI in October 2007. He is pleased with the CEVI program because it offers a valuable service of loans with only 2% interest per month which he believes is good and acceptable. Alex is a farmer, and rice is his main crop. His wife Josephine M. also helps him.  They have been married since 2001. He utilizes all his harvest to buy the things they need in their home like food, clothing, and the education of his eldest child who is now 6 years old.  He is asking Community Economic Ventures Inc. for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 which he will use to pay the laborers who work on his farm.

loans.use: To finance his farm.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie A. is from the village of Inroad in the municipality of Aurora, which is located in the Zamboanga del Sur province of the Philippines. She is 54 years old and married with 9 adult children. To make a living, Rosemarie raises crops, primarily corn. Rosemarie has been in this business for over 35 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she used to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Rosemarie is requesting her fourth GDMPC loan, for 10,000 PHP, to purchase fertilizers.

About GDMPC:  GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishmongers, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Hel

texts.en: Since 1979 this family has supporting itself by farming and doing handicraft along the riverfront of the Mekong River in the urban area of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Hel M. is a 52-year-old mother of six children, one who is married while the other five are single and live with her.  She is married to Prum Cel, age 72, who has been her life partner and who runs the family farm which was descended through his family. Recently, M. has decided to buy another plot of farmland located next door because she wants to increase her husband's income.  Her income is primarily from the handicrafts.  M. requests a loan to buy the land as well as fertilizer for the farm. She really wants her children finish their schooling. Her husband was not available during the photograph for he has gone to the field.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes A. is a 57-year-old mother of six children, with the eldest age 33 years old. Mercedes started with one sow in 2007 and after some months it produced 8 piglets for fattening. Her daughter also bought a half-hectare rice field but due to the pest attack they only got a net income of PHP 18,000. 

Mercedes is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to help finance the needs of her piggery like buying feed and constructing a barn.

She joined CEVI last October 2007. She likes CEVI because she believes they offer nice services, a small interest rate, insurance and savings.

loans.use: To finance the needs of her piggery.

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Mrs. Thida D., age 27, is a widow with a young son.  She is pictured here with her mother, who she lives with along with her brother in Kosh Dach, which is located on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 

Thida has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old. She learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Thida’s brother also weaves silk at home.

Thida is requesting her first loan, in the amount of $300, to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
"My sari-sari store has an income of PHP 500-1000 daily and I have 2 piglets for fattening that cost PHP 1,800 per piglet", says Jenny P., a CEVI client from Sto Niño, South Cotabato.  Jenny has three children and her eldest will be 12 years old this year. She started a sari-sari store in 2005 and a piggery in 2007.

She is requesting a CEVI loan of PHP 8,000 which she will use to purchase assorted groceries and feeds. The loan will really help her get a good handle on the growing finances of her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries and pig feeds.

loans.name: Diezan

texts.en:
Diezan P. has a 1-hectare rice field and 1 carabao, a farm animal used by Filipinos in tilling the rice field. He has two children and his eldest child just turn 5 years old this year. His wife is Annie P. and they have been together since 2003. 

He is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from community economic ventures Inc. He will use the loan to finance her farm like fertilizers and other needs to grow his crop.

He joined CEVi since 2007. He likes CEVI services because it has the lowest interest rate of 2% per month. They also give insurance ocverge aside from the loans that he availed.

loans.use: farm financing

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mr. Mat E., age 40, and his wife, Mrs. Sarifas E., age 42, have been married since 1986 and have one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mat and his wife have been selling recycled materials for four years. They travE. by their own motorbike to buy discarded household materials from villagers and return to sell the items to a wholesaler in their village.  But, the motorbike was breaking down very often so Mat decided to sell it and he is requesting a loan of $400 to add to his profit from selling the motorbike to purchase a second-hand one.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Hel

texts.en:
S., 33, with her life partner Morn, 35 (shown in the picture), has been operating a business since 2000. Their marriage has resulted in seven children who are still young and attend school. S. has a skill of making local kitchen accessories by hand with bamboo and Morn has a skill of decorating wood for building. After a while, she could earn much more and her husband could also make a better living. 

The family wants to earn more income by operating another line of work, farming, with their savings. So S. and Morn decided to take a loan of 1,300,000.00 Riel (Khmer currency) to buy a plot of farmland located next to her house. She dreams of having a bigger house and a degree for her children. S. was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland located next to her house

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
"Because of my loans from CEVI, I now have 4 pigs for fattening and 1 hectare rice field." says Virgie S., a farmer and mother of four children whose eldest child is now 18 years old and studying in high school. 

Virgie is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. which she joined in October 2007. She will use the loan to buy needed fertilizers and chemicals to grow her crops, and feed to grow her pigs. She chose CEVI because of its good services and low interest rate. "The policy is good and it is a Christian organization. I like the biblical reflection they have every meeting", she said.

loans.use: farm financing

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Chamroeun H., age 22, is single and lives with his widower father in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He has one brother and four sisters. 

Chamroeun has been a lathe operator for 2 years. It’s a skill he learned from his father. He doesn’t have his own transportation and spends a lot of money for traveling cost, so he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
"My sari-sari store income averagely reaches upto 400 to 700 per day while my Cassava plantation, incomed Php 84,000  a month. I have been doing these for 2 years already. These what I use to provide the needs of my family", says Elna G., 52 year old 

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to purchase purchase fertilizers and chemicals to grow her crop.

She joined CEVI last March 2008. She said " CEVI services is very helpful for us farmers especially that they are only asking the lowest interest rate of 2% a month".

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Yousos

texts.en:
Mr. Yousos M., age 37, is shown in the picture with his wife, Mrs. Mary You, age 36.  They were married in 2000 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Yousos has been a fisherman since he was young, a skill he learned from his parents. He fishes from the Mekong River and sells to the wholesaler in his village. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. 

He is applying for a loan of $600 to purchase a dragging machine and fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a dragging machine and fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
"At this time, I have a cassava plantation, 2 cows, and 1 sow with 5 piglets for fattening' says Edna M., a farmer and a mother of two children whose eldest child is 26 years old and already working. Her first marriage wasn't successful but through the years that she has been doing agricultural work she has found a new love.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to finance her businesses.  She likes the CEVI services because, aside from the loans, they also provide insurance and low interest rates to all their clients.

loans.use: To finance hog raising and farming.

loans.name: Georgie

texts.en:
"I own 3/4 hectare rice field as inheritance from my husband parents. My husband and I have saved enough money to buy another 3/4 hectare to plant mango and lansones. From our income we bought one cow, then it became two, and now we have plenty of cows and carabaos as well", says Georgie G., a farmer and mother of one child who turns 20 this year.

However, she needs additional capital to run her business. That is why she is applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. hoping that she will be able to sustain her livelihood.   She joined the CEVI credit program in October 2007and is pleased with the low 2% per month interest rate.

loans.use: To help finance her farm.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
"My business are Buy & sell and Hog raising. It help me to be able to get by in providing the needs of my family" says Jose Archie Blasico, 32-year old farmer and a father of four children. As afather he wanted to provide all his Kids a good education. He is happy now that atleast his eldest child, now 10 years old and will soon graduate in elementary. 

Now, he is applying a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. he will use his loan to finanace his buy and sell business. He sells clothes and he is earning from this business.

"Last October 2007 I joined CEVI. I like CEV services especially the policy being implemented in our cluster.Thanks to God our Cluster never encounter problems in terms of payment". He said.

loans.use: To finance buy and sell business

loans.name: Sivet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivet E., age 60, is a widow with two children, one son and one daughter. The first child is a garment worker still living at home, and the second child is married and lives outside the family home. Her sister and elderly mother also live with her. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sivet E. is pictured here on the left, with her sister. 

Mrs. Sivet E. has been a farmer since she was young.  She grows rice and vegetables.  Additionally, she has created another job cutting grass to sell for cow feed. She is requesting a loan of $200 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To use for growing rice.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana H. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old and married with 4 adult children. Luciana has earned a living by doing traditional mining known locally as "pamiling" for over 4 years and earns about 5,000 PHP each month.

Luciana joined HSPFI in 2008 to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is now requesting her third loan, in the amount of 11,000 PHP, to purchase mining materials.

About HSPFI:  HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase mining materials.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
"My business are buy & sell and Hog raising. It is helpful to sustain the needs of my family ", says Rolando H., 57 years old father of four children. His eldest child is turning 24 this year. He is a bit worried because his child's school expenses is growing.

He is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to purchase additional stocks for his sari-sari store business. And because he runs a piggery as well, he will save the rest to buy feed to grow pigs.

CEVI helps him manage his business efficiently. CEVI teaches their clients about savings. They also provide insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for his sari sari store business

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie B. is a 52-year-old mother of four children ages from 17 to 24 years old. Her husband is a farmer and has been a paid farm laborer in most of his life. From being a plain housewife, Reggie emerged as a business partner of her husband in farming business when she joined ASHI in 2005 where she was able to make a loan. Business started small covering small area of farm land. After making several loans from ASHI Reggie and her husband can finance wide area of rice farm and can harvest rice of up to 500 sacks every cropping (four to five months). In a year, Reggie can finance two cropping however, she wanted to make bigger amount of loan to enhance further her business and to purchase equipments and machines needed thus avoiding renting from other people.

Reggie is not only dreaming about the success of her business. Most of all, she dreamed about all of her children graduating from college. Through her profits, she could make this happen. Presently three of her children are in college and one in high school. Reggie hoped that through her loan she will be able to make her business successful and her children. By then, she will be happier and contented about her life as mother a business partner of her husband and as wife for she had performed her productive role very well.

loans.use: The farm inputs such as rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides she needs to purchase for her rice planting business.

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Абдумавлон мужчина, который кредитуется в организации шестой год. Его бизнеса- это продажа в розницу говяжьего мяса и баранины.Абдумавлон в начале своей кредитной деятельности был просто продавцом, но получив первый кредит  он купил одну корову и в розницу продал её мясо за хорошую прибыль. Абдумавлон на сегодняшний день имеет большой товарооборот, и у него много постоянных клиентов. Он благодарит всех инвесторов за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Abdumavlon has been a regular microfinance client for six years. He sells beef and lamb. He started his business as a seller but having received his first loan, he bought a cow and sold the meat at a profit. Today Abdumavlon has good cashflow and many regular clients. He thanks all investors for support and understanding.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to sell meat

loans.name: Мавлюда

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мавлюда женщина , которая торгует на рынке "Паншанбе" города Худжанда. Она продаёт печенья разных видов и наименований, местного производства и российского производства.Получив займ Мавлюда хочет пополнить свой товарооборот несколько видами конфет и сахаром рафинад.

loans.use: на увеличение продктовых товаров

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia is a 70-year-old widow. She lives together with her extended family, including her daughter's child, her aunt, and her youngest child. Anesia has been the breadwinner of her family since her husband died. Three years ago, she joined ASHI to take a loan to capitalize her business. At her age, she still wants to be productive and help her children, grandchildren and other relatives get out of poverty as much as she can. She started first with a variety store. With her subsequent loans, she was able to raise pigs and sell them after four months. Return on this kind of business is double the amount of her capital. With this profit and another loan, she was able to venture into financing farmers who grow rice. During harvest, the farmers she financed will give her a certain amount of rice depending on their price agreement. Rice paid to her will be sold in her variety store. Profits from these ventures have enabled her to pay her weekly payment to ASHI on time and maintain her business.

Now Anesia wants to take a bigger loan to enhance her business more. Although she is a new businesswoman, she has seen her profit and productivity grow, and so she is seeking more capital to achieve her dreams for her business and family.

Out of her profits, Anesia wishes someday to ensure her family's security by buying a lot and moving with them to a place that isn't always flooding.

loans.use: To finance rice production, start a hog raising business, and sustain a variety store

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
"Before, we didn't have the materials for making coconut wine, but now we have materials since we joined CEVI," says Catalina D., a winemaker and mother of 4 children. Her eldest child is 26 years old and now helps with the business.

She needs additional capital to run her coconut winemaking business. The loan will be used to buy more tuba, a raw material from coconut that is used to make good wine.

Catalina joined CEVI in 2008 and she said that it helped her business and her family a lot, and that the process is really not complicated compared to another MFI she was in before.

loans.use: To buy tuba for making coconut wine.

loans.name: Faraja

texts.en:
Faraja is a member of the Dodoma In Kihesa,Iringa,she is35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 15,13,9 years.
