 Faraja started her own clothing business selling used clothes 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 90,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is fajara`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Faraja hopes to save more money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Azamchon

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Аъзамчон, мужчина торгует на Афганбазаре 1001 мелочами. Товар он закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. Спрос на его товар большой из за качества товаров. Период кредитование он увеличил товарооборот и прибыль своей семье.Он планирует на запрашиваемый займ закупить мелкий товар  для быта.
texts.en:
Azamchon A. is a man who sells a thousand and one items on the Afganbazar market. He buys the merchandise on the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan. The demand for the goods is high because of the quality of the items. During his credit history he has increased turnover and profit for his family. He plans to use the loan to buy small items for the household.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batteries, hairclips, hair color.

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella A. has been a CEVI client since 2003 and is a 50-year-old mother of four children. The eldest is 30 years old and married. She has been a fish vendor since 1984 and fish is the "bread and butter" for their family. Her husband died because of an illness, now she is alone managing her business to earn income for her own need.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 to buy fish to sell. She is thankful to God and CEVI for helping her solve their financial problems in their family.

CEVI helps her sustain her livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie B. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Marjorie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marjorie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Marjorie has operated this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that can help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marjorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. Marjorie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be put towards expanding the business. This will be Marjorie's 4th loan from HSPFI. With these additional funds, she plans to improve upon and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia M. is a 38-year-old tobacco planter and mother of five children, the eldest being 18 years old. She marrried a farmer, Veronico M., Sr.. Tobacco is their main crop which they also sell in their town.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and tobacco seedlings to grow her business.

CEVI has helped her because aside from having the lowest interest rate of 2% a month, they also provide their clients with insurance coverage and leadership training.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and tobacco seedlings

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina L. owns a small sari-sari store business. She is 52 years old and has nine children. She married a farmer, Partimio L.. Aside from selling goods, the family also grows vegetables to supplement their income. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell.

Now, she actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings which are done weekly and governed by rural wives. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virginia L. is 46 years old mother of seven children. She started having a business since 2003. Her capital was just Php 5,000 but she manage to run her business and sustain it for a long time.

She would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from community Economic Ventures Inc. She thinks of buying dreid fish, fruits and other merchndise to sell in her stall situated in the public market.

She likes the services of CEVI so much because aside from it gives a very small interest rate of 2% a month, it also provides trainings and nsurance ocverage to its clients.

loans.use: To finance fish business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Dodoma in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman,she is separated from her husband and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 7 and 1 years,she also cares for other 4 dependents.

Elizabeth started her own business selling local beer  1 year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 95,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Elizabeth`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for local beer.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Elizabeth hopes to save more money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Турсунова Гулчехра, женщина торгует продуктами питание около дома. Товар она закупает на оптовом рынке Афганбазар. Так же она на дому шьет платье на заказ. За  период кредитования она увеличила товарооборот и повысила уровень жизни. На запрашиваемый займ Гулчехра в сезон заготовки варенья на зиму хочет закупить сахара.
texts.en:
Gulchehra T. is a woman who sells food near her house. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Afganbazar. She also sews custom dresses at home. During her credit history she has increased turnover and improved her quality of life. Gulchehra wants to use the loan to buy sugar for the winter as now is the season for preparing jams.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Franziska

texts.en:
Franziska is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa,she is 23 years old woman,she is married and she cares for one dependents.

Franziska started her own food business selling fruits  2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Franziska`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Franziska hopes to save money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Gunjinlham

texts.en:
Gunjinlkham B. is a 33 year old shoe repairer living with her husband and three sons in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. The oldest two sons currently attend secondary school and the youngest is in kindergarten. Gunjinlkham started the shoe repair business with her father in 1998 with an investment of 20 USD. Through years of profits and savings, she now has an available working capital of nearly 1,000 USD.

Since the business is her main source of income, her biggest priority is providing shoe repair of the highest quality. As she currently rents her workplace, her main goal in the future is to own her own workplace. This will protect her from sudden price increases in rent. She is requesting a loan to be used for purchasing shoe repair materials.

loans.use: For purchasing shoe repair materials.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru: Махмудова Нури , женщина торгует 1001 мелочами на Панчшанбе базаре. Товар она закупает на оптовом рынке Афганбазар.  В период кредитования она увеличила свой товарооборот и улучшила финансовое положении семьи. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить полиэтиленовые пакеты и благодарит инвесторов за поддержку.
texts.en:
M. Nuri is a woman who sells one thousand and one things on the Panschabe market. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Afganbazar. She has increased her turnover during her credit history and improved the financial situation of her family. She wants to use the loan to buy plastic bags and is thanking all the lenders for their support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bags

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Mgodi in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married.

Ester started her own food business selling fruits 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Ester`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in oder to buy more fruits for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Ester hopes to save more money ans expand her business

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 40 years old. Merlyn is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and other varieties of products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Odgerel B. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 8-year-old daughter in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her husband, who is a carpenter, started a carpentry business in 2006 by purchasing tools costing 480,000 MNT. In their business, her husband does the carpentry work while she paints the products. Because of their high quality and design, the products made by Odgerel and her husband are highly demanded in the local area, and they travel throughout the province to sell their products. They are requesting a loan to purchase pine timbers in order to make more durable and high quality products. This will help them accomplish their two main goals of improving their brand name and growing their business.

loans.use: To purchase pine timbers

loans.name: George Kimani

texts.en:
George is 35-years-old, married and with two children. His wife Lucy assists him in the baking business. He lives in Uthiru where he supplies the cakes to the small traders in shops.

He was introduced to KADET by a neighbor who is a client. George has never borrowed from other sources, this will be his second loan with KADET. He paid off his first loan well without any difficulty. He wants to use the finance from this loan to buy a water tank to stock water for his family and also for use in his business.

George hopes and plans to establish his bakery business by adding more equipment to bake and pack his products. He desires to diversify in to baking bread in addition to the cakes.
He also desires to start a clothing business.

loans.use: George plans to buy a water tank because there is water shortage at his home area.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie D. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old. Rosemarie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Letisya

texts.en:
Letisya is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in kinayanambo,Iringa.she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 11,7,years.

Letisya started her own shop business selling sugar,what,rice 2 years ago.she works 10hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Letisya`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to buy more commodities like rice.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Letisya hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more commodities like sugar,wheat

loans.name: Saboatjon

texts.ru: Ахмедова Сабоатчон, женщина 1967 года  рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Муж Сабоат водитель маршрутного такси. Она занимается пошивом женской и мужской одежды на дому и ПО «Навбахор» города Худжанда. Так же у неё много учеников, которых она учить шитью.  У Сабоат сейчас много заказов на летную одежду, поэтому она  планирует закупить летную ткань на пошив женских платьев и мужских сорочек. Она благодарна кредитором за поддержку её деятельности.
texts.en:
Saboatjon A. was born in 1967 and is married with three children. Her husband is employed as a minibus driver. Saboat is a seamstress and works on men's and women's clothing from home and for the Navbakhor company in Khujand, Tajikistan. She also has several students whom she is teaching to sew. Currently, Saboat has many orders for summer clothing, so she plans to purchase lightweight fabric for dresses and men's shirts. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old. Girlie is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Girlie owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Girlie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Girlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Girlie is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Girlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is managing a general store business located in the Public Market of Santiago City. She is married to Ernie, who is also a vendor of fruits in the market.  Grace patiently maintains the business and is used to cope with the busy market place of the City. Her two children Ayamie and Armie are her inspirations in managing well her general store. Her children are now both attending elementary school and Grace hopes to sustain her business for their future college education. 

Grace is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP20, 000 as additional business capital to expand her store and someday could able to develop it as a grocery store. She will utilize the amount in purchasing merchandises such as soft drinks, soaps, noodles, kitchen goods, and all items that she could sell immediately to rotate her capital further. She believes that patience is the key to success thus, she is really doing her best towards the development of her business.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Hilderh Akinyi

texts.en:
Hilderh O. is a 45-year-old industrious lady married to Mr. O., a retiree. They have four children aged 24, 23, 20 and 16 years old. She has been in the tailoring business for 17 years, assisted by an employee. 

Hilderh had tried securing a bank loan but that was futile since the only tangible asset she had was her sewing machine, which was not acceptable within the banking circles. She learned about KADET Ltd through World Vision, the mother organization, from whom one of her children had accessed aid for school fees. This is her third loan from KADET Ltd. 

She hopes to use the money to increase her stock of materials and purchase another sewing machine in readiness for the fast approaching peak season. She aspires to open a wholesale shop and employ some more people to increase the scale of her business.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and more material

loans.name: Everline Juma

texts.en:
Everline O., a 36-year-old lady is married and the mother of three children ages 14, 13 and 9 years. She runs a posho mill in Kibos, a low cost residential area in the outskirts of Kisumu City. Everline has been in this business for the past year and the income has enabled her to educate her children and uplift her living standards. 

She learned about KADET through a neighbor who is an existing client. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. Everline hopes to use the money to purchase a stock of cereals which are commonly consumed by her clients so that they can buy from her and get the milling services simultaneously. This will save her clients time since they will not have to travel to the market to buy the cereals and grains, especially during this time when the country is facing a shortage of cereals due to rain shortages.

She aspires to develop a plot of land that she has purchased and open other business outlets.

loans.use: To buy cereals and grains to give her a competitive edge in her milling business

loans.name: Byamba-Ochir

texts.en: Byamba-Ochir D. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and 20-year-old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His son is currently attending college. Byamba-Ochir started a mobile grocery business in 2005 with the help of his wife. He travels in his car to countryside areas, where quality grocery stores are lacking, and sells grocery items to people who are unable to travel to the province capital.  He would like to use this loan to expand the number of products he sells as the demand for more diverse food items in his area is increasing. However, his and his wife's ultimate goal is to make sure their son receives a good education and becomes a good person.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 44 years old and manages a simple mini-restaurant and jewelry business in the public market of Santiago City. She is married to Roland and they have four children. Her eldest is already married while three are still studying. The couple is doing their best to improve their eatery business in order to earn an income for the education of their three children.

Divina dreams of further improving their eatery business and making it into a big restaurant. That’s why Divina and her husband were motivated to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 17,000 as additional capital. She also wants to maintain the quality of food they serve to attract more customers and get bigger income.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Baldorj

texts.en:
BALDORJ D. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His oldest daughter is a college student; the youngest is 6 months old, and the rest currently attend school.

Baldorj has been running a dairy products business since 2005. He buys goods at the the local market XACU and also directly from herders in the countryside. His younger brother owns a stall in the capital city's largest wholesale food market and helps him sell the goods. When he started in 2005 his working capital was 250,000 MNT, and it has now increased to nearly 2,000,000 MNT. He is requesting a loan to further increase his available working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Gladys Ambiyo

texts.en:
Gladys S. is 44 years old and married to Emmanuel Owacho who is a social worker. Together they have five children. Her business is located at PAG Church on the Likuyani road in Eldoret Town. She has been in the retail business for the past two years now.

Gladys was introduced to KADET Limited by a group member. She has applied for a loan which she intends to use to restock her retail shop with one bag of sugar, two bags of rice, cooking fat and detergents. In future she intends to diversify to wholesale and increase her sales to one hundred thousand (100000/=).

This will enable her to support her family by providing the basic needs and educate her three dependents.

loans.use: To restock her retail business

loans.name: Huruma

texts.en:
Huruma is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group,In Kinyanambo ,Iringa.She is 46 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children,Her children are aged 18,15,8,4 years.

Huruma started her own shop business selling  rice,wheat,sugar 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Huruma first`s loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to buy more rice,wheat,cooking oil.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Huruma hopes to get more food for family,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
BOLDBAATAR D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He has three sons, two of whom are university students; the youngest is in kindergarten. He has run a taxi business since 2006 and has gained much experience in the last three years.

During this time, his business has been quite successful, as Boldbaatar has increased his working capital from 250,000 to 1,000,000 MNT. He must operate the business as well as pay his sons' tuition fees from his profit and savings. He is requesting a loan in order to increase his available working capital and purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: purchase  spare parts for his car

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in KInyanambo,Iringa,she is 35 years old,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is 2 years aged.

Zaina started her own business selling local beer 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 60,000Tanzania shillings.

This is Zaina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more Maize for local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Zaina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah N. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His son currently attends secondary school and his daughter is in kindergarten. He has owned and operated  a clothing shop with his wife since 1990.  Their family lives together in their own khashaa, a Mongolian traditional house. 

Galbadrah started his business with an investment of 300,000 tugrugs and after years of profits and savings has a current working capital of nearly 1,000,000 tugrugs. He also has a positive relationship with Xac Bank (Kiva's partner MFI in Mongolia) as a result of his timely repayment of previous loans.  His future goal is to start a mobile trade business and provide service to countryside residents.  He always asks for God's help to  increase his profits,  and he is requesting a loan to use to increase his working capital and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's apparel for his business

loans.name: Edward Musidia

texts.en:
Edward M. is 40 years old, married to Violet Muyuka, and they have three children. His metal shop is located in Likuyani centre in Eldoret Town. He has been in this metal business for the past seven years now.

Edward was introduced to KADET by a friend who had information about KADET. With the loan he is taking, he intends to buy more materials like metal sheets and related items for welding into windows and doors.

In future he intends to enlarge the workshop, employ other staff, and open up more branches. This will enable him to educate his children and provide basic needs and parental care to his family.

loans.use: To buy more metal sheets and related meterials for his welding workshop

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
At the age of 71, Norma is not yet retiring from her role being a mother to her three children and a wife to her husband. In fact, the role she plays is now broad for she is also a backbone for her grandchildren wherein she helps her children send their children to school. This is the reason why Norma has to make the rest of her lives productive by growing a business to be inherited by her children and grandchildren in the future. 

For the fulfillment of her dream, Norma thought of having a business capital to start with. She joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2008 and made a loan. She bought piglets for her hog fattening (pig raising) business then. Profit she had with this kind of business is every after four months. Piglets she bought amounting to Php1,700-Php2,500 when sold after four months will cost Php6,000 each. 

After several loans Norma made in ASHI, she has able to finance her husband and son's business which is planting of rice. With her family supporting her and her businesses, Norma has able to keep her good performance in terms of payment, attendance in center meetings of and business. These have made her qualified to make bigger amount of loans to ASHI. Norma takes the opportunity making bigger amount of loan because she wanted her businesses to grow and for her children to have their own source of income through her.

loans.use: Finance her farming business and to be used in buying necessary farm inputs.

loans.name: Soronzonbold

texts.en:
Soronzonbold D. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His children currently attend a local  secondary school.  He has operated a raw wool trade business since 2001.  He started the business with an investment of 200,000 MNT and after years of profits and savings has current working capital of 700,000 MNT. <{>

He buys raw wool from local herders in the countryside and the central market in the province capital and then sells it in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Thanks to the success of his business, he has a good market share.  He recently bought some livestock for breeding purposes, but his main  goal is to start a vegetable-growing business. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital for the new business.

loans.use: To purchase raw wool

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 22,20,18,15,12 years.

Judith started her own Tailoring business 3 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Judith`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more material for her business.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Judith hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel D. lives with his family in the province Arkhangai. He and his wife have 4 children. 3 of them go to school. He started his business in 2003, selling clothes in the market stand. Altangerel goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, once or twice every month to purchase men's and women's apparel at cheaper prices. His business is running successfully and  his working capital has increased from a start-up capital of 300,000 to 3,000,000 tugrigs. 

As a result of his successful business, they could afford to build a house and buy a truck. In the future, they want to expand their business by producing construction blocks. He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 to purchase more types of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more types of clothing

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a member of the ikweta borrower,in kinyanambo,Iringa.She is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 4 and 2 years.

Frida started her own food business selling bites 2 years ago.she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Frida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000Tsh in order to buy more rice,cooking oil.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Frida`s hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,cooking oil

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg Dayanjalvuu is a cell phone merchant who lives with her parents in the province of Arkhangai. She started the business in 2005. She was able to increase her working capital by 1.5 times due to her sustainable and profitable business. Her family's living condition have improved as a result of her success.

As well as selling cellphones for cash, she took a proactive approach to reach people who don't have cash readily by offering her products through bank loan. In the future, she wants to expand her business and open a grocery store. Altantsetseg is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT to purchase cellphones from UB and Beijing.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of drinks in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a member of the Ikweta borrower group In Kinyanambo,Iringa.She is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child aged is 15 years.

Sophia started her own food business selling tomatoes,onions,potatoes 2 years ago,She works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sophia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,potatoes.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of that loan Sophia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura S. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin. Laura is married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Laura owns and operates a retail stall in the market. The main source of income for the business comes  from selling a variety of products like dried fish, a variety of spices, vinegar, soy sauce and others. Laura is just starting this business.

Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Laura is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for her stall. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her stall

loans.name: Batrentsen

texts.en:
Batrentsen S. is a 35-year-old man who lives with his wife and two daughters in the central part of Mongolia, in the province of Arkhangai.  He started his business in 2005 with 800,000 (~$555) tugrugs. He buys clothes in Ereen, a Chinese border city, and sells them at a market stand. The business is growing sustainably and his working capital is now 1,500,000 (~$1040) tugrugs. 

With his business profits, he bought a traditional small house with a yard. In addition to his market stand and he is doing a mobile trade. Therefore, he is planning to buy a car for the business in the future. His ultimate goal is to help his children to get a better education. He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 ($1525) tugrugs to bring more and different types of clothes from Ereen.

loans.use: To purchase more types of apparel

loans.name: Imoh

texts.en: Imoh sells drinks. She has been in the business for the past 5 years. Imoh is 36 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Imoh is requesting for the loan of N100, 000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is an entrepreneur from Kamenka. She sells groceries in the local city market. Liana started her business seven years ago with the help and encouragement of her family. She has gained much needed experience working in this sphere of trade. Liana has about 25,000 Grivnyas (roughly $US3000) in turnover capital. Her monthly profit is about 3,000-5,000 Grivnyas.

Liana is seeking a loan of 12,836 Grivnyas to buy and install plastic rolling doors at her kiosk. She has a hard time opening heavy metal shutters of her small vending facility every morning and decided to substitute them with lighter plastic ones. One of her short-term business plans is to plan her kiosk to store merchandise better and install a good quality door to secure stored inventory.

Liana is very outgoing. She is known for her kind heart and willingness to help those who are in need. She has a son and grandkids who bring much joy into her life.

loans.use: To buy plastic rolling doors for her vending kiosk and re-stock her merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Damdinsuren

texts.en: Damdinsuren T. is a 40-year-old businessman who lives with his wife and two children on the plot of land that he owns in province of Arkhangai . His family lives in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian housing tent or "yurt." In the early 1990's, he started his shoe repair business with the help of his wife and only 20,000 MNT of startup capital. The business has been successful. Now his working capital has increased to 700,000. Because the business is being run in rented space, his goal is to have his own workplace.  He is working hard to help his daughter to get a good education. Damdinsuren is requesting a loan to purchase shoe repair material for his business.

loans.use: To purchase shoe repair material for his business

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is a single mom. She raises her 3-year-old son on her own. Oksana runs a small business in one of the central markets of Ivano-Frankivsk selling sports footwear, tees and sports outfits. She has been in the market for 15 years. Currently, her monthly profit is about 5,000 Grivnyas.

Oksana is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to purchase 80 pairs of sneakers and diversify the merchandise she offers for sale at her kiosk. Oksana enjoys her job even though she was hoping to specialize in a completely different sphere. Oksana is a professional vet and after school she was hoping to find a job in a vet clinic. However, she had no luck with that and decided to start her own small business. Oksana is very grateful to her friends who encouraged her to launch this small venture which has flourished and is helping Oksana meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase 80 pairs of sneakers.

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en:
Rejina is a member of the kinanambo borrower group In Kinyanambo,Iringa.She is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 16 and 14 years.

Rejina started her own shop business selling rice,cooking oil,wheat 2 years ago.she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Rejina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,wheat,cooking oli.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Rejina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,sugar,wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of hair products as well as service the facilities.

loans.name: Olexandra

texts.en:
Olexandra is single. She sells women’s pajamas, lingerie and t-shirts in the central market of Ivano-Frankivsk. Olexandra has a nice selection of good quality inventory at affordable prices which keeps her business sustainable. Even though she started her business only 1 year ago she is already making 6,000 Grivnyas in profit each month. 

Olexandra is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise, i.e. 50 pajamas and 50 tees. This business is the only source of income for her which is why Olexandra works hard to keep it running and stable. One of Olexandra’s dreams is to open a foster care home for orphans she works with in her free time.

loans.use: to purchase 50 pajamas and 50 t-shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Adetola

texts.en: Adetola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells textbooks and notebooks in her shop. Adetola learned her business in 2 years and she has been in the business for the past 7 years. She supplies books to schools when they are in section. Adetola has been borrowing from lapo for a year and the loan has expanded her business. She is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting for the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell. She says thank you to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells foodstuffs and she has been in the business for the past year. Florence lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 26 years old and married with eight children.

Florence hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya C. is a 43-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and three children in the province of Arkhangai. She started her used clothing business with 300,000 tugrugs of working capital.  Sarantuya now sells clothes that she buys in Ereen, a Chinese border city. Because of her experience and hard work, the business has been growing , allowing her to purchase home electronic appliances with her business profits. She is planning to repair her house in the near future.  

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 tugrugs to bring more and different types of clothes from Ereen. She said, “I want to expand my business by operating a grocery store."

loans.use: To purchase clothing apparel for her business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 25 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 10,4 years.

Zawadi started her own clothing business selling used clothes 6 years ago.she works 12 hours a day and earn motherly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Zawadi`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Zawadi hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 66 years old and lives with her farmer husband and seven-year-old grandson. The land in her village is mostly used for rice and vegetable production and Magdalena and her husband are one of the many couples who farm these as a business. The rice and vegetables they harvest are sold in the municipal market on market day and at other markets in other municipalities. This has been Magdalena's family's source of income for 34 years. In the past the business was on and off because of lack of finance and no available credit. It started to become more stable when Magdalena joined Kiva partner, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), and was able to take a loan. From then on, her business eventually grew and she started to dream for her grandchildren, especially the one who lives with her. 

Magdalena wants to take a larger loan from ASHI in order to sustain her business and enhance it further. She hopes that some day, out of her profits, she will be able to build a house made of stone so that her family will not bothered when typhoons come and strong winds hit the house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for rice and vegetable production

loans.name: Шарофат

texts.ru: Сулаймонова, женщина торгует на вещевом рынке Панчшанбе детскими товарами.После первого займа она увеличила товарооборот и привлекла еще больше клиентов. Товар она закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. В школьный сезон хочет закупить носки для мальчиков и колготки для девочек. Она благодарна Киве за поддержку ее бизнеса.

loans.use: На закупку носков и колготок.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 22 years old and married to an accountant in the Ministry of Finance, Government of Southern Sudan (GOSS). She has two children who attend School. She sells green vegetables at the market, and is requesting a loan in order to purchase beans and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a shop from which she could sell her produce.   

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana L. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 44 years old, and is married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Flaviana owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Flaviana has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Flaviana joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flaviana is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to build shelter for her livestock. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business and support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build shelter for her livestock
